OVERALL: I doused the entree in tabasco + ketchup + sriracha... so... make what you will of that. It was pretty pricey too. Probably won't be returning.

FVPk2YC8q7bic3CtZiWbwg.review_text: First off, the decor of this place is awesome!!! It really makes for an enjoyable experience.  On top of that, the drinks are great, and the food is average to good. I've been for brunch and dinner, though prefer the brunch/lunch options. Their "big ass burger" ($11) really is big... I could only eat half, though there's great topping combos like mushrooms and avocado (and bacon, if you're a fan). They also have a "small ass burger" ($9) which doesn't have the fancier toppings but is a more manageable portion. If you're vegetarian, I'd stick with one of the veggie scrambles rather than the veggie sandwich (mozzarella, tomato, avocado, red onions, balsamic... on a kinda stale baguette - or at least ask for the baguette toasted).   Big bonus: their Bloody Mary is definitely above par, and only $5!

hZRQvFmlsPJ7v8Da4WiUWQ.review_text: When we come to this place for breakfast im usually hungover. I like this place because we always find free parking and we rarely wait more than five minutes to be seated. I usually get the eggs benedict though they are nothing to rave about. Coffee hits the spot and service moves along at a good pace. On our visits, they've had live music so thats a plus. You'll find a mix a people/families here which makes it that much more comfortable. Oddly, Tabasco seems to be scarce here. I feel much better when I leave so 3.5 stars for that!  * Free Wi-Fi *Brunch Drink Specials: $3 Mimosas & $5 Bloody Mary Pints Brunch served Saturday & Sunday 10:00am-3:00pm

coEX0WGa92jJZ0Wgn1WRMg.review_text: Brickhouse was suggested for a quick catch up.  Kind of a deceivingly small place for how big it looks on the outside.    Seated at a booth, I was thinking this was gonna be one of those best kept secret type places but everything was just okay for me...service, food...nothing special, but nothing bad.  Good hamburgers, garlic fries, and beer.  I can see how this might be a place to come for pre-game bites and drinks, (...or another friendly catch up) but I'm not sure I would come here on my own otherwise.

nD2U9xPKdty_VOYGloz_BA.review_text: This place always feels like home. I especially love the salmon (which is caught by owner Fred). There's sometimes a bit of wait from the time you put in an order but at least there's usually some live music to help pass the time.

tvuGWTCPKe4fu5NOMTxGlQ.review_text: We stopped in the other day for some takeout burgers. I got the three cheese burger and was very happy with it. The fries and burger were both really good and cooked as I asked (medium). I'll probably go one notch more cooked next time and see if I can get a little more char on there. (Monsieur Maillaird FTW).  If you're in a hurry, watch out for the lunch rush. The line can be pretty long and it takes a while to make your food after you've ordered.

IprKHet03baoU8heBOYuwQ.review_text: Not bad, but not amazeballs = 3.5  PARKING = it exists! There's parking on the street as well as the streets adjacent to it. Also walkable distance from the MUNI.  THE WAIT = none! Came around 12:15 on a rainy Sunday and had no wait.  THE FOOD = Corn beef hash: 3.5 stars. I've had better, not salty enough. We substituted the garlic fries for the potatoes (might cost a bit more but worth it). Garlic fries are delicious !  Vanilla bean French Texas toast: 3.75 stars: mine came with a burnt piece but overall it was yummy. The vanilla bean whipped cream/butter was very delicious and addicting  Mimosas are only $3 each!!  Atmosphere is rustic and hipster, loved the hanging tricycle.  Service was very good and attentive

HXLtUj52n24xOHZyXBaTmQ.review_text: OK, quick rundown of why this place is awesome:  High-quality ingredients Creative dishes Strict attention to detail Fair prices Great ambiance Good service Self-serve water Full bar Huge plasma TV Great selection of coffee High-quality tables and seating  The first time I came here, I was blown away, and ready to run back to my laptop and give it 5 stars. The inside of the restaurant is very well-done; there's a nice pale yellow/burgundy/dark wood color theme going on, plus there's a tree in the middle of the dining room that adds a nice (tropical?) touch. They have a full bar with a huge plasma screen, a wide and well-priced selection of coffee drinks, an unbelievable upstairs with what looks like designer furniture, and all the people who work there seem helpful and personable.  I usually spend a good five minutes pouring over the menu ANYWHERE before making a decision on what to get. However, I was sold on this place after reading the first item on the menu: a hot sandwich with grilled chicken breast, melted brie, red onions, pesto many and crisp apple on toasted focaccia. I figured that if they have thought about a sandwich that delicious, they will love sandwiches enough to craft it perfectly...and they did. The chicken was juicy and flavorful, the cheese was melted perfectly, the bread was toasted just right...the flavors of each ingredient mingled perfectly, and it was then (or maybe it was after they brought me a free sample of tiramisu smoothie) that I knew I would have a long, meaningful relationship with Brickhouse Cafe.  The second time I went, I wasn't as wowed, but that's not to say it was a bad meal (it definitely was not). They had a meatball sandwich special,  which turned out to be good but not great (granted, I set the bar pretty high for this place after my first visit); I thought the sandwich itself was too small, as well as the amount and the size of the meatballs. Additionally, the marinara sauce was good and well-spiced but not out-of-this-world like the sandwich I had the time before. I got the fries this time instead of the side salad, and they are (here comes my token phrase!) fundamentally sound; they're a good size, just like you'd expect at a proper restaurant. But if you don't want to pony up the extra dollar for the fries, they include a side salad with lettuce and bell peppers, which is a healthy little extra to round out your meal.  Now one thing I haven't gotten to are the burgers. The fact that they tell you to allow 20 minutes for it was a sign that I need to try it (in reality, it's about 8-10 minutes, but they say 20 just to be safe). Also, quick note, you can phone in your order, but they assume it's a to-go order unless you tell them otherwise. I was going to go with the classic burger, but I stepped it up and went for the SOMA burger, which has melted swiss, grilled onions, grilled mushrooms and avocado. Simply put, it was a very good burger. High-quality beef (though I thought it was a bit too pink for ordering it medium), perfectly melted cheese, and a heaping pile of mushrooms and onions. However, I will say that I thought they could have put more avocado. The burger is a bit expensive at $12.32 with tax, but it's definitely, definitely worth trying.

IO4UN5G6pawMCoj9gUdlKA.review_text: We found this place by chance, and the three of us came here to eat for dinner.   Was inviting and ended up to be a cute, comfy place.  Here is what we had:    1). PRIME Top Sirloin Steak rare....was as tender as can be, a very generous portion, juicy and cooked to perfection. It was served with garlic mashed potatoes and snow peas.  2) Kobe burger med rare. Excellent burger, the best I've had in a long while. Served with fries which were cooked a light golden color and not greasy! Very good!  3.  Swiss, mushroom burger. Very good! Served with fries.  4.  Caeser Salad and wedge salads were also very good.  5.  The Beer Batter Onion Rings were fantastic and such a huge portion!  6.  The Napa Cabernet and the Argentine Malbec on the Happy Hour menu @$5.00 - both wines were very smooth and decent.  Service was good. A little pricey, but well worth it, and the portions are very generous. We were stuffed when we were finished with our meals. We would definitely come back again, glad we found this place and would highly recommend this restaurant.;o) :0) :O)

kqbk9c4jvvPduSbqNt2d3g.review_text: I've been here twice and have enjoyed both thoroughly. I prefer brunch and will absolutely be back. The ambiance is my favorite part.  Nice spot right before a giants day game. Shhh- don't make it too crowded though!

wI795B7EQTjkSL1eiYpMhw.review_text: you know what's great about america? we can blame anyone for anything. so i'm going to blame my lunch at the brickhouse on the economy. because if the economy was in better shape, i wouldn't need to entertain the notion of taking jobs that are below my pay rate and level of experience. and if i did not need to entertain such professional prospects, i wouldn't have been in the vicinity of the brickhouse for lunch today. but it (the economy) is, so i was (near the brickhouse). and my potential new bosses wanted to have lunch there so, since they were paying for my lunch (again: damn you economy or maybe they would have foot the bill for someplace better), i had no choice but to eat lunch at the brickhouse. that's the way i see it.  but i'm trying to be good about the gluten and the dairy and general health, see. and that would have meant a salad but everyone was bragging on the burgers so i order a burger with no bun. only mistake i made that i can't blame on the economy is that what i actually ordered was a turkey burger. because it's healthier they say. so i'll blame that on fat cows.   anyway, what i got was a pre-packaged patty of semi-raw turkey meat. i wish i were kidding. they served me a turkey burger extra rare. and with the economy being as it is, i couldn't just spit the food out on the plate and gross out/embarrass/insult my potential new employers. other tactics were required for the situation. first, i tried pretending i was mistaken on the first bite and had another. when that failed to yield the desirable alteration of reality, i next tried sticking to the outside rim of the burger, which was mostly cooked. but watching everyone else eat their lunch finally got the better of me and i flagged down a server to explain the situation as calmly as i could whilst wondering how long it would take for the food poisoning to arrive. she apologized, took the remains of my burger back, and brought out a new one for me. yay! and the grill marks were not just darker, but criss-crossed on this one! double-yay!! it was piping hot! triple yay!!! and then i had a bite. it was rubbery and gross and quite the furthest thing i've had from a good turkey burger in a very long while.   stupid economy. there really is no such thing as a free lunch.

GKtmqMWjTSkiU1bmMmR7Gw.review_text: Brunch here is pretty decent. My girlfriend and I just shared a french toast and an egg florentine, both was really good.

eXM67alQxlrA_hMCQ3S0qQ.review_text: 4 stars for dinners and weekend brunches 3 stars for lunches  this is why...  Lunches- If you don't go at the right time, you usually get stuck in a long line and although they are pretty efficient, it can still take you a while to get your food. The last lunch experience that stood out in my mind was when I wanted to get soup. I ordered a cup of soup to go thinking I wouldn't have to wait too long for it.  But since they went by the order number (which mixed in the to go orders and sit in orders), it took a good 15 mins to get my soup.  Food wise though...their sandwiches are yummy and hearty.    Brunches-  Always good service and the food doesn't take that long to come to the table.  I usually get the Western scramble or the corned beef hash.  Pretty large portions for $9-$10. I had the corned beef hash yesterday and I will have the rest of it today for my lunch ;). Oh and of course there's the $3 mimosas...gotta love that.  The burgers are also very tasty.  The patties have just the right amount of juiciness and they have a good variety of toppings/fixings.  The one recommendation is to avoid ordering the baked rigatoni and cheese appetizer on their dinner menu.  We ordered it once and it was on the watery side. Besides that, you can't really go wrong with their food.

GgCVGJJ4qKuNWmQ85XHdKg.review_text: I stopped in during Happy Hour one afternoon with my friend. He ordered the Wagyu burger, (priced between $14/15) cooked rare. When it arrived, it was difficult to  discern whether it was cooked beyond rare or if the meat was just discolored. We concluded that it was both and reordered. The second burger arrived RAW and STONE COLD! The meat was definitely discolored from age and inedible. Pretty disappointing. Fortunately, the waitress was understanding and comped us the burger on our bill. Other than that, it's a cute place with a nice atmosphere, and the bartender made a delicious Old Fashioned. Just don't order the most expensive burger on the menu!

nhMI5fxr9b-5YBUNp26Hyg.review_text: If you sell, for an extra $3, "100% pure maple syrup," what was that maple-syrupy-thing that you gave me with my pancakes? Seems like a weird way of admitting that you are giving me crap syrup. What else are you hiding? Seriously, only the facade of the "brickhouse" was brick.

saICjWgZghLL7FCnyhXS0Q.review_text: The very fact that I am wasting precious energy to write a review of this place is well sad, but I couldn't let a place with such shitty staff and horrible service go unnoticed.  If I could rate this place with NEGATIVE stars I would, don't waste any of your hard earned money, the wait staff apparently doesn't think much of your money, otherwise they would give a damn and treat paying customers with some respect...  You are better off hitting up the McDonalds on 3rd & Townsend then this place, at least there you will get some form of service.  This place SUCKS, period

sNRP3Vrt0OiBhbMp3ajw-w.review_text: I whole heartedly agree with the review, "a bit pretentious on occasion, like you should be happy that they are serving you..."  After giving them 3 chances to make a better impression on me, I've decided to not frequent  BrickHouse.  They've messed up my to-go orders on 3 occasions.  When I've called them my order in they haven't made it until I arrive, taking a good 40 minutes! And to BOOT they give a RUDE vibe - totally not the friendly SF restaurants I am used to.  There are soo many places in soma, this will be the last one I visit!

UUD_5WtCRSaM3uFTDxDHZg.review_text: If I could afford it, I would eat here everyday. Gourmet burgers, for my standards anyway. Amazing sandwiches, delicious iced tea. I could go on and on, my favorites are; The chicken brie sandwich, SoMa burger, and Pear salad. Dont forget the onion rings and cucumber infused water! YUM! -1 star for having to spend 15+ bucks for every meal.

uXybf-Hg0cpCHj8i7C2lIQ.review_text: This is a neat neighbourhood place to hang out. I passed by this place almost everyday. Was very drawn into the brick exterior and vintage interior, but never stepped in as I am not a beer or burger person. I made it finally last week. It was surprisingly great in all aspects. Love the happy hour menu. Pretty good cocktail selection... food was decent. I had fish taco. Service is awesome. The singers are nice and play light music. It's a great plus to a casual evening out.   I'm specially fond of the window corner table if I would go alone or with one close friend. Very cozy, you get to see every corner of a busy place but you still enjoy your little room and do your casual people watching down the street. I love the feeling.

2ZVl7FC76GUAP3LIGJhP5Q.review_text: Came in on a rainy evening upon finding out that Farmerbrown's Little Skillet had closed for the day. Did not Yelp. We literally walked around the area trying to decide on where to eat.   The waiters seemed busy when we first walked in. Eventually we were seated by the entrance...away from all the other patrons. It was quite a lonely dining experience.  I ordered the babyback ribs and fries. The ribs were dry and the meat did not fall off the bone whatsoever. As for the fries, they were thickly cut and very soft. Eh.  On the other hand, my friend ordered the kobe burger which she graciously let me try. It was nice and juicy. Should've ordered that, gah!  The bar area sounded very lively. Dining in the main area seemed pretty romantic with the lit tea lights...although I wouldn't know.   Onto more places to try!

SZftVsWQMdxF8_FVrp-QFQ.review_text: I like this place.  I go to a lot of Giants games, and this is my go to place prior to games for a quick bite to eat.  The plusses: Good food, and they take a fresh, green, organic stance on their ingredients. Well priced drinks Close to the park Has some Giants fans, but is not overrun by drunken knuckle heads like places like Mono's and 21st amendment Good happy our specials on food. They have a great Sunday brunch menu; the atmosphere is very relaxing and they have live music as well.  The minuses: Service can be spotty, especially on game days.  Leave yourself at least an hour before game time if you don't want to miss first pitch. On Wednesday - Friday game days, they have a reduced dinner menu with less options.  I would recommend keeping your order simple (sandwiches, burgers, etc) to avoid problems and to have a tasty meal.

m7ulbgBB7Z-0STPpBMiOuw.review_text: I've eaten here twice now, and the food is mediocre but the service is way worse.  The first time, the server seemed so out of it, I was pretty sure he was still high.  The second time, each server who waited on us was impatient, rude and acted like they were doing us a favor by taking our orders and serving us.    The food in itself is strictly mediocre as well.  The French toast is decent, but the mimosas are $3 for a reason.  The granola is drowned in milk and skimpy.

1d9E_VFmxvZL1VWldnEb3Q.review_text: One word; deliciousness! This place has awesome burgers! The burgers taste fresh, are yummy and huge! $12 can fill you up for a whole day! The fries were good, fresh. The service was good and friendly. The place is unique but comfortable. They also have upstairs seating. The only thing is that this place does get very busy during lunch. It can take up to 15 - 20 minutes to get your lunch. However, it is very much worth it. Everything on the menu sou

-z_QAVPlXYLlYiCzvhF4VQ.review_text: This used to be a neighborhood gem.  This was one of my top recommendations.  While pricey, I used to feel, you get what you pay for.  They're getting cheap, while charging more for everything. The not so tasty, but helpful gluten free bun has gone up a buck.  I'm sorry, but I can bring my own, not too mention better tasting gluten free bread for less than $3.  About the only thing to say is when I want to pay too much for a burger, this is the place to go.    $2 for onions and pico de gallo added on, making a meal that costs less than something else with major protein that adds way more than that.  Plus I'm not getting the bread.   Then I not just wanted the onions & cheese in the scramble, I needed the onions cooked.  It was just the Pico de Gallo to be on top, not everything.  I just paid $13 & change + tip for something not worth $7.  I didn't question the cost, because I'd also ordered a mocha which wasn't included. Also I miss the white velvet (white chocolate version of mocha).  Once I've specifically would have picked brickhouse for a minimum of the next five times, I'm eating somewhere else.  From the other reviews, I can see there's some general quality issues going on.  Plenty of other places that can get eggs right and I can pick up better pico de gallo for less, too.

N3joXEbEYn5ljRNqVpdHNA.review_text: Diet went to shizzz when I came back for happy hour on friday and couldnt resist the chicken brie sandwich I got last time. I managed to convince my group of 5 to all try it. The waitress was amazed and said she's never gotten a full table requesting the same sandwich, though it is her favorite sandwich as well. Sandwich was still delicious, but not as great as last time--maybe because they had to make 5 in one go, thus couldnt give as much attention to each sandwich.   Some updates on the sandwich: - The flavor of the onion was more present this time around - The brie got a little lost (not as big) =\ - Side of salad MUCH bigger than the to-go.  Got to dine in this time. The waitress was very friendly. We sat in the nook by the door, so it was a bit chilly, but it had a nice ambiance and it felt very homely sitting by the four panel window with a table lamp and a tulip. The place wasnt packed, which is nice if you're looking for a happy hour place without fighting with people's elbows. A live band came in around 7p, but it wasnt loud enough to disrupt our conversations or have to talk over it.  This was a perfect place to catch our with our friend who was visiting--it had a nice balance of chill and beer-loving fun.

TZatgTt9RyYGlBa7uZTgBg.review_text: The ambiance here is casual and there was a live guitarist playing some bossa nova type tunes, which was really nice.  However, the food is simply not good. We got the crab melt sandwich and the corned beef hash for brunch. The crab melt was cold and I just couldn't bring myself to eat more than a bite, and the corned beef hash had no flavor, it was oddly creamy, and it was kind of lukewarm too.  So sad.  The fries that came with the crab melt were good so I ate that as my brunch.

DHs8No90RxNP6EQHHNEZvg.review_text: This place had me at $3.00 mimosas. Was looking for something new and found this super cozy diamond in the rough. This is a must try on my list!   I ordered the southwest scramble- I'd recommend adding sour cream and avocado. Another visit favorite was the corn beef and hash. We also tried the French toast- but the marscapone was not to my liking.  Each dish was around $10/$11.  Ill be back for more for sure! Decent prices, nice people, fast & slow service...? I would have ordered more mimosas if our server asked...  My recommendation- arrive thirsty!

QW3LIXu3xwKZ9LiDqf7a_g.review_text: I ordered their ravioli. I'm the fool for ordering a pasta dish. It was not ... (I hate to sound like a picky drama queen, but I'm being honest) not edible. I had a bite and I pushed my plate away.  I didn't return it bc my friend reached over and said, "I'll eat it. It's ooo-kayyy." He finished the entire dish. In his defense, he had just gotten back from the gym. He ordered chicken pot pie which wasn't half bad. First impressions are important, but it definitely doesn't define a relationship so maybe I'll come back. Fingers crossed it's better the second time around!

A3Ra1zq46baasuuQtV1DLw.review_text: Came here on a Wednesday night after happy hour to grab a late dinner. It was 15 minutes before closing and the staff was cool to let us sit down for a meal. The big ass burger was great. Spend the extra money to upgrade to garlic fries. It is worth it. The French onion soup was a generous heaping bowl. And the hot bread was one of the best which was crunchy on the outside and warm inside to melt the special butter they served on the side.

YgXXxNqi1fs8igXQbfEETQ.review_text: I started working in the area and in general, the restaurants suck. So when I got my lunch here, I was actually surprised how decent it was.  I got the Hawaiian Burger with fries. Although the fries were not the freshest, they were the best I've had in the area so far. The best fries...are at McDonalds.  My burger was cooked to specification (medium), was juicy, fresh and it came with NO onions as I requested.  Service was much faster than I anticipated judging from the line. The staff was friendly, got a couple of smiles and even my plate cleared.  I'll be back...

0G9BcXSQscv_GnhlNwFfjw.review_text: On the night of our arrival we basically went straight from the airport to our friend's gallery opening, and pretty much the sole purpose of our quick visit. Because we hadn't eaten all day and were in for a late night, our friend sent us a block away to get some dinner at the Brickhouse Café & Saloon. It was a small, unassuming place with some great live jazz playing when we walked in. The place had maybe 25-30 seats max, plus some at the bar and I believe an upstairs area which I didn't get to check out. They had a great cocktail menu and a decent selection of beers. Their menu is stocked with tons of food, but what surprised me was their huge burger selection. Most places I go to these days, even burger specialty restaurants, don't have as many pre-made selections as this place did. Quite a nice surprise for a last-minute dinner!  I went with my go-to mushroom and swiss burger to have something fairly neutral but still provide me with an idea of what these guys could do. The buttery bun looked smaller than the meat, but ended up being proportioned quite well in the long run. The patty had great beefy flavor with a small amount of char, and was cooked perfectly. The mushroom chunks didn't stand out even though they were quite large, and the cheese was nicely melted but also didn't have too strong a flavor. Unfortunately the fries were only so-so, and I wished they were a bit more to compliment this strong burger. Overall it was juicy, wet and great. I don't think you can go wrong here with many of their options; the prices were good, the drinks were great, and the live music was a treat.

goZ-kSTFH5Ujpf54GwbaRw.review_text: What place has a violinist playing during brunch? A pretty amazing one at that... Uhh..Brickhouse.   I love the comfort of Brickhouse. Along with its trivia question of the day and burgers with names of different iconic San Francisco neighborhoods or significance, it's an idyllic place for food and groups of people, even kids :)  There are hit or misses on their menu, but for the most part their sandwiches and corn beef hash are pretty darn good. Eggs benedict is so-so, but their coffee is excellent and is high on the caffeine level.

BwTPj8XS_iqdSTLPBVMs1w.review_text: BF and I went here twice for brunch. You seat yourself when you arrive and are pretty quick to bring you water and take your order. They have a solid menu here. Both breakfast and lunch items are great. Blueberry pancakes for the BF and a "small ass burger" for me. Perfect in size, shape and taste. If you like spicy try the bloody mary. Packed full of delishness but oh so spicy!!!

aUMXnlJmofj6jpZFipAV6Q.review_text: Service was excellent. Food was good. I had the chicken wings, nothing extraordinary. My date had the fish tacos and hated them. But our server took them back with no problems.

jbA_xJu3eoogZI4x0B42_g.review_text: I work across the street from this place so I'm forced to come here all the time, and that might be why I hate it so much. My Issues:   1. Food - the burgers are good but not great. The vegetarian food here SUCKS. Their "handmade" veggie burger tastes like a stale morningstar burger which is so dry it will give you cotton mouth.   2. Bad Service - they also screw up my order more often than not (seriously, I started keeping track a while ago and they have a 58% screw up rate). I have often been kept waiting for 20-30 minutes - and not even at peak lunch times, but after the crowd has left.   3. Cleanliness - last but not least: on multiple occasions I've seen several different cashiers display blatant disregard for basic hygiene standards. On one occasion a sick cashier who looked like death coughed all over some poor guys order. On another occasion, they had my order ready but didn't know it was mine, so it just sat on the counter for 10 minutes. When I asked about my order, they were confused, and realized that the order sitting on the counter was mine. First a cook, and then a couple of minutes later after I asked again, a cashier - they both opened the to-go box and pushed down on the sandwich with their bare fingers to see if it was still hot. Then the cashier gave it to me - obviously it wasn't warm, so I asked for a new one- and she just said sorry and shrugged. Obviously they take the food here very seriously.   4. Price - horrible value, and in the evenings they cook even crappier food under the guise of being a sit-down gastropub and charge twice as much for it. As for the salmon that the owner proudly procured himself on his annual Alaska trip - I'd much rather have store bought salmon which was flavored properly.   Bottom line: good if you want a mediocre (at best) and likely unsanitary lunch.

4eR6hYFJcBHoAqhuOS07ww.review_text: Came here to watch the Giants win the World Series (!!) and it's got the typical bar food. Nothing memorable except the ribs! The ribs were SO GOOD. Like shockingly good. I would come back just to have the ribs. They were that good. Everything else, meh.

tZ6UTquj55ULeqKjckOsug.review_text: This place is poppin' for lunch time. It has it's typical San Francisco feel with it's rustic interior and chalk board menu.  If you're feeling like sandwiches and burgers (they have soup and salad too) then this is a great place to go to. The inside is really small, so unless you're not in a time constraint for lunch I suggest going elsewhere. Food takes a while to come out. You just take a seat and they give you a little number and they bring you your food.   I was craving burger and fries and so obviously the "little ass burger" sounded perfect. It was a basic burger with lettuce, tomato, red onions and a pickle. The other specialized burgers looked really good too. The fries are nice and crisp, nothing spectacular though. The last time I had the apple chicken brie sandwich which I really liked. The apple gives it a nice crunch. I want to try their tomato bisque and sandwich combo next time.  Prices are ok, I've seen a variety of stuff from the yelp photos that I don't see on the menu...so I suppose there are separate breakfast, lunch and dinner menus? Decent place like the rest of SoMa.

47jYU6CunkW--4S9vYqyYg.review_text: Food here is terrific!  Drink special each night.  I think my margarita was only $5 - tasty!  I've had their burgers, various sandwiches, and tonight, the penne pasta which was fantastic.  Good beer selection.  They even have MaCallan's 12 year!  OMG their polenta is seriously to die for...calamari & onion rings were also fantastic.  I love the indoor/outdoor look and very clean bathrooms.  Awesome, little SOMA joint that I often look over, but really should revisit more often.

LPkXc94_xyRN09d8sXSR7Q.review_text: I love this place. It's become my go to neighborhood brunch place. Weekend parking around this place is pretty easy, unless there's a giant game.   I've gone a handful of times for brunch, if you go early about 10-11am there's usually absolutely no wait, if you go around late brunch time you'll have to wait about 10-15 minutes for a table. They have a second seating area upstairs that they open up when it gets really busy.  My favorite brunch dish of all time are eggs benedict ($10-12). I love the benedict here, you should try both the regular, salmon and florentine versions. THEY DO NOT DISAPPOINT. Ok I lie, the only thing that disappoints me is when I realize my plate is empty and I want more and I'm on the verge of licking the last of the deliciously smooth (not too sour) holindaise sauce up. What makes the benedict different is that they serve it on a thick house made bread instead of english muffins. The florentine version loads you up on a whole pile of spinach, the regular has delicious not too salty canadian bacon and the salmon version is caught by the owner according to the menu. They serve it with their delicious breakfast potatoes! nom!   Also - did I mention $3 mimosas? Endless refills on your coffee and tea? yup.

esG5ZnOJHkWSZCZxJAnH0Q.review_text: This place is barnyard chic... Love! From the brocade wallpaper backdrop at the bar to the hanging cowboy hats & tricycle in the air.... It's all so visually stimulating and surprisingly.. Not tacky, I know.. I know.. but trust me when I say that it all blends very well together! Now the food... I asked our waiter for his recommendation, and he said "You can't go wrong with the chicken Brie sandwich".... and wrong it did go :-/ The chicken was dryer than jerky. While the idea of Brie and apples sounded interesting in theory... they were kind of an odd pair with the pesto thrown in the mix.... The side salad... was also dry. I'm going to take a wild guess here and attribute that to the MISSING SALAD DRESSING... On the brighter side, the garlic fries were just perfect and my friend had no complaints about his "big ass burger". As for their bloody Marys  - they're a bit too strong for my tolerance. But if you like your acohol strong, then you will be very pleased with this cocktail.

sOqWGX6L2jEjatCokssNEA.review_text: Great lunch spot I found by accident.  Great burgers. Friendly staff. Clean and welcoming. A great SOMA find.

muPKUHFQnK5_G55k48Avkw.review_text: The Brickhouse is definitely radsauce. Despite a funky layout, it's a great cafe in a cool old brick and timber building. They have a full bar with some good beers on tap and some decent wines.   The staff is quirky and uber-friendly. It's a great place to grab a sammich and a beer with friends or hideout in the upstairs with a book. I wish I was in this area more often.

Zv7LkQXYvkk9be7cpRXWpQ.review_text: Lastnight came here with a party of 8, the atmosphere was great and everything was going well until our waiter Justin started to develope an attitude. A friend of mine order a cocktail and ended up not enjoying it as much as she though she would. She wanted to possible change it for a diffrent one and he replies to her "I cant keep making drinks". Now iam no expert on serving but i do know a thing or two about it. I know for sure thats no way to respond to a customer thats spending their hard earned money to get good food and great service! I rate the resturant and their food a good 3 1/2 but the service gets a big 0! Maybe you guys should think about getting more staff or hiring friendly people that dont have a problem dealing with big groups. By the way we were about the only people there besides the party that was happening upstairs, in which he wasn't even helping serve.

gBCKyJl4lEQZJc6WWEFvNw.review_text: Meh.   I agree with other yelpers, the staff is rude.  My lunch companion's plate was pretty much dropped at our table.  Dropped in that "I hate my job, here is your goddam food" kinda way.  When I asked for extra BBQ sauce the woman looked at me like I was crazy.  The BBQ sauce sucks, by the way.  It's a sad day when the best thing on your plate is french fries.

YaYFETkXJRwG5XvzE541FQ.review_text: Best burger around with super friendly staff and reasonable pries. Love!

iTgOsDkUmpOBwR4X8sKpAw.review_text: Had their corn beef brisket on rye with a side salad and it was amazing. Side salad was simple and matched evenly with the sandwich.

Nc8kVGwETsaWhYn1lgMbKw.review_text: Came here after a little beer garden event in SF. It was a great little spot to rendezvous because we just wanted some snack food and some (more) beers. They had a special on the menu for happy hour that was 11 bucks for a pitcher of beer...WINNING!! However.. when we told the waitress we wanted the happy hour deal she said that they actually changed it and that it was the regular 18 dollar price...(we wanted a very tasty stout). Well, as you can imagine, we were a little peeved because the menu said otherwise. We shared our feelings about this with the waitress, and they honored the 11 dollar price. I really respected this because any good business owner would change that price on the ACTUAL menu... So I gave them a full 5 stars for this. We were a group of 8 so they really ate some cost on our 2 pitchers of beer.. but I will always remember how gracious they were for doing that.   And now for some info you were really looking for... good food, friendly staff, pretty clean, nice bathrooms, and in a great location. Just go here...you won't be disappointed!!

_vv5SIsWpZJ3NZ-jPDq5Ew.review_text: Unique place to get some grub. They specialize in burgers, sandwiches, and salads. Seems to be a cool lunch joint and very popular to grab a drink after work or the ball game.  Finally made it here for lunch and ordered the soma burger (avocado, grilled onions,swiss) and the Hawaiian (pineapple, ham, lettuce, pickles). Fries came with each order and almost forgot about our salted caramel milk shake!  We were disappointed with the patty. It should have been seasoned a bit more, it just tasted like it was missing something. Don't get me wrong the presentation, size portion, and the flavors of the other ingredients was on spot but it tasted a little bland. The salted caramel milk shake was vanilla ice cream mixed with caramel from a squeeze bottle. I guess I was hoping for something like bi-rite's salted caramel in milk shake form, doesn't that sound sick? For $31.00 there are other burger joints that I rather chow down on.

FVRGHTS_1T1pNtJO-mc02A.review_text: Have tried this conveniently located SOMA pub/cafe several times, and while the talented trio of musicians that play weekend evenings are enjoyable, the food is barely palatable...even by lowly bar food standards. Horribly bland, wholly forgettable, and usually served lukewarm. Of the half dozen dishes we've tried over three visits to BH (i.e., fish&chips, burgers, pastas) they all share one consistency: incredibly greasy. Blech.  Do yourself a favor and pop in for the music and maybe a beer--but eat elsewhere beforehand.

Rk-Tb9DNZArrCHdHtkfIHg.review_text: Brickhouse Cafe is one of my new places I like to go to for brunch or lunch. They have a variety of things to choose from on their menu. Plus they also have a great bar and cafe drinks as well. What's really unique about Brickhouse Cafe is the country vintage design theme and their live music early in the morning. I highly recommend ordering one of their omelets.   The only reason I give them 3 stars is due to the spacey service. In a restaurant environment that small there is no excuse for your waiter to  disappear for that long.

2DxpHK4nJh8iJnbSLJ8XCQ.review_text: Plans changed at the last minute (i.e., friend was too hungover from last night to hang) and it was late and I needed to satisfy my hunger pangs.  I live in the 'hood and have driven by this place a bunch and its gotten decent reviews here so I walked over.    The bartender was a bit surly at first (though I came to realize it was because they close at 10 and I walked in at 945 - though they had a large party upstairs and weren't closing anytime soon - and asked me to repeat my drink order and then forgot to ask how i wanted my burger cooked) but warmed up and ended up being pretty cool and chatty.    They close at 10 on Fridays and Saturdays - it was empty when I left but I guess its more of a neighborhood restaurant than bar.  Big menu with lots of stuff!  Long list of winter drinks - I would have had one if they were open later.  Bourbon with apple cider...yum!  The food was OK.  The jalepeno crab drip was a bit bland.  Granted, I'm from the home of the The Wire and use to blue grab, but I still think that this was a bit bland.  I got the Waygu burger blue moon style.  Again, a bit bland - had to ask for extra buffalo sauce to spice it up (though while I admit I love condiments, it needed more than the wipe of buffalo sauce on the bun).  But the food was hot when it came out and the server seemed nice.    Certainly would not bring out of towners here to show off our gorgeous city, but if you are looking for a big variety of things to eat locally and OK food, not a bad choice.   Wonder how my friend is doing...  P.S. Saw a new Audi A6 with all LED lights on the walk back home...wow.

UNbRVJql-hopPSuvYmsDmQ.review_text: Eh! I don't know why people like it!

saEUjebfkgXQKzNuD_0Pfg.review_text: A go-to for quick lunch of grown-up comfort food.  Hell yes, I want a grilled brie sandwich with tomato bisque and side salad.   Now, if only the atmosphere matched the quality of their food.

MawKHfnns-XPW0y8-9AWkQ.review_text: Veggie melt: Amazing.    I wish they had a little more seating - we had to wander around a little and wrangle a couple chairs at the main table in the middle, but otherwise, I loved it.  The wait wasn't long at all like some others said, and we went smack dab in the middle of the lunch hour.  I wouldn't try to come with a group since the seating is a little awkward for more than 2 or 3 people trying to sit together.  My office also go takeout from there once and they did a really good job dealing with 15 orders.

GwsCRGQnzOZkKfRcT2wGvw.review_text: Came to brick house looking for a good burger but left unsatisfied. The burger meat was a little dry when I had ordered it to be cooked medium. And the toppings and acutramal were so minimal that it didn't add any flavor or interest.   I do however recommend their milkshakes and fries but because the burger was so bland compared to other places. They even got our order mixed up with another table so we ended up with different burgers than what we ordered.

qcqjzBi2pzWzCnc5crDiyQ.review_text: Love this place! Burgers for dinner are great, or check out the brunch specials on Saturday and Sunday. $3 mimosas and $5 bloody marys!  Had the steak and eggs for brunch - not bad.  Personally I love the Blue Moon Burger - buffalo sauce w/melted blue cheese!  Can't wait to go back to try the vanilla bean pancakes!

VuU81aYTjVOENXFUhUkllQ.review_text: Yellow tail sandwich was amazing! Food was fast.the people were friendly and I loved the whole look of the place. Very relaxing.  Can't wait to go back

xZeUqDmZDYatMyFzvFSFLQ.review_text: This is one of my favorite lunch spots in this area (SOMA). I've been here numerous times in the past, but I came here recently with some co-workers for a team lunch in late January.   Great selections on the menu. Good food and service definitely! I'd rate this place 4 stars! I usually tend to lean towards on the healthy side when it comes to ordering. I ordered their Asian Sesame Salad w/ grilled chicken. So yummy and delish! I'd definitely come back to this place when the opportunity comes along and try their other things....

ZoXCBHIgkDq2v3xWJO9JIg.review_text: Well definitely don't listen to the posted hours, both online an on the door.  I went at 8:30am this morning and, though there were staff inside, they were not open nor would anyone acknowledge me at the door.  FAIL!

uJfIFcquIAkzo4QZ9tRJTw.review_text: Been going by this place for seven months, finally decide to give it a try to lunch.  Hot Pastrami on Rye with side salad for under ten bucks..... 3.5 stars maybe 4. Sirly, unhelpful attitude of mislabeled 'waitstaff'..... 1 star  This is basically a serve yourself restaurant... it would an improvement if we could actually enter the kitchen and get our food rather than have to wait on the servers to deliver or NOT deliver it to your waiting hands.  I give the sandwich I had 3 stars but the service or lack of any a 1 star so we are on it as 2 stars.

rWlDLUjarpm7VqUbm-IWjg.review_text: This place is a nice, cozy place to have lunch. We got some burgers and garlic fries, tried the tomato bisque soup, and a lot of Happy Hour drinks. Everything was delicious! The burgers were well presented and came in huge portions. Cooked to order was done perfectly. Service was awesome and I like the upstairs seating that allows you to see the view of the streets. Great first experience and I'll be coming back.  I absolutely loved the book our bill came in that allowed us to write a little note in it that we were there and when or whatever note we wanted to leave behind. Nice touch.

qtDZl8bg3QMeuWEPKb4owg.review_text: Salmon scramble was soooo yummy and the fish is wild caught by the owner. Heart!!! $5 bloody Marys also get a 5 star review

h5SOcFFMqkJKUEHd-K7UjA.review_text: The burgers and sandwiches here are solid! The mushroom burger is delicious.  Pretty crowded around lunchtime, but I've always managed to find a space to eat with a friend, sometimes in the upstairs area.

cI1mPY4Y6mtYq3yb_x8acw.review_text: Are you kidding me? This place is awesome!! Okay, fine. Only because I would come here during my lunch break to pick up my fave item - Tuna Melt sandwich- and I always leave happy knowing I am going to dig into my lunch and have a satisfying meal.  On the real though, during lunch hour this place is packed! The line is super long so make sure you get familiar with the menus that are hanging. I'm not sure if they are hand written (but it looks like) but it's pretty cool. I haven't had much experience with the other menus but everything looks good. Next time I come to SF again I will swing by this place. Take a risk if you want to get your own seat because it's a first come first seat basis. You should probably try to avoid the weekday lunch hours since that is their busiest time.  Other than that, please do enjoy their menu. I know I did and I always recommend this place. If your work is not that far, go ahead and walk to this place. Order up, eat if you can get a seat, then walk off those calories back to your office.  Happy eating!!

C469FeAyiATdaNmgXjZYWQ.review_text: Walked around with a friend after a workout looking for a bite. The friendly rustic decor drew us in, and we got a booth on the side. Running down the middle is a raised common table with stools -- a good spot to catch the game with a friend.  The bar looks to be Southwestern themed, with buffalo buffalo buffalo skulls lining the walls and pieces of brick with museum tags on the walls, presumably of some geographic, historic, or fictional importance (although I did no musing, out of respect for my company).  I got a nice 8oz Wagyu burger ($18) with swiss cheese, lettuce, tomatoes, and a pickle inside, cooked medium. The sweet potato fries were good but looked a little sad -- on the other hand, my compañero's onion fries looked and smelled delicious! Never doubt your first instincts, either on Scantron or burger menus.  I had two rounds of the California hef (note to self: stick to the Germans next time) to top off the meal. All in all, I had a good conversation over good food.  Total bill per person came out to 35 with tip, but if you get a regular burger ($10 to 12) You're probably looking at something closer to $25 -- not bad for beer and burgers.

_n7tQCMMAFkY3wTwKWqRnw.review_text: So we decided to have dinner here when our attempt to go to Little Skillet was foiled. It's was closed. We had dinner on the later side here (around 8:45PM).   The place has a western theme was pretty cool. The live jazzy music would have been nice but it was so loud for the space. I felt like a was at a rock concert.   The food can be described as bland at best. I had the smoked seafood salad. The portion size was good but the salad dressing was tasteless. I could have made a better salad dressing at home. My bf ordered the salmon ravioli off the menu only to be told that they didn't have it. They actually had lobster & crab. No big deal. He went with that. Portion size for the ravioli was pretty small but it did come with a side of garlic bread. Also when we sat down, we were given 4 meager slices of bread. And meager is a very generous description. From reading the other reviews, it might be better to come here for brunch or to order simple stuff like the burgers.   We had a super spunky and nice waitress.  While we like her, we had to ask several times for more bread and it took a while to for the food to come out.

MDQHCmuIB6WF01aqExEfXw.review_text: I'm about this place. It seems like burgers are all fluff nowadays. Build your own burger, add so and so toppings blah blah blah. Oh, here's your tab.... $22 burger, have a nice day! Fuck that shit. For $11 bucks, I got a one inch thick patty of medium rare beef goodness between the perfect compliment of bun. Burgers don't need to be sloppy dripping in 10 ingredients covered in garlic mayo to taste good. Wendy had the tuna melt and that was pretty epic as well. It's a bit pricey, but it's SOMA and I also just payed $3.50 for one hour of parking right outside, so relax. I'll be back for sure.

RjfNwq0LDp-DiOQ2VX1-nQ.review_text: Such a fan of this restaurant. It turns from fun, packed, sports bar like lunch place to ritzy, quiet, intimate dinner restaurant. Great food so you really can't go wrong. I'd say they could use a little help on their drinks, but still satisfactory.   It gets PACKED at lunch, so be aware if you choose to face the crowds.  Regardless, gets 4 stars for great food at a decent price.

IrN8TKnbtflUz1MjJ3Mhmg.review_text: Got the sons burger, fries and a brownie. They did not have Dr. Pepper just in case you were wondering. The brownie was good and the burger was good. Went during the busy lunch rush and it was a little slow.

g3HFkZgloxLQCvoJ5Zs5gg.review_text: Not bad at all for lunch...food is definitely copacetic. Busy and cute SOMA outfit, right across the street from Farmberbrowns Little Skillet. Line up to order/pay for your grub.  Extensive lunch menu....sandwiches were okay, and there are always specials of the day. My French dip did the trick. Portions are def enuf to stuff for the mid-day! Salad was very fresh, with lots of toppings. Soup was also average. Upstairs area....best wishes with the parking situation.  Perfect spot for a stop-off before the Steins Collect at MOMA.

DTWtZJAIPMrZJwUJV0DJmQ.review_text: Shatangi has a new lunch staple. Brickhouse (or crackhouse as some call it) has some of the tastiest soups, salads, sammies and entrees in town.  My fave must be the pulled pork sandwich.  They take to boring out of comfort food.  Great for lunch in or to go.  Staff is friendly and quick!  Shatangi told you...

sQgQRJTGkMSvmSI8Okd-WA.review_text: Excellent food and wonderful ambiance. The furniture was comfortable and the music was great. Highly recommended.

p7GcbNJav26_VnZKvW5tHw.review_text: Came here on a Friday night around 7 pm and man does it get busy! This is a really different kind of place and is not what I expected for the location and what it looks like on the outside. It's somewhat near the industrial district, which is generally grimy/dark/cold... but the inside of this place is the complete opposite!  Warmly lit, cosy feeling, rustic atmosphere. This place is great on the inside! When we got there, there was a three man blues band playing, which really adds to the feel of the place.   Though the place was crowded and we had seven people in our group, since we had made a reservation, we were seated immediately upstairs (highly recommended) and away from the din below.   The waiter (Chris, I think his name was) was super friendly and accommodating. One of our friends was a bit (like a lot) *ahem* inebriated... And kept knocking over drinks, throwing things on the floor... A bit embarrassing since this place seemed really nice, but the waiter took everything in stride and good humor, cleaning up every spill, bringing more drinks and food, etc.  The food was okay. Nothing quite blow me away kind of thing, but not bad. I ordered the seafood salad... which wasn't great. Other people got burgers and seemed to enjoy them... so I guess it was okay. The drinks were alright but definitely not memorable. They get a star for service (incredibly accommodating), star for atmosphere (super cosy), and a star for the entertainment... other than that... food and drink are probably a pass for me. It's a bit expensive for not being that great.

_j2mtXo6LUbuProl7Cod7Q.review_text: When anyone asks me if I know where a good burger joint is I always mention Brickhouse. I've only been there once but my dinner was exceptional, not to mention huge. I got a burger that was piled high with garlic mushrooms and brie cheese. It melted in my mouth and dribbled all over my hands. It was deinitely on the pricey side of burgers, but for the taste and size im willing to let it go.

FuPsBiugKkjHWEtG72bKfg.review_text: Came in and was surprised at how small the restaurant seemed. They also had an interesting set up. There were seats around a central island bar. Also the tables were really close together. I had a party of just my bf and I and our table for two was extremely too close to another table for two. Too close for comfort. I felt like I was also having brunch with these people. But I guess the restaurant has a map for how to seat their guests. They're obviously not going to seat two people at a table for four. Also, be careful about their order for seating people. I was sitting right by the door and next to the stand where the host stands. I watched as a couple was extremely upset when a couple that came after them was seated first and had a nicer table.   Anyways, my bf and I ordered corn beef hash and a salmon Benedict. I asked for English muffins and scrambled eggs. My meal was pretty decent. Everything was cooked well! My bf's dish eggs Benedict was on a focaccia bread instead of an English muffin! Never saw that before. His Benedict was also very tasty. I didn't enjoy the smoked salmon that much. I thought it was a little too salty for me but my bf enjoyed his dish. Each of our dishes were very filling.   Overall service was pretty decent, although our waitress never came back to refill our waters. Maybe we were at a disadvantage because we were sitting at the very front of the restaurant. I liked that they did not seem to rush us out of the restaurant. They didn't bring our bill out until we had asked for it.   Would love to try this place again, but maybe not during brunch time for it may be a long wait.

7W-K0_0hLnkYx-2gUbKdig.review_text: If you come here, you will truly regret it. The inside looks "acceptable" for a typical San Francisco look. Ripped chairs is the new "new" There is no heart and soul put into this shitty food bleh You basically come home wanting to take a massive dump  Major detox is necessary for this shittery  Watch out for the brunette waitress. She's a feisty one.

YKgrNyT29bfbMKMvQnhxVQ.review_text: This place is awesome.  The food is good but what makes this place is the decor and the mixed drinks! I can't wait to come back to have a few more cocktails - there's a different special drink every day of the week for $5.  What a deal! Oh, and the live music & kind people is what will have you sticking around past dinner!

X8u30swWi-N58RjBHb8kiA.review_text: This place is okay at best, to be honest. I was excited to visit after reading all the stellar reviews, but I don't think it lived up to the hype. I had the Chicken brie sandwich with fries. I went in around 1. My fries were cold and it definitely was sitting out for awhile or something. The staff was friendly, so that's a bonus

aDRoV-LE36PhrOA0XSaGnQ.review_text: We went to this place for lunch with a group of co-workers and it was great. I ordered the Blue Cheese Burger and it was so awesome, the meat was almost one and half the size of the bun...and high quality. You walk up front and order your food, and it seemed like it took less than five minutes for my food to come.   This place also has a full bar...so for some after work excitement I am sure to come back and check it out!

CO82sC1pmHrRs_JXW96FAg.review_text: *sigh* Inattentive wait staff. Unimpressive food.  Yet, really lovely music. That was a nice touch, but I can play my own jazz music at home. Smoooooth jazz. And heat up pot stickers from Costco.   Really? Is there nowhere good to eat in SOMA. Please tell me there is a hidden gem within a reasonable walking distance of our house. That has dinner service.

r636kd302eGgDGuS-dR4bQ.review_text: Let's start off my saying that the patty on these badboys are ginormous.  I love a restaurant that knows what the customers want, and in the case of a burger house, BIG OL PATTIES.  And I must say they are quality patties.  Depending on the burger you get, your tastebuds will ignite with different flavors.    The first time I came here I tried the Mexican Burger.  Spicy Jalapeno beef patty? Check.  Jack cheese? Check.  PIco de gallo?  Check.  Avacados?  Check.  With all these ingredients the spicy jalapeno patty still manages to stand out.  Also, I asked for medium-rare...and I got medium-rare.  You'd think its a simple concept, but a ridiculous amount of restaurants do NOT know how to prepare meat at different stages.  I'm sure many fellow yelpers will empathize.    The fries were great, not AMAZING, but pretty great.  All in all, its a really great burger stop.  I prefer it 10x more than Burger Bar at union square.  Pair it with one of the bottles of German beer they have and thats a great lunch.  The ambience is small but cozy.  There is an upstairs that many don't know about so if you can't find seating, try your luck on the second level.  It gets a little crowded around lunch time but I think its worth the wait.  Eat on.

AV6n2IFxNHQ2lu7ZONOomw.review_text: Brickhouse cafe does not get enough credit. We come here frequently and just about every dish we've ever had from here was very good. They serve a great brunch selection as well as many burgers, sandwiches and lunch options.   The atmosphere is great with an old fashioned feel and the service is always quick and friendly. They even have a good bar selection in the back with a number of beers on tap.  My favorite dishes here are the pulled pork benedict, which is amazing, and the deep fried bacon. The smoked salmon benedict in the picture was very good as well. Their french toast and most of their burgers are all very satisfying.  At the end of the meal you get served your bill in a cute little drawing book which is unique and fun.   Definitely come here if you don't want to wait in the 1+ hour waits at the other trendy brunch spots.

MLbLKzGqDXhC9rf9VvMgCw.review_text: Excellent brunch spot with ample parking.  The burger was great and the live music is a great touch.  Menu is unique and tasty.  Service was quick and attentive.

GCuDiPUKYxhgFHP5LqJa2Q.review_text: Can't seem to find a place that opens around the area (Coco, Bacar...of course, we saw a few after we ordered!), so we decided to try this place.   Quaint.  Picked the table at the end of the staircase in front of the window - private and some sunlight!  The Happy Hour drink specials are taped onto the table...we are kicking back in an old wing chair.  Sign at the front says "Seat yourself - your server will be with you."  Right when I wonder if anyone will know we are hidden in the corner, the server came over to give us the menu.    After studying the menu, we decided we should try their burger and something in the breakfast menu.  We decided on the Carlito's Frittata and the mushroom burger.  I tried the Trumer Pils - it's from Berkeley and although light, it's not bad.  They also carry Wyder's Pear Cider - that was my 2nd drink w/ a splash of OJ (it's a poor man's "mimosa").    Back to the food - the burger wasn't bad BUT the fries are FANTASTIC!  Damn, it was SO perfectly crunchy on the outside...just yummy w/ the side of barbecue sauce we requested.  My frittata was not what I had expected - it was more like a semi-scrambled eggs w/ slices of tomatoes and a few fresh basils on top.  It's light, not bad - again, just not what I expected.  Our server was very nice and attentive and not over bearing.  Two unisex bathrooms - the one I used was large and very clean.  Cool place, interesting artwork and pictures on walls that are for sale.  Would come back for drinks.

uqC3ll6vCfqFalbWnPi-Qg.review_text: Nice beer prices.  Service is a bit mediocre but the food was pretty solid. Good spot to hit before/after a giants game.

_r35DixNRywNCIrP4FmptQ.review_text: Really perfect for what we were looking for.  Well made cocktails, tasty salads,  and gourmet burgers/meatballs.  Affordable comfort food in a cool space.  Love that you can actually park around there when it's not a game night.  Look forward to checking out their breakfast/brunch as well.

6ZpfGwq-raI2CmM69_aqng.review_text: I came here with the 50% off Scoutmob deal.  The place has a good interior, and friendly staff.  I had a fantastic grilled yellow tail tuna sandwich with garlic fries and my friend had the empanadas.  Both were quite delicious and I would happily return to this establishment.  I was really digging the garlic fries because they were VERY garlicky in a good and spicy way, I don't like that bland canned garlic that so many places use.  I want to be sweating garlic for days after I eat my garlic fries!!

1Vd4tcpfWOjkVMbwT-z9tw.review_text: Just sayin, if you are complaining about not being seated in the first 5 minutes you arrived, chances are you missed the big "PLEASE SEAT YOURSELF" sign right in front of the door.  Can't say if that's the case or no in the below reviews, but every time I've been here I've seen the sign and BLAMO!  I sat at a table.  It was like magic! :D  Food is pretty good, been here for breakfast, brunch, and dinnerish time.  I am always well fed and satisfied with my meal.  Hubbie's beer was nice and cold.  This last time we were there I tried a desert - I ordered the apple crisp (which is seasonal).  It's friken made to order.  Like, they slice the apples and make the whole thing fresh.  Then top it with some crunchy buttery cinamonny bread crumb topping then add creamy ice cream and caramel sauce - if I could eat the bowl I would have it was so good.  Nom nom.

rIt5q2ooLCpApiqCshL8Ag.review_text: I came here for Brunch with friends one weekend and had a great experience. The food was delicious and the pancake battered bacon was AMAZING! I work in the area and also used their catering services. Not only was the experience pleasurable...Kim the owner personally delivered my order and the appetizer food was so good. I appreciate good service because these days it is hard to find but I want to say thank you to Kim and the staff at Brickhouse for the awesome experience. I will definitely be back again and again!

F4dfncYAZdlJw-YTEHEi6A.review_text: I recommend approaching this place from the southwest. If you approach from the northeast, you might get scared off by the concertina barbed wire surrounding the lot next door...  Thankfully, I was brave... or reckless... and I charged on to the front door. Once inside, I did a double take, as I imagine many first-time patrons do. This place looks completely different on the inside from what you would expect from the outside.  Sort of a hipster-folksy feel, with cowboy themed stuff around, warm woods, a tree in the middle of the dining area, overhanging roofs inside. Yet somehow it all works and it winds up being "comfy". I dig it.  I haven't been here to get my drink on, so seek another review for the quality of the intoxicating libations. But I can whole-heartedly recommend the breakfast fare. Quality eats and lots of them.  Live music occasionally. Nice servers always. Solid food. Unusual ambiance.  Four stars.

LbXPxx2HwO9yz7RkOQP3QA.review_text: We live really close, so we come here pretty often. Its convenient and easy.  What is really weird though is that I feel there is no standard for service. Sometimes we get presented with bread and water upon sitting, sometimes we are left fending for ourselves - no water/no bread, having to flag someone down just to help us. Sometimes we have a good experience, sometimes it is just okay - it doesn't seem to be a function of being understaffed or crazy busy.  The Mexican Burger is really good and so are some of the other sandwiches. Plus $2 pints of PBR and weekday drink specials - so we keep coming back despite the disconnect between the servers.

utsD7uMz380XQqAr27L5YA.review_text: Solid brunch and burger joint with delicious food combinations. I personally enjoy the huevos rancheros, which is a tough find in this area. Does get a bit packed during the weekends but still manageable.

PKra4ioryJYwSMo4b2Tqyw.review_text: Boyfriend and I went here for lunch and shared the following items:  -Tomato Basil Bisque ($5): Delicious, but then again, how hard is it to get this right?   -Garlic Fries: ($6.50): Just OK. Not enough garlic for my taste, but they were nice and crispy.   -Tuna Melt Sandwich ($8.50): This was one of the better tuna melts that I've had.They didn't serve it with just the usual tuna, mayo, and cheese. They included lettuce and tomato.. just how I like it.  -Brickhouse Melt ($8.50): Turkey, bacon, tomato, avocado, cheese..etc. Just an ordinary sandwich and our least favorite item.   Quick and friendly service. What the food lacked in taste they made up for in portions. We had to take a lot of the food home since there was too much for us to be able to finish in one sitting. The half of the tuna sandwich and fries we took with us actually tasted better after being put in the toaster oven a couple hours later, lol. The other half of the Brickhouse Melt, however, we left alone after 2 bites. Although my first visit here didn't wow me so much, I'd come back to give some other things a try before completely giving up on the place (:

iLjMdZi0Tm7DQxX1C1_2dg.review_text: I think I'm just going to start reviewing places that rhyme with '70s disco songs. Yesterday, I reviewed the fabulous Rickhouse. Today, it's all about Brickhouse. Maybe tomorrow I'll find a joint called Slickhouse? Trickhouse? Only time will tell.  As I digress, Brickhouse is a pretty cool little coffee shop/cafe in SOMA. They have good coffees, a pretty extensive food menu, happy hour beers for those middle-later portions of the day, and a pretty swell vibe. It's a little on the small side, so if you're meeting someone for the first time (whether it's a business or personal thing), you'll have a pretty intimate gathering. If that doesn't freak you out, you're golden.   And if you're meeting someone who's driving from outside they city... say San Jose, for example, it's really easy to find if taking the 280 to 6th street. I'm sure your buddy/business colleague would appreciate not having to park their whip in the middle of downtown on a weekday.

4RUXeyp_Af2C5t9JFyJlBQ.review_text: Eggs Benedict. That's what I normally get when I go brunching with friends.   These eggs benedicts were good. I got it with pulled pork (yum!) and it was pretty good. The eggs and hollandaise sauce were made well, but there wasn't like a point in the meal where I thought it was fantastic or anything like that. It was just good.   I will say that the mimosas being only $3 (I think) make it a very dangerous place to go for brunch. Although bottomless mimosas would have been nice, it just makes it dangerous because I could get 4 of them and be well on my way of being day drunk and still have plenty of money.   Overall, good place for brunch - I'll have to try the dinner sometime.

AfvYl8vuc25bsBPMgQveqw.review_text: First off, Brickhouse? No, no. THE Brickhouse. That's what my friends and I call it. Not a huge difference, but I think it just sounds better with the "the" in front. Don't you think?  Whatever you choose to call it, The Brickhouse has been there for me through thick and thin. It's nothing fancy, but that's what I love. I can't tell you how many times I have worked all day on school projects only to find myself starving and too tired to cook. I can always rely on The Brickhouse for a tasty, filling meal - all within a cozy, eclectic atmosphere.  My favorite is the Chicken Brie sandwich, hands down. Oh. My. God. If this isn't the most heavenly sandwich I have ever had the pleasure of devouring, I don't know what is. The combination of chicken, brie, pesto, red onions, and fresh apples (yes that's right, fresh apples) is an all around palette pleaser. The sweet crunchiness from the apples is what sets this sandwich apart from all others. As a side, I highly suggest ordering the garlic fries. They are served with a tasty chipotle aioli dipping sauce which I am addicted to. If that stuff was sold in bottles, I'd buy the whole lot!  The Brickhouse is also a great spot for a laid back breakfast or brunch. You can't go wrong with the Vanilla Bean French Toast. Oh, oh! There's also a question of the day, and if you answer it correctly you get 25 cents off your coffee. I'm not a coffee drinker, but trivia junkies like myself always appreciate opportunities where we can show off our knowledge of useless, random facts.  Now, you may be wondering, "If you love this place so much, why give it 4 stars and not 5?" Well, my little yelpies, it all boils down to two simple factors - consistency and service. The service isn't bad by any means. Most of the people are awesome! It's just that the service and quality tend to fluctuate. Sometimes the staff is AMAZING and other times I feel borderline ignored. I guess it just depends on who's working. I've had ONE bad meal here, but that's easily forgiven because everyone has their off nights.  That being said, all the people I have taken to The Brickhouse have fallen under its spell, especially when they discover Happy Hour. I'm not a big drinker (I usually drink the cranberry lemonade), but I suggest going on Monday - pomegranate margs - enough said. You can thank me later, or yell at me - depending on how much you drink and how bad your hangover is on Tuesday morning! (;

RZykBff5zKRFUQO9lREC2Q.review_text: Decent food. You could basically find their menu on every other cafe. The decor was the reason I give it 3 stars. Service was a bit, took a while for our food to arrive.

jdpp5cxwrKYHM7ESlim1YA.review_text: One of my favorite places for lunch when at work. Good food - I love their corned beef sandwich - fast service, beer if you're in the mood, and usually enough seats. Garlic fries are good, too. :)  I also like that they have sriracha available.

0OFtP9x_ysPQ1KWNLrT0yw.review_text: Great brunch. 2 of us came for Saturday brunch just before noon, and there was no wait. The fare is pretty standard with a few twists. we got the corned beef hash and brickhouse bennies, which came on focaccia . We got the pancake fried bacon, which is bacon battered in pancake batter and deep-fried. Served with the maple syrup, it was great.

rtQs6OFrwWceVM12bmG-Hg.review_text: Excellent veggie burger, and brunch. Great location.

xflt0qbyWb7qrFbLAV5XXg.review_text: I love a good gastropub, and this place certainly delivers. The chef does his own fishing and brings back the catch for the kitchen. They also do an excellent burger. Decent selection of craft beers plus a full bar. They sometimes have live music (guitar/singer sort of stuff) which adds the the experience. They are located just a few blocks from the Caltrain station, so its a perfect spot for dinner before taking a train home. I've been here a number of times and they are consistent.

pFBvmfXRQj3NZjL6sLSbfg.review_text: This used to be my default "I have a meeting in 10 minutes!! My stomach is about to eat me alive!" lunch spot when I was working in SOMA. The burgers are okay, and a couple of the sandwiches aren't bad (chicken and brie!), but a lot of items on the menu are extremely overpriced. Stay away from the caprese salad...you will be very hungry two hours later.  Service is pretty good, but I wouldn't seek out any of the food were it not so close to the office. I kind of landed on the soup + fries default option after a while.

dzXPcNOQyaiD5vGMXO1Rww.review_text: Excellent brisket sandwich.  Very tender with little yellow peppers.  I liked this little place--expansive menu of comfort food basics.

VbpTaNqVfykwLlYpj88nJw.review_text: The last piece of meat I ever consumed, before going Veggie was here. It was one of the singularly most amazing pork loins I had ever eaten.  Ahh bliss.

pLlwJOMcsH770F-H8rNJIA.review_text: Pros: Nice setting, high ceilings, and even though it gets busy, getting a table is typically not an issue.  Cons: not a great value spot.  Salad with any meat is $13-$14.   Today I had one of the grossest sandwiches.  I ordered fish and chips and when I got back to my office, I found out I had a fish sandwich.  I had one bite and threw the greasiest thing away.  A waist of $11

gMwwQif7RMqBdPUrmbaqyQ.review_text: I'm so near this place and ust found it. The food was amazing. I've had several of the very creativly inspired burgers and have been thrilled everytime. It's a great atmospher too, and a fun place to rab a bight and a drink with friends after work. I've found the serviceto be somewhat unfriendly however.  Edit, I have not had any unfriendly service since I wrote this review, and have been hitting the place up alomost every week. 5 stars!!!

rP1JhMcc7sZTzW3KzLpL9w.review_text: Deliciousness for lunch!!!  I have yet to try the breakfast menu, but so far lunches have been great. The people are awesome, very friendly service over the phone and in person, and they always carefully package your food if you order to go, not to be underestimated! The line can take some time, especially for less-regular customers who spend minutes at the register still reading the menu.. which yes, can be overwhelming.  Favorites are the brickhouse melt, chicken brie sammich, and their caprese salad. All their soups are delicious, and the jambalaya has a special spot in my heart. I really look forward to trying their breakfast foods, yet I'm afraid it might spoil my lunch appetite. Uhm.. decisions, decisions.

eUmVXP9UnoWtz9NSBwY4jA.review_text: I really hate reviews that start with "I really wanted to love this place..." That being said, I really wanted to love Brickhouse. It's a great space with exposed brick and the dining room is cluttered with all sorts of kitschy items (I love me some kitsch) The menu is pretty extensive and downright affordable plus it's a short walk to AT&T Park. And did I mention they have happy hour?  "You lost me, Phil...this places sounds great. What's your deal?" Well, dear reader, the food was just average. My ribs were fine but lacked any sort of bite. I ate the whole order but they were just sorta 'eh'. Also, my root beer was flat. No bueno. My date's burger was overcooked and (oddly enough) featured a round patty on a square bun. Everyone knows that throws off the bun/meat ratio per bite! They need to either make the patties square to match or switch to round buns.  Service was solid, especially since there was a constant stream of people in the place. The inexpensive prices, friendly service and great looking happy hour is enough to convince me to give Brickhouse another shot next time I'm in the hood and looking for a bite to eat or some drinks. Hopefully next time I truly will love it!

_k1SZqmthiRtPRj7z48iaA.review_text: Got a SoMa burger for take out, which was burger topped with caramelized onions, avocado, swiss cheese and sauteed onions. Patty was a perfect medium rare between yummy grilled brioche bread and the topping took me by surprise - in a good way. There were so many avocado slices and the mushrooms were not the cheap white ones, but full on large, oyster mushrooms, and many of them! To top it all off, the  fries were perfectly cooked and seasoned. Man. That was literally a perfect burger meal.

WNmSVxHWy8tQqPOs_6yecw.review_text: Let me preface this with letting you know I've been here four times (twice for brunch and twice for dinner).  I would be giving Brickhouse four stars, however, the seafood salad I had the last time I went was so horrible, that I cannot in good conscience give more.  I am boggled by how a soggy salad, with dry, salty smokey fish-like food on top could ever had made it on to what is otherwise a decent menu.  Furthermore, when I did not eat a bite of the fish and then ordered an entire burger to accompany it because I was "still hungry", the server did not even bat an eye and read between the lines to ask about whether the salad was not to my liking.  At $16 or so bucks, this was an expensive miss.  Rant over.  On to things I think are good and even great. - Beer selection.  My boyfriend really enjoys the variety of beers they have to offer.  I like picking a nice cocktail off of their pretty decent list.    - Other salads.  The Thai-style salad they have has a nice sauce, delicious chicken (maybe I paid to add this--can't remember) and has noodles on the bottom which i really enjoyed.  - Both the veggie burger and the regular burgers are good.  - Breakfast is SOLID.  My bestie had a scramble and loved it.  I had bacon and eggs--(bacon is a bit fatty and greasy but that can come as no surprise, I suppose, but I've had better).  Their real winner is their pancakes.  DELICIOUS.  I will get those every time I go from here on out.  All in all, I will keep going back, but definitely will think twice before straying too far from what appear to be their menu staples (i.e., no more seafood salad for this chick).

xPQnCfBPziRh3mzzDZJ3Mg.review_text: Great brunch here. Nice atmosphere, friendly staff. Will go back and try their dinner options for sure.

iCYMf_sHRevmzWg8la-LVw.review_text: Came here for brunch today before the game, and our wait was a lot shorter than we had expected. We sat at the long bar like table and it was a little tight but good seating.  I am a huge eggs benedict fan, so while everyone went with burgers, I went with the smoked salmon eggs benedict. They do not substitute their house potatoes for fries unfortunately. Our food was brought out pretty quickly, and I was disappointed to see my smoked salmon was more like cooked salmon, and it was dry and extra fishy tasting. It was on top of focaccia bread, and the eggs were perfectly poached. The potatoes were okay. I was starving and ate the whole thing minus some of the salmon. I wish I went with the pulled pork instead since my fish was so dry and hard.  Everyone's burgers looked good, the garlic fries were delicious! Their caesar salad also looked amazing with anchovies and garlic bread on top.  Service was lacking towards the end, even though it had emptied out. Loved the cute touches of the place, like how they present your bill in a small leather bound notebook.  Would opt for a burger next time rather than their breakfast food.

fHsdLww6d_LVIGJ-Bt4UDA.review_text: The service was excellent and the turkey burger I ate was fantastic!   (There's only so much you can do with a turkey burger - I don't know what they did, but it was really delicious.)

qIDy9zJfCuqxy6A3exPe_w.review_text: Not that into the burger here either. Too meaty. It was just way too filling for a lunch portion. I fail at this place!

pstUj_8tgwbF0AktTUJasw.review_text: good-not great.The Calamari would have been excellent but it was served almost cold.Fish Tacos were excellent however.The drink specials are good...the waitress was sweet and cute....thanks Emily. Ps-be careful on going when the Giants are playing,we got stuck w/some truly obnoxious drunks.

XpQ91mkfHviZCgKY1nGQDQ.review_text: The Big Ass Burger was one of the best burgers I've had in a long time and the best I've eaten in San Francisco so far. Awesome garlic fries as well.  Service-wise they're nothing to brag about--we had to call for our waitress several times when she seemingly forgot about us.

5Fqrvt74YeurTJy3Xi1wXw.review_text: This was the first place we ate in San Francisco after getting off the plane. We had planned to go to Darwin but then saw the crazy line and how small it was. So, we walked around the corner and found this place. It was extremely cute inside. It did take a while to get our food. But, when it came it was the most delicious portabella sandwich in fries I've had in a long time. My husband had a club sandwich and salad which was also delicious. The food was presented well. I don't know how it could have been any better.

2xIEk7jVctflUN8ltpg05A.review_text: This was a cool place! Good drinks for decent prices.
