Good food.  I will definitely be going back, whether or not I'm there for a giants game, cause of its proximity to the park.  The inside is roomy and the decor is nice very country hipster, local bar feel.  I loved it, and recommend it for breakfast, dinner, or drinks anytime!

UnvwodJKxqXn6Bhhcm1Amg.review_text: Chicken pot pie, onion rings, chili... all great, for one of those cold rainy days when you want something hearty, greasy and fills you up nicely so you can fall asleep in food coma after.  $16 for a pot pie is expensive, though :(

TVvTtXwPXsvrg2KJGoOUTg.review_text: This place is one of those cool hipster-ish places that people can meet up at and potentially spend the entire night without lacking for good food or drink.  It had a great decor with a live jazz band (it was a weekend night).  The servers are really helpful and nice, and will definitely give you recommendations on drinks or food.  But the best part is the hot bread and the whipped butter.  If you left me at Brickhouse I could probably eat loaves and loaves of bread and be the happiest kid on Earth.  The drinks were good and well-crafted, strong but not too strong.  My burger was super tasty and cooked the way I like it, but I got over-zealous by adding on too many toppings and it got a little messy to eat.  The calamari is delicious, as are the garlic fries.  Definitely try to order those two if you can swing it.   I'll be coming back for that bread soon!

CUbbOpIrbwyoXJnok9BhNw.review_text: I really like the ambience of this joint. Sometimes there is live music. Yummy cocktails, good food. Fun pre-post Giants game.

7edHxOKYn5UwGXafHGRlAw.review_text: We went here for a quick Dinner before we hit da' Club. Food was reasonable priced and they had  a Live Jazz  band playing.  They also had a nice sized bar and clean bathrooms, (unisex)  Wifey and I split the Yellow Tail Fish Sandwich and salad. The rest of the Burgers and food looked good, but I was still full from Happy Hour previously. Nice Ambiance and Friendly service is a good reason to come back here.  The place is also near the PacBell park, too.

fHqS4V4QRtkn_bjMCzDDrg.review_text: Came here for a late lunch at the suggestion of a friend. I really liked the environment, vibe and decor. Good menu, decent selection of beer. We ordered two burgers and two sodas, just under $35?! They were good, but not $35 good. Came with fries that were crunchy, but nothing fantastic. What really got me was the typical "SOMA hipster" service. I always feel like my ordering is inconveniencing them. No one was friendly, they didn't even smile at each other, let alone customers. I'm not racing to get back to this place.

TDX5Xy0M2HPHFiWc1UHdjg.review_text: Lunch is nice. Brunch is sub-par.  Biggest problem I noticed with brunch is that they do table service, unlike the counter of lunchtime, which seems to operate at a good pace.  We waited for-EVER for our tab. It was ridiculous. And there was no reason to have table-side service - they did little more than take our order + bring food. No check-ins.  The server even gave me a roll of the eyes when I asked for the missing pepper shaker. And the brunch food was unremarkable and so-so.  Mediocre biscuits and gravy, french toast,etc.  I do enjoy their lunches (especially the onion rings) in the afternoon & the fun of cheap PBR after work now and then.

3J0C16J14wc1JoRMey5vpA.review_text: my husband and i go to Brickhouse every weekend.  EVERY WEEKEND - why?  because the people that work there are great and we love their pancakes, eggs benedict and huevos rancheros.

7fENVju2EGjwELwDQ9HsHw.review_text: Might be a good place to drop in for a beer at the bar, but that's about it. The food is mediocre at best. Burgers are nothing to get excited about. The wait staff is attentive at first but then forgets about you, and may even forget to bring stuff you've ordered. There's so much other stuff in SOMA just a block or two away that if you're looking to eat you're better off going somewhere else.

zAFS5GwqdQH9ZlwgL5ywAQ.review_text: Friday night talkin' here...Between 2 and 3 stars.   *Baby plus for an easy menu:  burgers, salads, veggies, stuff like that. **Bigger plus for casual ambiance and full bar. ***HUGE plus for live music.  MINUS(es) for below mediocre food :(  Really.  How can you make a salad taste yucky?  Well maybe it was those bathrooms...  They're a little misplaced, being in the same space as the dining area.  It's so cramped, the door can just fly open onto someone's meal.  Seriously.    And when those doors open, they stay open unless someone shuts them.  GROSS.  I would venture to guess that there are some *SERIOUS* SANITATION molecules flying all over that restaurant.    I'm not OCD or anything ;)  Just not my cup of tea.

3-Fdl-0rn3eE-ofvfoQqeA.review_text: Cheap food, great crab melt, but it's pretty much a self-service and I would rather pay more for a good service for brunch. But this is my go-to for a regular brekkie if I'm in the area.

RmMbDOMp_BFS_kllQbRNxg.review_text: Great lunch spot with lots of healthy and fresh options. Good veggie options too.  Would most certainly recommend and will definitely return!

wfTgUYunMLde3bIoEhu3-w.review_text: Food was decent - had the gravy+biscuit. Gravy was a bit salty, but very tasty  Decaf coffee was great... probably because we got there just as it was opening and they hadn't started brewing their house decaf yet, so they gave me a decaf Americano  +1 for a very up-beat and friendly server who wasted no time getting us comfortable with the restaurant +2 for the little one-legged bird who always shows up around 10:30am to claim the bits of croissant and cheese that the staff leaves out for him

sHwBXS0trP0CC_f5K_11VA.review_text: Leave it to me to forget to call my intended lunch place before we drove into town. Closed for July 4th? I guess we'll have to dine at Brickhouse.  It smelled good when we walked by and looked super cute! I will say that the decor was lovely. The staff was nice. But the food was meh. Major meh.  Started with some celebratory, welcome to SF, happy birthday drinks. CP enjoyed a mimosa. I had a bloody mary. Once every two years I'll have a bloody mary only to be reminded that I don't really care for them. Sigh. oh yeah, my bad.  CP and I both ordered burgers. Mine had a fried egg on it. I asked for grilled onions but that didn't happen. Both burgers were fine. My onion rings were pretty good but there was only a few on the plate. The burger greens (lettuce, tomato, pickle) all looked frighteningly soggy and wilted. I pushed those off. blech.   The bathroom was very dark. Why? Why would they do that.  Clearly this wasn't the worst lunch I have ever had and I may be particularly sensitive since I didn't want to be here in the first place but I was still very unimpressed. With all the delicious dining options that San Francisco presents it seems enormously wasteful to blow your calories on a par meal. No thank you.

WaLKa3tjbj5qN3RGnSS9ow.review_text: Great live music for sunday brunch. Food wasn't off the charts but it's good. Bloody Mary's are spicy like they should be servers were friendly and a great mix of people in the area.

-ozZzOwDCiK3obovH_n_Ng.review_text: First visit today. Impressions: Good little neighborhood place. Great vibe, casual atmosphere, friendly people. Love the tricycle that goes nowhere.  Brunch food: just ok. Wife's Eggs Benedict- hollandaise sauce was good. The egg was ok but the bacon was slightly overdone (dried on edges) and the muffin was overdone (crunchy). Roasted potatoes tho were very, very good. My western scramble was overdone. Egg was way overcooked.  My son's sausage and eggs were good. Eggs were fluffy and sausage was tasty.  Overall it was ok, nothing that inspires you.   Service rocked: I love places that refill your water glass before it empties.  Will probably come back to give it another chance; plan to try the burgers next time.

lKS8TBEB_rsFcVKurzuAlg.review_text: Huevos rancheros were excellent. Great local pub too. It's not surprising that this spot has nearly 900 reviews, the staff take careful attention to decor and food presentation.

lDtTvz2rLeaSNPhUJ6me3Q.review_text: I don't know what happened to this place!?!?!  Was looking for food on a Saturday and decided to stop by one of our favorite places and left disappointed and still hungry.  I"m not sure which was worst, the service or the food.   Our waitress was dismissive and acted as if she was being bothered to take our order.   My fiance's menu listed steak and eggs on it but it was marked out on my menu.   When we asked our waitress about it, she said "Oh yeah, we have the rib eye steak and eggs but we didn't for awhile so I crossed it out on some of the menus."   Never ran a restaurant myself but I think I would be a little upset that my most expensive menu item had been crossed out on the menu's even though it's available.   But rest assured if you didn't get the correct menu because the "steak" would've turned your stomach over.    My guy has had the rib- eyed steak and eggs here before and what he got was definitely not a rib-eye steak.   And when he later went back and pointed it out to the waiter, they admitted it wasn't a rib eye!!   But that would've been fine if the steak didn't look AND taste like it was old and had been cooked from a frozen state.   He had also asked for medium rare and the steak came out blue.   When he mentioned it to the waitress, she offered to throw it back on the grill.....who asks that???    He should've gotten a new steak and when she did bring the steak back out, it had clearly been put in the microwave.     My sunny side up eggs on my huevro rancheros was also undercooked and between that and all the blood my guy's plate from his rare "steak,"  I couldn't finish my meal.   Even though we had practically full plates on our tables, our waitress didn't care to ask how our meal went when it was clear we didn't enjoy it.     After we had paid and walked out, my guy was so disappointed that he went back in and spoke to one of our usual waiters to tell him about our experience.   And he responded in a defensive manner and told him that even though it wasn't a rib eye steak that he had that another customer had raved about it and made no apologies.  A complete WTF moment.   We won't be going back and that's too bad because I wrote a raving review about them not too long ago and I will miss what use to be a great breakfast joint.

LJ_6Mdrd959hEwSnuSwsPQ.review_text: We here before todays A's-Giants game (LET'S GO OAKLAND!!!) and was seated very quickly. It's got a nice comfy setting and our waitress took our order very quickly. I'm basing my review off of their Cowboy Combo which hit the spot just right. BIG THICK SAUSAGES.  PLUMP AND JUICY EGGS. HEARTY PIECES OF TOAST. GREAT SEASONED POTATOES. Oops, is my caps lock on?   Anyways, I'm leaving here very satisfied.  I'll be back.

P2fXcmsU_vrs4zB2IfsHnQ.review_text: Love this place. We came here with some friends and we had such a good time. Came here for dinner and it wasn't that crowded. It was just right where we can have a good time, laugh and have good conversation and not have to scream because it's too loud. Love the decor, too. It has that old time feel. Charming. As for the food...great pot pie and good garlic fries. Yes. Fattie. Who cares. Oh, hella random, but they make awesome shirley temples. Yup, that's right...shirley temples. Hella good. LOL.  Good ole' time. Friendly staff...reasonable prices. LOVE.

4Ya-tjG6q2lMOOHUlwYZ7A.review_text: wow. i'm surprised at the low ratings.   my boyfriend lives right around the corner and we come here pretty often.  absolutely love the live music which i think is thurs to saturday except if there are giants games  crab onion dip -- 5 / 5 stars. lots of crab beef papparedelle -- 4 / 5 pretty decent pork chop -- 3.5 / 5 could be a bit juicier steak -- 5 / 5 boyfriend loved it king salmon -- 4 / 5 garlic fries -- 5 / 5 of course they are super tasty!

m-wOqansyTVzX0gn2dMIhA.review_text: I recently moved to SF and this was the first place I found for brunch.  Between vanilla bean french toast and $3 mimosas, you absolutely can't go wrong here.  Come and enjoy.  This is a great place with a lot of character.

dRFblt8xitfnwnPbEBo0Vw.review_text: I ordered the brickhouse bunnies (eggs benedict over foccacia with smoked salmon and house potatoes) and it was amazing! The smoked salmon came in slightly harder/meaty chunks but actually worked quite well to compliment the eggs. At $12 it was a steel.  This place has cute, kitchy decor that's perfect for a winter brunch and makes for a great brunch date since it's an automatic conversation starter. They also have incredibly fast service, but in a good/bad way. My meal was too much for me alone, so my date was stealing bites off of my plate. He finished his plate before me and it was taken away before he could grab the fork off of it to help me with my plate.

QCk8kt0YesOpIHgQP90XMw.review_text: Brickhouse is one of my favorite lunch spots in the SoMA/South Park area for two reasons: - The Veggie Amore sandwich - White Velvet coffee  The Veggie Amore is one of the best tomato-mozzarella-basil combos I've had in the area. Brickhouse adds marinated artichokes, red onions and balsamic vinegar to the concoction, which takes it up a notch. Plus you get a nice side salad with it, no extra charge, so you're not left hungry.  And the White Velvet (their white mocha) is amazing. I realize it's a floofy beginner coffee drink, don't hate, I'm new to coffee and still need sweetness added to enjoy it. With the White Velvet, though, I may never go to straight-up black coffee...

wXxTnDYNXIaRxcEOs_agJw.review_text: Came here right before a giants game and this place was pretty popping. It was almost packed full and there were a couple people in line.  I was here to grab some Nachos Del Diablo to eat at the park, and they didn't disappoint.  First off, they say they cook their own kettle style potato chips for the chip portion of the nachos. Theyre covered in cheese (cheddar?), then with pulled pork, then with jalapenos and blue cheese. OMG, they were yummy. I would recommend eating these when theyre hot still since the ones I ate when cold were a tad soggy. The pulled pork was sweet, but not too sweet and since the jalapenos were cooked, they weren't too spicy.  I had 2-3 people at the game ask me where I got these awesome nachos and I had to point them to where brickhouse was. I'll definitely be coming back here again. Maybe for their Happy hour Nachos and a pitcher deal.

GzZ-G46jB7lUP7veL9_zdw.review_text: This is my go to spot for dinner and drinks before a Giants game. Always a good deal on PBR pitchers. Great burgers and sandwiches. Always the freshest ingridients.

Fmr6QPBlUrrson-facjNrA.review_text: This place is rated wrong!! Should've been a 4 star cafe. When I first came in the cafe I wasn't expect anything special..since it's a 3.5 star one.. So I randomly ordered a corn beef brisket sandwich and the dish came up much better than expected!! Tho the dish looks casual, but the taste is WOW!

P5bUL3Engv-2z6kKohB6qQ.review_text: People used to always tell me to get the burger here. I remember when Green Day played the park nearby an we came in for a quick bite. It was crazy packed. Im guessing game days are like this too. So much so that they were out of hamburger buns, so we got the white bread redneck style burgers. Decent taste but I dont think I'd suffer the wait again. 3.5 stars

kp1SDNjwwBPFmdF1kadRmw.review_text: For bar food, Brickhouse is pretty decent. Immediately when you walk in, you will notice the decor. It's quite interesting. There are tables that line the windows and walls, which I think is a great idea. You get some privacy without feeling really cramped in the small space. The tables in the middle of the room do feel a little claustrophobic.  The food selection was pretty good. There are all different types of burgers (and you can customize your own), seafood, steak, and salads. So there's something for everybody. My burger was pretty good. Cooked just to the temperature I asked for. I like that you can sub in different sides. The red cabbage slaw was pretty good.  For a simple dinner with friends, Brickhouse is a nice neighborhood spot.

YiMz379X7wihAHPKljf0Rg.review_text: Great atmosphere.  Cute neighborhood place with good food.

lcBxErp_W1aNAPD_2RikcA.review_text: I just went to lunch here today. It's busy with all the working people, as are all the lunch spots in SOMA. I'm a huge fan of Caesar Salads and try them everywhere. I was not impressed. I've gotten a sandwich here before that was pretty good, but overall I wasn't that impressed so I'm not sure if I'll be back for round 3.  If you are going to go for lunch during the week, beat the crowed by going at 11:45 instead of lunch hour.

be_VC6SjhIABLvpGqRlMow.review_text: Quick add: I tried the homemade Ginger Ale - that stuff is GOOD! You will not be disappointed. Gingery, fizzy, fabulous!  ****************  I came to Brickhouse Cafe for brunch. I like the decor - it's different, rustic, slightly random and schizo, and very visually stimulating so there's a lot to look at and keep you occupied. We sat in a window table which is nice if you want to be separated from the main floor/dining area.   We got the wagyu burger and salmon scramble. Both were good. Burger was really tasty. Salmon scramble definitely hearty with a good portion of salmon. Potatoes were tasty too. They have freshly squeezed fruit juices (said the server). I had a latte too and it was a large and hot cup - nice.   Service was really friendly. For a Saturday brunch, it wasn't crowded and we were seated immediately which is great when you are hungry. If you drive, there's a lot of metered street parking.

5B2Ozg2UPi3WPtZgX3YfEQ.review_text: soooooo good! I am so glad I leave close by. You must try the roasted skilled half chicken ... :-)

fxpH4PaedDQkFRjldw6OzA.review_text: Came here for Happy Hour on last Thursday as a last stop before I took the Caltrain back home. The ambiance is quaint and they had 2 talented musicians playing Christmas songs. The polenta was delicious: crispy on the outside and creamy in the middle. I didn't enjoy their HH mojito but I liked the bloody Mary which wasn't an HH drink. Probably will not come back here until I've tried all or most placed in AT&T Park area.

hOwNzTU0g0UzNLNQhhuHEQ.review_text: It wasn't the worst and it wasn't the best, but exactly down the middle!   The pros: good customer service, western theme inside, no line, quick food delivery.   The cons: music was way too loud for a Saturday morning breakfast and there wasn't anything special about their menu.   Maybe the evening time is a better option?

af6ayEH9BzsOPQRoxKNE0Q.review_text: Very reliable lunch spot in SOMA that I frequent at least a few times a month. The food is mostly good, but it is definitely hit or miss between entrees and even the same thing on different days. Here's some of my pros and cons for my friend the Brick House:  Pros: Cool old timey feeling. Wood, stairs, big chairs. Try to sit upstairs and pretend you are a queen/king staring down at your subjects as they wait in line. The Sassy Spinach and Asian Sesame salads are both quite good. Filling but not totally unhealthy tasting. Onion rings are bomb. Beer on tap and wine by the glass - my coworkers and I occasionally LOVE this.  Cons: Gets very crowded right past lunch hour and can be very awkward as you try to maneuver around and find a spot. Come at 11:50 and you will be just fine. Otherwise prepare to wait in a long ass line and then creep around for a table. Kind of expensive for the quality of the food. Why is the menu in that weird cursive that is impossible to read?? The veggie amore sandwich is really, really, unapologetically bad.  Haven't been here for happy hour but I should. it's a fun vibe that I enjoy if I come at the right time and order the right thing (plus some booze).

n6GBeJVd1C2dszlSOBAfJw.review_text: Decided to come here for Happy Hour with Vincent K. last Thursday since he had a $25 restaurant.com certificate. Parking wasn't hard to find but then again, I wasn't the one driving!  Walked in and the upstairs wasn't open so we just grabbed a seat downstairs. They were offering the regular menu and the happy hour menu which was good cuz sometimes, happy hour items just never seem to make me full, or maybe it's because I'm fat.. We started off with drinks. I ordered the Happy Hour cocktail. The Buckaroo? It's almost like a Mojito but used basil? That was OK. Nothing special and not enough alcohol for me... We chose to order the: Fried Calamari ($9 - $2 during happy hour = $7!) Jalapeno poppers ($8 - $2 = $6!) Baked Rigatoni and Cheese on reg menu ($8) They were all pretty damn good! My fav? Calamari and rigatoni and cheese. I love it when places make mac and cheese using penne or rigatoni.. The cheesey gooey goodness inside those tubes just makes the best of the dish! Calamari, piping hot, crispy, oily served with chipotle aioli. YUM! So good! The jalapeno poppers were good. REALLY hot. Vincent, I know you were trying to man up and NOT spit out that piping out jalapeno popper with SUPER HOT cream cheese filling, but it was funny seeing how it's steaming in your mouth but you still didn't spit it out. haha The popper was good, but I think it was purchased then fried.. BUT still good. The restaurant.com certificate was good if you order $45 worth but we weren't there yet! So Vincent orders a pasta dish for his lunch tomorrow.. It was the special for the night. Some kinda pasta with shrimp in a cream sauce. SMELLED SO GOOD. Vincent really wanted to just get a bite of it once it came but we were going to Humphry so he resist... until he went home atleast... Oh and thanks for saving me a bite! NOT!! Definitely would come back again and get dinner or something cuz their pasta dishes were looking really delish! THANKS VINCENT FOR HAPPY HOUR!

xh5JpGXzrhnrVi2eQyRrtw.review_text: Burgers here are amazing. I recently ordered the unusual mexican burger, and it was unusually good. Lunch is very busy and you have to walk to the counter to place your order and you're given a number. Dinner service is very slow but the waiters and waitresses are very nice.  Whatever you order, get it with garlic fries.

Gh7a3aAOlB2zMRocFzGEZg.review_text: I've been here twice and although it wasn't love at first sight, this place is growing on me. They've got personality - heck, their stools have cowhide print on them! You might even call them "cozy" - if you consider tightly packed tables surrounding a long, communal table "cozy". The wood-paneled walls add to the warmth. And, you can always catch the Giants games here. Yup, I really do think I'm starting to like this place.  It doesn't hurt that the food is good. I've had their Big Ass Burger (love the name) twice, and was seasoned and cooked to perfection. Their happy hour gets you discounts off the bar menu and certain beers and cocktails (ask for the happy hour menu when you come in). The only downside is that the servers get really busy here, so if you're in a rush you might have to flag them down.  Parking isn't terrible during happy hour since most folks are leaving SOMA during that time.  I just realize I didn't insert even ONE "Brickhouse" song reference. I must be getting rusty. *shrug*

W_EQFi2fXpBtuRm510cCpA.review_text: I loved my Roast Beef sandwich (only a little over $10), as well as the friendly service and casual ambiance. The Roast Beef was down right delicious - they don't skimp on the caramely caramelized onions either :). My friends loved their sandwiches as well (Open-faced Crab Melt and the Turkey Cobb(?) I believe). Deep fried onion rings were also legit.

hRMpQlJQDObCpNSJ1qd_fA.review_text: Had the veggie/vegan burger here. It was pretty good!

nVGBXDq8TozIaAk7zAivGA.review_text: Kim the manager was awesome. She was really nice and sincere. I will definitely be returning to Brick House.

5I6-yegWr4p1mtUMwNkVtg.review_text: We were in the neighborhood and decided to check this joint out for lunch. It's a cute little restaurant/bar and I was digging the unique ambiance.   We were immediately seated by the bus boy and helped by our waiter who was friendly and knowledgable. My hub ordered a german beer, turkey burger with garlic fries and he said it was alright. I tried some of the turkey burger and would say that it tasted like it was a previously frozen patty.  I had a caesar salad and a bowl of tomato soup that came with garlic bread and unfortunately everything I ordered had an overwhelming amount of cheese on it, which I was not aware they were going to put cheese on everything. In a nutshell the meal was tasty but a hassle due to picking out the cheese off my meal.  I also decided to treat myself to a brick house buttered rum and it was the best alcoholic concoction I've ever had. The drink wasn't too sweet or too strong it was just right and if you foodies ever come to BC I highly recommend it.  Overall I'd highly recommend this joint for lunch, dinner or cocktails in the evening. The prices seem to be alright and the service is friendly and fast.

gXZDZZPqVdd1wwC2Ach8Fg.review_text: I've been to Brickhouse for brunch, lunch, and dinner and it's always a good place if you're wanting some comfort food while in SoMa. Their menus are mostly consistent, though some items change with the seasons and they are into using local, fresh ingredients which is always a bonus.  Brunch: -I've had the corned beef hash, which was really tasty and eggs were cooked perfectly.  -Bloody Mary's and Mimosas are plentiful and delicious  Lunch: -Gets BUSY! Lots of tech guys and gals come here for lunch/meetings -Delicious Arnold Palmers made with a floral-y tea -Roast beef sandwich with side salad is spot-on. Note: roast beef is "well-done" so to speak  Dinner: -Great atmosphere around dinner time; casual and intimate -Pot pies are DELICIOUS. I've had the chicken and turkey and they are fantastic -Burgers (for me at least, I'm not adventurous in this area) are mediocre; missing a certain je ne sais quoi that I can't put my finger on. -Meatloaf tastes like mom's but with a New American twist; sometimes they have cheddar mashed potatoes, sometimes sweet potatoes, veggie changes. Always good. -They have our favorite cider: Fox Barrel Pacific Pear.  A solid place for any meal. Will continue coming back for scrumptious food.

G7JO1ZepfNZq2oOV49oU-g.review_text: Love coming here for brunch. Try the pancake battered bacon. Delicious! And they were nice enough to bring us an extra few slices so we could each have one.   Sometimes the service is off. But thanks god for Miguel. He is probably the most helpful and efficient staff member.

03Jiz8bJrjjVoYpQ3dJmOw.review_text: I have had several trips to this place. The only time I was disappointed was when I ordered the Burger. Just seemed boring to me... It tasted well enough, but not impressive. Brunch is quite good. Great omelets. What they really excel in is desserts (IMO). The apple crumbler is the best I have EVER had, and the molten lava cake is sublime! Nice atmosphere and friendly staff.

VmloJ_YR6WMPOrX1Lp8wtw.review_text: Got confused, I was so excited to go here thought this place was brick..sat at the bar and ordered drinks anyway before our dinner reservations at another restaurant. I was impressed that the bartender brought out a fresh herb plant to make my mojito, I just do know if I saw her wash the leaves or not, drinks were ok...great happy hour prices.  Brickhouse was not happy with my review...this is what they sent me...now  I have changed my review to 1 star Hi D d.,  Kim here, from the Brickhouse Cafe.  Just a quick note, all of our fresh herbs are washed by the kitchen before they make there way to the bar for our fresh drinks.    We take all of our reviews very seriously and I was just wondering if there something else you were unhappy about aside from not being at the restaurant you thought you were at?  A 2 star rating is just a step beyond, well...pretty awful, and I didn't quite grasp the reason for it.  I'd love to hear any additional comments you have so that we can do our best to improve upon them.  I look forward to your response.  All the best,  Kim,  Thank You for the message, the plant was at the bar in front if me, did you wash the plant before you brought it out and started making my drink? The pieces of mint were so small I had to keep spitting them out would you like me to add that to my review...fyi I couldn't even finish my drink and was charged and I didn't complain. Word of mouth is the best form of advertisement.   Try a drink at Grand Pu Bah or Olive and then ask why I only gave your establishment one star.

orMhxLrNGNe1EWvcJulZew.review_text: Wonderful burger  - I had the "kobe"-beef burger as the mushroomburger and it was  awesome.

nF-UM092NAxzdGqERXGZLw.review_text: Good beer selection and food.  It has a Western bar theme.  Contrary to some other reviews, I've never had trouble with seating, but I avoid SOMA like the plague when there's a baseball game and haven't tried Brickhouse on a Friday/Saturday.  I've ordered the Wagyu Burger, Three Cheese Burger, and the Fish and Chips.  The Wagyu burger didn't wow me too much, it was good but I've had better, however a rare-cooked Three Cheese Burger is fantastic and the Fish and Chips were plump and succulent.  The prices have the standard SOMA mark-up, but the portions are very good.

spDS7HPrOUc3wCNRyfSUnA.review_text: Great fresh Burger and fries, decent portions, and good beer!

dviPtjXu-AzbefzWExaxGA.review_text: I've tried Brickhouse several times for brunch and overall it's been a pretty reliable spot when I don't want to wait hours for brunch.  Plus they have free coffee out front for those waiting for a table.  I remember the SOMA burger being bland and the Brickhouse melt was forgettable, but the smoked salmon benedict looked and tasted amazing.  Mimosas and bloody mary's are also reasonably priced.

hs7xVn_dUqgLSP2NwWdC3w.review_text: service was terrible, my friend's order came over wrong, and had to be sent back.  Which took about 20 extra minutes for the right food to come. Three other people around us either sent food back, or complained about something else.  Seems like it would be a cool bar scene, cheap drinks and tons of seating, but not great for food.  Also, lettuce with vinaigrette on them, is NOT a side salad!  I don't know why places think this is ok, or equal to fries!

P2FqSdcZ78mez-rvmsRixg.review_text: My husbands works near here and he wanted to try the food. Today after work, we finally gave it a try. The place is really nice decorated and the staff was nice and friendly. I got the SOMA burger and my husband ordered the BBQ hamburger;they were so juicy and delicious! We also got garlic fries and some beers.  We are definitely going back to try other things in their menu.

ZUk37WJbVRJJa2s_sX3D_g.review_text: Good spot for a sunday brunch with live jazz.  Food was typical american brunch. Nice ambiance and lively crowd.  I will stop by again when I'm in the area.

rKhT3fA-XB6zeApHlIGvIA.review_text: Love the atmosphere here. Feels comfortable and inviting. Live music at the door playing lovable Spanish guitar. Glad I found this place on yelp!  P.S found myself asking a lot of questions about the menu, didn't make much sense.

3nRENjIkd19bMwtJQtUFdA.review_text: What a nice SOMA find. I've been there for dinner and breakfast. Burgers, sandwiches, tomato soup and a traditional breakfast were all great. Loved the biscuit with my breakfast. Looking forward to going back the next time I'm in the area.

vXYxtW_JpMMdjNzcw91u7A.review_text: Diggin' Brickhouse. Loved it from the first time I walked in and still feel lucky to have it as my neigh~cafe.   Casual environment with a couple of booths and some high bar seating tables. Great menu with a nice assortment of all the American classics and comfort food (Brekkie, Burgers, Salads & Sandies. Ah, & full bar!). They have definitely put forth some good effort and ingredients into their menu options. Much appreciated!  Come in, place your order and have a seat. Or, come in, have a seat and place your order. Take it to go. Have it at the bar. Whatever you want! It's fine!  Coffee? Drop a dollar here and help yourself. It's ok!  Yeah, I'm diggin' Brickhouse Cafe. It's my kinda gig!

JoBmWW62xDOkXr2anyxfag.review_text: Lunch with a friend Sunday. It was pretty packed because of a giants game, but fortunately we only had to wait about 10 minutes for a table.   I'm not in the mood for a long review today so I'll summarize. My tuna melt was average and when they say side salad they mean small pile of lettuce on the side. My friend ordered the spinach salad no olives, which came out as a salad with no artichokes.   Service was...missing. I think our waiter was also the bartender, so when he said, I'll be back in 1 minute he really meant, see you in 20. It was impossible to get refills and we were relying entirely on other servers to get what we needed.   My friend was off the game so she really wanted to get going, but we couldn't find our waiter. Finally we tracked down someone else and got the check, but then we had to wait entirely too long for someone to take it. So I took it up to the register, he ran over apologizing and rang it up, but when he handed it back to me I opened it only to find he had passed me someone else's bill and credit card... free credit card?!   Once we got that sorted out it was fine, and we left. Not sure I'd return based on this experience.

3ebGuvvDgFEd5wu6GB2fWw.review_text: I wish they had more salad options, but this place is delicious. Like all SOMA lunch spots, go before 11:45am or after 12:45pm. The garlic fries are awesome, but I'm not allowed to eat them.  Tip: There is Huy Fong Foods sriracha, but there are only like three bottles so you have to search around.

EbtEBo_nccHifQHCABWTXQ.review_text: The staff was nice and the owner catches all of the salmon that they serve, which is really cool.  I ordered the chicken brie sandwich.  It is supposed to be hot.  I was served a sandwich that had warm bread and cold meat.  This is not a hot sandwich.  Hot food should be served hot.  And it was a very small sandwich.    What I got was OK, but that's all.

A02ryK2u5hA_ANkErNjuCA.review_text: Went here after dropping off my computer to be fixed at Create More Apple Repair Shop on 3rd Street (from a recommendation by their staff). I was struck by the quaint ambience of the place, and since it was right around 10:15 a.m., I went for a hearty breakfast. It was truly wonderful, albeit just fried eggs, roasted potatoes and chicken sausages and english muffins. I had asked or an extra egg, but the staff member couldn't find the key on the computer to ring that up. Rather than hold up the people behind me, I told her to "just skip that"..She went and told the chef of my request, and lo and behold the extra egg arrived but the added egg charge was not added to my bill. I thought that was especially wonderful, and I made sure I thanked her and graciously added more to the tip to show my appreciation of that extra generosity. The only thing that I wish that they'd change is that early in the a.m. loud music is not necessary when one is not really quite awake. Perhaps it is appropriate for late afternoon or evening crowds, but not for early in the day..Other than that, all was quite spectacular..

lFxIDgJG-nqRAxEAJY58YA.review_text: Great place!  Cute place, loved the atmosphere and food was reasonably priced and delicious!  Bloody Mary were great as well! Would definitely go back!

IjfxKR1ut1htmg5OUHvRnQ.review_text: While I really wanted to love Brickhouse, I may have made some poor choices in my ordering.  I asked the waitress if I wanted the Turkey Pot Pie or the 3-cheese Burger, and she actually told me I wanted the 3-Cheese Burger.  I ordered the Turkey Pot Pie, and it left me flat.  it wasn't bad, but it was not much better than something from the frozen isle of your grocery store heated in your oven. (Ironically, I kinda like those.)  My friend ordered the pork chop, and though ample, it too left him wanting... not wanting more, just wanting.   The lemonade was from a powder, and to me, the layout of the place just seemed off.  All in all, Brickhouse ain't bad, but it's not something to make a trip for, either.    By the way, I didn't intend to have a margarita that night, but given that the lemonade was chalky, I went ahead and added a few shots of Petron from a flask I had in my pocket.  Much better!  This is to say that I don't know if Brickhouse has good margaritas, but I certainly know how to make lemonade when life gives me lemons.

BbUuP-IfnIB_rVssrj7UEw.review_text: update: the homie is now my roommate aka sig other. when we're too lazy to cook and i don't want to go too far, i order take out from here. it's yummy, fast, easy. favorite for me: SOMA burger + garlic fries.

Xtck2uygtQ1vxHfgQGDg-Q.review_text: Rarely can they get there orders right. Unhelpful and unfriendly staff. Good location and food is good when done right. Time for new owners

ZcmAUjbvfCh2b_Reui1iRw.review_text: Why would you put a cranky person in the front as a hostess??    Anywho...our server was super cool.  My 10 year old daughter got the "Hangover Burger", LOL...She really enjoyed it!  That sucker was a monster...or BAB (Big Ass Burger) as the place advertises.  I got the Western burger with garlic fries...good garlic fries, very tasty burger!    Mom got Huevos Rancheros and said it was REALLY good.  She always gets that if it's on the menu and knows her huevos, says I.  GF got the chicken and brie sandwich...I think if they made this sandwich a panini and put a little bit of balsamic vinegar on it, it would be off the charts, but as a cold sandwich, it fell a bit flat.  Cool decor, hip place, not sure if I'll come back...I think I might like Frjtz better.

iIFkCL_89t9bWWAOVvhG8g.review_text: I'd rather spend $10 on Squat & Gobble's Salmon Cobb Salad.  I spent $10 on an Asian Salad........... AKA greens + canned mandarin oranges + some fried wonton skins.  Why is it $10...I don't see a large piece of grilled salmon in this thing...  Overpriced.

5KtOX6QV5Wxcd2onINvzxw.review_text: I'm starting to get my bearings in this neighborhood. I'm finding my favorite spots and go-to places for certain food. This place...might end up being my can't-make-up-my-mind old standby.  You want a burger...an ahi sandwich...a tuna melt...a bowl of soup...a steak...they have it all! Great selection, great food, full bar, nightly specials and a happy hour.  The food is reasonably priced, the service is good, there's never a wait.  What more can you ask for?!

6e1uUkq7Bc2qWIRL15GpRw.review_text: The veggie burger patty was much more flavorful than most. The toppings are pretty depressing though.  I didn't try any of the salads yet.  The service for lunch is a walk up and order like place, and the service for dinner is a "you should probably walk up and order because the waiter will never show up" like place.  They do have a full bar, so I imagine this is a great place for a more entertaining kind of lunch.

uZdFsE_aHbFBChgN6Xa8tw.review_text: This is a good place for brunch.  French toast was pretty good.  Reminds me of Los Gatos Cafe.  Service was pretty efficient and as long as there's no Giants game, there's plenty of (paid) parking.  This is a good place to have a low-key date since it's price friendly and casual.  I think brunch dates are better than drinks date because it's better value and during the daytime.

gd4MJcHnaGSTlJ0Q8N68QA.review_text: Friendly service. Went for brunch and got seating immediately! Food and drinks came out quickly and the huevos rancheros was excellent! We'll be back soon!

bPjw8wZ8ee5H2exOA_F4wA.review_text: With an atmosphere a bit swankier than average hipster fare, this place has a fabulous ambiance. Went for happy hour (4:30-6:30) and enjoyed $3 beers on tap (what a steal!) and tasty bar food (the garlic fries come with a VERY tasty sauce, and the fish tacos are well-seasoned and the ingredients are fresh, although the portion is small).  A light dinner and beers for 2 came out to $18. And it was chic to boot. I'll be coming back!

VxX_s8ayJXknerXLYYBSNA.review_text: I live in the neighborhood and probably eat here at least a couple of times a month, so this review is long overdue. I usually end up coming here on the weekends for dinner, although I have been here for brunch a few times.  This place provides a cozy atmosphere with its eclectic collection of cozy mismatched dining chairs, breadplates and artwork. I really enjoy tucking into one of the chairs, or booths and ordering a beer, burger or some comfort food. The burgers are fairly pricey for a hamburger; however as stated in previous reviews, they are of pretty good quality. Other favorite dishes of mine include the chicken and brie sandwich, pork chop and the pot pie.  On Friday and Saturday evenings, there is usually live jazz.

yF22nN7Sh9WIcbyR-MRd2w.review_text: I went to Brick House during off hours when it was empty, but i can see this place being lively.  The decor as many have pointed out is welcoming and.... well, woody.  Wood everywhere.    I can't remember the name of the sandwich i ordered, but it was delicious.  Coincidently i was on a plane flight the night before and a man asked where he could find a great sandwich in SF.  I was stumped then, but no longer.  Now i will recommend Brick House.

XEOa47yPIfy6cGYgD77F4Q.review_text: I bought some restaurant.com coupons and tried this place. The vibe was alright for a friday night (jazz music was playing for  a bit). We sat at the bar to wait for a table and ordered three drinks. One of which was tom collins. the bartender did not know how to make it and when she found out, used lemonade. So when we got our table, we ordered some garlic fries (that was good-not the best i've had), I had the Cow Tipper Dip (essentially french dip) and it was good.  The clam chowder tasted like mayo in it. Someone ordered the beer battered fish and chip (forgot their opinion on it) and another ordered the penne pasta with jumbo shrimp. the shrimp was quite big and good (that dish was alright, nothing memorable). The waitstaff was friendly for the most part. Bottom line, would I go back? yeah for a quick bar food grub.

0pb7fWD194iTqPMFAG5Oxg.review_text: I hadn't been to Brickhouse in nearly a year and coming back recently made me remember how much I love this place. They do a good job with everything--breakfast, lunch and after-work drinks.  They do egg whites without asking a second question which alone is worth a star. In a city that's so self righteous about being healthy I feel like it's pulling teeth to get them at so many breakfast places where you don't sit down. Their bagel sandwiches are good and they come out pretty quickly. Their coffee is good also.  Lunch options are varied and there are tons of veggie options.  They've also got a great bar and a good amount of beers on tap--including some nice local surprises. Whether you're looking for a place to do some work on your laptop for a few hours, grab a drink with friends or a quick sandwich you can't go wrong with this place.

SJLdFnlLrNbDzvauNZJncw.review_text: There is delicious food here if you can suffer through the miserably hipster disinterested attitudes of a good deal of the wait staff. The Big Ass Burger, Chicken & Brie sandwich, and their garlic fries are all fantastic. But what's the point of great food if you're treated poorly, ignored, or met with surly demeanor?   My latest experience was standing at the register to place a to-go order while the server sorted through credit card receipts... Place one here. Stick one there. Circle a total on this one. Shuffle. Re-sort. Done. Wander away with a sigh. Leaving me standing there, still. A waitress then approached, never made eye contact, and didn't seem interested in helping either. That's when I gave up and left empty handed.   I find it funny that in my time waiting there I had time to read and then reread their note on the register about requiring a $10 minimum on credit card transactions because "the economy the way it is and these transaction fees are killing us!" and found it funny. I'd figure patrons wandering out the door unhelped would be more of an issue.   This was one instance of 4 years worth of experiences with Brickhouse. Some experiences have been great, and the food, like I've said, is really quite wonderful. But good lord, the bad experiences really take their toll, and there is a consistent pattern of poor service here. It's really too bad.

WLmS2d9gdf2t8gbPlMnsRg.review_text: The food here is consistently awesome and the staff is always very friendly! I just wish the service were as consistent.   Its pretty hit or miss, depending on who's working. We had to ask for butter for our toast this morning. Also our soda glasses sat empty at the end of the table waiting for refills while our server walked by 3-4 times. Then when the bill came it was wrong but that's because there was confusion over what today's special was versus Saturdays.

TLiv7pKzS1ruZ4rD1ZzhJw.review_text: A solid 3.5 for our local joint Brickhouse. We've had brunch, lunch, and dinner here as it is probably no more than 200 steps away from our place.  Their scrambles and french toast are great for brunch and their burgers are very tasty for dinner (don't order the veggie burger though, that was extremely dry and tasteless) but their regular soma burger is AOK.  I love the fact that you can walk in without a reservation.  Friday nights are fun because they have a live jazz band playing near the lobby.

OzOqYZvfhUyrF9AwuAKOzQ.review_text: Great spot to stop for a morning latte (double = $3) or a breakfast sandwich to go. (about $3-$4).   I would venture back here for lunch and hang out. Great atmosphere inside and friendly staff.   I ordered up a bacon, egg and cheese on sourdough and it was delicious! I also tried a double hazelnut latte. Not so hazelnutty, but it was pretty yummy.  Only downer - credit card minimum is $10. Easily doable at lunch, not so much for bfast.  Cozy, affordable and yummy. Definitely a must!

2rsBcxUh5MM3tNJvkXAknQ.review_text: If I was limited to one word and a qualifier, I'd say Brickhouse Cafe & Bar is 'slightly eccentric'.  The feeling I get off the place is that it's kind of an at homey feel, part restaurant, part your living room.  It's comfortable and the food is good to boot.   Tip: read about how they catch their own salmon in Alaska - I was kind of impressed and loss a bet over it (hint: bet that its true)  I've visited for dinner and drinks a few times.  The prices can be described as 'not unreasonable' but not super cheap either.  I recommend the Blue Moon burger (blue cheese and buffalo sauce).  It's pretty darn fantastic.

JnGjZVSlfCkKHErvO5ts4g.review_text: Happy Hour~ Monday - Saturday. 4:30-6:30pm. $3 Drafts. $1 off Well Drinks. $2 off Bar Food Items. Given my past positive experiences at Brickhouse, happy hour here left me a bit disappointed. Complimentary bread with Sweet Herb Cream: (yelp.com/biz_photos/HCTO…) Free is always good! Buffalo Wings: (yelp.com/biz_photos/HCTO…) Best item we had. Good flavors. The meat fell easily off the bones. The breading was a bit thick. Combined with the buffalo sauce, made the wings a bit soggy. Garlic Fries: (yelp.com/biz_photos/HCTO…) Very starchy fries and lacking much needed flavor. Barely any garlic and cheese on it. Should've stuck with the regular fries. Jalapeno Poppers: (yelp.com/biz_photos/HCTO…) Probably store-bought from the freezer aisle. Way too much cream cheese with no jalapeno flavor. So it was like eating deep fried cream cheese. Never again. The plus side: bang for the buck. All the items above with 2 beers and a cider came out to under $25 before tips. Mental note: stick to lunch, brunch and come back to try dinner.

eYSWTXiLmZoeOq27rIXWJg.review_text: Cool place and great place to get lunch. I was introduced to this place by a good friend.  Sandwiches and salads appear to be their speciality. Kinda built in a unique industrial/home/restaurant space. It does provided you a very interesting atmosphere.   My order was good and satisfactory. However it was not one that I thought about for hours after eating. I had a great time discussion childhood memories with a friend and enjoying lunch.

uGhYbf_tDIGOVxK3hZbJ9g.review_text: On balance, we had a great experience. We went on Sunday morning and were lucky to have a table for 5 with no reservations.   Those that ordered breakfast were very happy.  Eggs, crispy potatoes and coffee all great.  Eggs Benedict & Biscuits and gravy also lovely.  The bacon was a little less than crispy even though we had asked for it extra cooked.  The breakfast special, huevos rancheros - were well enjoyed. One person ordered the veggie sandwich which was average.

Rgf9lI8RTU5q8-rc5wwklA.review_text: the food and drinks are nothing to write home about...they're good - just not anything that's really amazing. it's convenient (near AT&T), good service, will hit the spot if you're hungry and very friendly.

uWvGgJxcewrsxkcdNsbTzA.review_text: I love this place. Great food, great service, and great decor. I recommend the Bloody Mary's; it's better than most places and it's only $5! Great Scott! Everything breakfast is amazing especially the benedicts and biscuits and gravy.

PmrFSehNLWAn8pMWtB53Lg.review_text: Due to my childhood, the quintessential breakfast food will always be corned beef hash.   Why my childhood, you ask? Well, it all started with my father, and my father's experimental combinations involving canned goods and the spice rack. I won't go into detail but let's just say you can do some really interesting - and entirely legal - things with over-the-counter spices and canned spinach.   Now while Dad's efforts with foodstuffs were not always properly appreciated by his offspring, his hash was deservedly legendary and quite delicious. And now, because of that legacy, I am compelled to order corned beef hash if it shows up on the menu. And judge it by a very high standard.   Brickhouse's hash is lovely. The meat is shredded, not cubed, and wonderfully salty. It's breakfast comfort food at it's finest and I would happily return for more. The rest of breakfast was fine but not inspired.   Service was kind of inattentive, but not unkind. I would put this place on my list if I lived or worked closer, but it's not a 'go out of my way' winner.

XvOY_bk_KWqnqGvjwZxOxQ.review_text: Meh. Hunger makes you do weird things, like randomly stop in a place thats filled with bad decor. Perhaps its their lack of vegetarian options, or their weird "Stand-in-this-line-and-here's-your-number" format. If you're looking for something shockingly average, go here.

y6I7waddCQUpHKelJ9sC2g.review_text: I am always "that person" in my group of friends who is the most critical about restaurant food because I despise paying for food I can make better myself.  So it means a lot when I say I was pleasantly surprised by Brickhouse Cafe.  Based on the reviews I never would have thought to try it if it weren't for my Scoutmob coupon.  I came here for dinner Saturday evening and impressed by the first food item that appeared on the table -- the complimentary bread.  Fresh out of the oven, this baguette was so piping hot my fingers could barely hold it in place as I cut it in half.  When I pushed gently on the crust it made that fresh crackling noise and when I finally cut open the bread an eruption of steam accompanied the exposure of a delicate, chewy center.  The bread was served with an herb butter but the herb flavor was very subtle.    We tried the jalepeno crab dip appetizer, and I was impressed once again.  I so often get served seafood that is improperly marinated/seasoned, resulting in this unpleasant fishy aftertaste that makes me crave dessert afterwards.  That was not the case at Brickhouse.  The crab was prepared with the perfect amount of lemon juice and jalepeno and was not disgustingly mayonnaise-y as often is the case for dips.  To finish it off, the dip was topped with parmesan and bread crumbs and served with 4 slices of focaccia.  Heaven!  My friend got the Frenchy burger, served on a nice plump roll and topped with an over easy egg.  He was quite pleased.  I ordered the seared ahi tuna sandwich, which once again, had the right amount of acidity to counteract the potentially disgusting fishy flavor.  To my personal delight, the flavors of the asian marinade described on the menu were not very prominent and my only complaint was that the sandwich could've used twice the amount of fried onion and the chipotle aioli could've had more of a kick.  Both entrees were served with french fries that deserve a solid 4.5 stars - perfectly deep fried, not too dry, not too greasy.    Not only that, the service was excellent.  Our server was very friendly and our waters were refilled 6-7 times during the course of our meal.  My only complaint about this place is that their sandwiches and burgers are $1-2 overpriced, but that's SOMA for you.  Still a solid place overall.  Thanks Scoutmob for directing me to Brickhouse Cafe!

OJPU-VZn7jFSMvsuKU0ypw.review_text: This place is great! The decor is super cute. Theres tons of different goodies to look at but it's not too overwhelming.   I've been there twice for breakfast. Both times it was delicious. The crowd is young and fun and they have a great Sunday brunch. I think the mimosas were $3 and the bloody marys were $5. I had a bloody Mary and it was super spicy and delicious.   I had the average joe breakfast one time and the eggs benedict another time. One of my eggs was cooked through so you might want to emphasize that you don't want your eggs cooked too much.   My boyfriend had the cornbeef hash and loved it!   I live and work in the area and I'm definitely planning in becoming a regular here!

Ol1WRYPs5wbiMRs6MzO4Wg.review_text: Our office just moved to the neighborhood and a bunch of us went to check it out for lunch based of previous reviews.  They recommend the Mexican burger which was a burger with chopped tomatoes and avocado on top. Lame.  The meat quality was terrible. It tastes like a burger from Nob Hill grocery store frozen food section. The bun was stale.  It came with French fries that were terrible.  Not sure where all these great reviews of their food are coming from. Apparently the Yelp reviewers have no taste. I mean come on - Burger King is better than this place.  As if the food wasn't bad enough, the service sucked. Ordered a tea and told to serve myself at the bar (pitcher of tea on top). So I helped myself and had some of the help yell across the the restaurant for pouring my own tea. You would have thought I just stole some money from the register.  I don't give bad reviews for shitty service because we all have bad days. I don't mind bad service as long as the food is great. So these guys get 1 star for crappy food.  Save money and go to McDonalds instead.

Zit8YhfIvPhc2V-OfHVbaw.review_text: Go for it is what I say, you will not regret it. Went there months ago for the first time & had their pulled pork bennies aka eggs benedict. Sounds odd I know but its delicious with their roasted taters. A dish full of flavor. Went to SF yesterday for the ferry building farmers market, could've ate there but had to get us those bennies. That's how good they are especially with their mimosas.

4rscUhRnHPie0Uv3VEcoOQ.review_text: I had the experience of freelancing directly across the street from Brickhouse for three months and treated myself to the best darned veggie melt ever. I am NOT a vegetarian, in fact the thought terrifies me, however I saw someone eating it and I couldn't resist.   When I'm in the area I go back especially for it: mmmmmmm.  I have no idea about anything else in there, I just give 5 stars in honor of the man who prepares this delectable specimen of a meat-free lunch for under $10: I love you!

KB19vV-uwDxfYIfnNIcbZQ.review_text: Love having this place I'm my neighborhood!!! Very good place for a burger and a beer.

b3mKOYkOBDqogUENT1ba2w.review_text: I guess you could call me a regular here.  I am here at least once a week, not because it's amazing but because it's very close to where my friends and I live.  It's the fallback for when we're too lazy to explore.  One of the waitresses is great, she's usually the one who serves us, but the other ones are either a million miles away or have a really shitty attitude.  They sometimes have a jazz trio some nights.  I am completely neutral on their content, but they are just a little too loud for the size of the place.  If I wanted to eat listening to random music instead of talking to friends, I'd eat at home listening to the radio.  I've had a couple of meals here that were very poorly prepared.  This is the exception and not the rule, but severely under cooking hamburger meat is not something I take lightly.  They used to have a much better menu, but these days it's pretty much a burger joint with a couple sandwich and other options.  There is a bar, but not much selection for a beer drinker.  My favourite meal here is weekend brunch.  Their omelets are pretty good, and being walking distance sure helps!

Kgi-p4JW_GSlsWSN-25ySA.review_text: I passed out from all the sprout lovin inside the 'Brickhouse Melt'  The end.

ljHsu7YzZmN7JaNrI9aciQ.review_text: Went there looking for happy hour fun.  Smelled like the type of delicious food I'd like to eat, but we had just eaten.  Pretty empty, but the few older individuals  sitting at the bar looked to be regulars, and neither they or staff acknowledged us.  So we left.

1kpMAKRZuAz3OzxBav3XTg.review_text: Though the menu would mylinate cells with its grease content, it's longer than my college roommate's list of lovers. And much more eager to please. The hooch and beer selection are nothing to go nuts over, but the happy hour shoots high: $3 microbrew drafts, discounted well drinks and nosh, and of course $2 PBR all day, everyday.  A quirky mishmash of random interesting things, what they're going for isn't really clear. The chalkboarded question of the day was, "who coined the word 'quark'? You get the idea. If you care to know, it was Joyce in Finnegans Wake.  Come here to Hoover down a meal or quaff away and you'll leave in contentment.

nUms0RzJFJsqlR_VkjrSuw.review_text: A different kind of review - my friend made a 15-person bday dinner reservation, and they gladly accepted the large party, and we received the upstairs patio area all to ourselves.  A bartender/server was assigned just to us, and her service was top notch from the pre-dinner drinks at bar to dinner service.  The food was just ok.  My ribs were a bit burnt, but the meat was tender.  A few people ordered their burgers "medium-rare," and the burgers came as more medium and well done.  Ironically, the one guy who requested "whatever the chef thinks is good" got his burger exactly medium rare - its always nice to brown-nose the chef!  Great specials for the drinks - $2 Pabst and $5 reds.  Otherwise, the shots for the bday folks were the standard $10 per.  Being able to get the upstairs patio was definitely a big plus so we could play musical chairs to chitchat without having to yell across the long table - which we did anyways because it was that kind of bday party.

jFklPUhCb3X1MQOc_nuwdQ.review_text: It can be a bit busy during the lunch and dinner rush, but otherwise it is a great place. The food is good, and the prices are reasonable. I usually get the burgers and salads which are good.  Sometimes there are bands playing live music which really adds to the environment.

VvRQkhRG9UwQwnJWIMi8Ww.review_text: Now, I was genuinely excited about giving this local hotspot a try. I just moved to SOMA and live right around the corner. I was meeting my boyfriend who was just a few minutes behind me. I walked in to a semi-busy Sunday afternoon close to 2pm.  I missed the "Wait to be seated" sign and headed for the bar. Mimosa was in order and I was ready to see the food selection. The bartender was rude and said I should wait to be seated up front. Eek, sorry, nice to see you too! She seemed more annoyed that I missed the protocol. The BF showed up and we ordered. Service was fairly prompt but missing utensils which my BF procured. That shouldn't have happened. The huevos rancheros where mediocre at best. I've had better in the Mission District which where I moved from. I will give them another try with better staff. Every restaurant deserves a second chance for two star service. It could have been an off day. I love the ambiance and the decor. The location, of course, is convenient and I love that there were folks meandering about outside. It was cozy but the service could be stepped up. Never make a patron feel like they are inconveniencing you! Never a feeling I like.

eIa4QJXp5ZNmuFORnuPvDA.review_text: Alright.. bumped it up a star because the *Chicken Brie* was pretty damn good. Albeit a little small. But you get a nice light house salad with just the right amount of balsamic dressing. The focaccia bread is just dense enough, great crunch to it, and the chicken moist. Slices of apple add a bit of sweetness and counter the brie nicely. Solid stuff.

-nRX-ozd8JFJRrJCp4hLuw.review_text: Ate here with some friends a couple weeks ago.  The food was delicious and came out quick. You order at the counter, the cashier was really friendly and answered questions we had.  Highly recommend the Kobe Burger and Garlic fries.

ey6Q_D0IU0WnrK_akj68bw.review_text: I went here a while back and the food and service were great... but I went back recently and the food was horrible and the service sucked... So im left scratching my head on this one.  Maybe I need to go back a third time to figure it out haha  They just couldn't cook poached eggs, whoever was cooking that day needed to call in sick because my eggs benny were nasty

xMNS7Ryl1ptKLE9Ki5Zw1Q.review_text: Decent place.  I would probably give 3.5 stars if it let me.    I like the atmosphere, the food doesn't blow you away, but its alright.    Mostly its just a cool spot and good value.

Zn8tgekH0oCfyk4SUtygoA.review_text: I walked here during the lunch rush based on a recommendation. They took our order in only a few minutes, and it was ready for us in only a few more minutes.  My salmon, caught by the owner himself!?!?!, sandwich was freaking awesome. Cooked perfectly rare, fresh, huge, tasty with some kind of slaw topping and crunchy fresh bread. Delicious and enough for lunch and dinner combined! Plus, they offer espresso and the double I had, hit the spot for me.  I highly recommend it.

pH5y9wmSPDF_ffhc5SOCkA.review_text: I've always wanted to love the Brickhouse.  It is cute, the price is right, and it is semi by CalTrain and the ball park. It is a great meet up spot.  So, for my 30th birthday barcrawl, it was the perfect dinner meet up.  We had someone with us that was a friend of a friend and he completely broke down in the restaurant.   Totally uncool.  The way the staff reacted?  Perfectly.  They got the guy a cab that would take credit cards and take him to San Jose, and they were nice to us in the process.  Tthey never lost their cool, they never even got upset.  They hadn't served this guy at all and he was now their problem.  I would have murdered someone.  I kinda felt like murdering myself, really.  How uncool are we?  But the important point is how cool they were.    They also handled one of my other friends perfectly.  They cut her off upon arrival and she really was having none of it.  After pulling me aside and telling me the plan they "un-cut-her-off" and served her virgin drinks all night.  It was the perfect way to handle a belligerent drunk.   Three off us didn't get to eat as we were busy playing disaster management.  The food is great reheated.    Sometimes the service here is slow.  But I've never, EVER seen any staff react better to disaster.  We suck, they rock.  I wish I could do more than tip huge and five star yelp review this - they took a terrible situation and made sure we didn't feel any worse about it than we had to.  Thank you, Brickhouse.  Thank you.  Thank you.

Qu9EHdFbrYXQECwl-tGq9A.review_text: 3 buck mimosas and yummy vegetarian food makes Jennifer Tang a happy woman (among other things =P).   Came here for brunch with some friends before the Giants game and it was the perfect spot. Walking distance to the stadium, cheap drinks (or well, mimosas at least - but what else do you need on a Sunday morning?), and yummy food (they had vegetarian chili!). Oh - and supposedly there was also live music but I am so oblivious that I didn't notice until my friends started talking about him...which by then,  he was already done playing and so all I got to really enjoy was a recording of what he had just finished playing live.   Next time I will make sure to turn on my Jack Bauer skills so I'm more aware and can enjoy the live music...although...it would probably also help if I wasn't hungover from the night before.

obt4ZTH5xxtHhBdRzUzLWQ.review_text: Over the years Brickhouse has been in a state of evolution. They are finally dialing in their food and I have to say I'm impressed.  Breakfasts and Afternoons it's cafe style, walk up to the bar and order food. After 5pm though it's sit down service --- you can still order to-go and all that, but the vibe is different, it's nice and chill and the menu is extensive.  Try out their dinner and happy hour items, they are really great. I am proud of Brickhouse and what it has become thanks to Fred and his loyal staff. Show some love for this Soma staple.

UJngxJRlxTMX0TJndsHb8Q.review_text: Good atmosphere, love the decor, a bit pretentious on occasion, like you should be happy that they are serving you. But on the whole, I enjoy it there every time. Seating is difficult to find at lunch time, so have a friend go scout a place to squat.   The burgers are juicy and delish, on a soft bun Fudrucker's style, just not grilled, but they are so freaky tasty. Fries are good. No decent mayo for dipping, can't remember if they had ranch...  Other foods I've had there are a bit standard, nothing special. Today, I ordered the Ham Broccoli and Cheddar Quiche. Didn't taste that much cheese, and it definitely needed to be heated up in the middle more, still too hard and lukewarm.   Also, the salad was a bit dry. I know no one likes soppy salad, but this was almost dry.   Anywhoo, still waiting to be totally sold on anything but the burger, but that could be enough for now.   Final note, I saw a chocolate shake this guy picked up and it loooooked oh so good. And make sure to order your drink at the bar on the way to order your food.

OdBdt2-gnbJLcjvyQ-0MZQ.review_text: I really enjoyed my breakfast/brunch at Brickhouse. The original plan was to go to Mama's but the line outside was insane so we went to Brickhouse instead. Parking was easy (although we got a $74 ticket for not paying the meter on a Sunday *thumbs down*) luckily so we were able to hop right in. The restaurant was pretty full (we arrived around noon) but there was only a 10 minute wait which was fine for us since it gave us some time to look at the menu since it was our first time. I ordered one pancake, one egg and a side of bacon with a vanilla latte. I loved everything I ordered! The eggs had a really great flavor and were cooked perfectly, the bacon was superb and the pancake also had great flavor and was just the right size. I live for a good vanilla latte and Brickhouse didn't disappoint, although my only wish was that the mug was a wee bit bigger because I was still yearning for more to the point that I almost ordered a second one. My friend ordered the cowboy combo with a pancake on the side. I tasted a few of the potatoes from my friend's plate and they were spectacular. The seasoning used was really good and gave the potatoes a nice kick so I'd say they were probably some of the best breakfast potatoes I've ever had.  Overall, I would go back to Brickhouse and recommend it to others. The atmosphere of the restaurant was chill, parking was easy (pay the meter!), the prices were reasonable and the food was really good in my opinion.

ffHLvzZhy24ZQBjnhgn0FQ.review_text: Met a friend here for lunch. Ordered a big ass burger with garlic fries and an iced tea.   The place was crowded and you have to order then try and find a place to sit.   The burger and garlic fries was good. Service was great and friendly. I would come back.

m_8jyyegatTVii3ZysDU3g.review_text: I can only reliably give the burger 4 stars, because that is the only thing I have ever eaten here. I never want to try anything else because if I'm here, it's because I thought to myself, "Hm. What should I eat for dinner? I feel like a burger. Mmmm, Brickhouse!" The only problem is that they haven't been cooking my burger correctly lately. I get the small burger and my boyfriend gets the regular size. We both ask for medium rare. His is always under done, and mine is always over done. I assume it is because we order different size burgers to the same degree of done-ness and their cook freaks out about getting them finished at the same time. Nonetheless, this is something they should work on. Otherwise, yum! The ground beef is from the owner's family farm and they are never crowded for dinner because they're in SOMA and no one (except for my boyfriend) actually LIVES there.

NooqeG39MncaFiekMTmXjg.review_text: Service has definitely improved in the past few months- +1 star for now- more to come if they keep up the great work!

o03ZwIhEEbKLxffxBmcuUw.review_text: Over the past couple of years I've been here maybe 10 or 12 times, and it seems like every time there has been something wrong. It's never anything serious, just annoying stuff like being out of the dish I was going to order or being understaffed. The food is decent enough and affordable, but I've never found myself thinking "man I really need some Brickhouse right now". Best part of the place is the live jazz musicians in the evening, who do a great job. I definitely wouldn't bring a group of more than 4 here as seating is really hard to come by, both at lunch and dinner.

gYiVnM66H6VOKmc2oxSu3A.review_text: The food is good, the service is super friendly, and the location can't be beat (particularly if you work next door, which I do!)  I've eaten pretty much every meal here - weekday breakfast, lunch, weekend brunch, dinner.  Each meal has been consistently good.  Not blow you away awesome, but solidly good.  The prices are decent as well!

ptLIFLUPwg3MYt-J62s3iA.review_text: One day in the future while on my deathbed, I'll be thinking of that plate of fish n chips. Those artery clogging pieces of deep fries fish parts and equally as heart attack causing french fries.  It was here, the Brickhouse where we sat and drank beers and scarfed down some of the best food that will kill you later you're gonna find anywhere.  The service was 5 star attentive and never did they let us (even for a moment) have an empty glass on the table. And just to be sure that my future was written, our server brought out a plate of house made potato chips (gratis). Wash those tasty treats down with an ice cold IPA to perfection.  An easy walk to the ballpark.  I say, skip Momo's and come here...it's just better.

1MmK-SHJFLASAJ2Hj-GGZw.review_text: Although a little pricey, the quality of the foods is definitely up there . I would recommend their sandwiches and beer on tap, but hold off on the over priced coffee drinks.

vTugBdYg34rX4KvGpzBrNA.review_text: My update to my update is that this place rocks again in my book. Since my last update warning customers of their order mess ups, I now see a complete difference. Everything thing I've/my company has ordered has come out perfect- nothing missing, everything tasting great!   Cheers, considering I have to pick up large orders on a weekly basis from you!

GMV7p76V-lDaEeXgnxdY1g.review_text: Hidden gem! Great food, great atmosphere, great music. The only reason I didn't rate this place 5 stars was because they brought my food out a lot sooner than my husbands. I was practically done with my food by the time he received his. Otherwise this would have been 5 stars hands down.

1q4sB7WNmtQcFVigJppg5Q.review_text: I LOVE this place for weekend brunch! Cheap ($3 big glasses of mimosas), delicious, big portions, oh and they have live music now! Some guy in a cowboy hat and guitar plays cover songs of pop, rock, you name it. He's really good too! They also have such a friendly and down to earth interior that makes you feel like instantly at home.   The first time I came here, I ordered a shrimp avocado omelet that was to die. My bf always orders The Country Western omelet or corned beef hash - and judging by his reaction after the first bite, I'd say they're pretty bomb. I go with the Odyssey omelet (with artichoke hearts!) or try one of the salads. Just FYI - they're known for their "Big Ass Burger" so don't come here and order a salad! It's still large and colorful, and I'm pretty surprised that a burger place can still deliver on the nutritional side.  Onwards to dessert - we ALWAYS come here for the Vanilla Bean French Toast. My bf would eat this everyday if he could. It comes with a couple scoops of vanilla ice cream to top the delicious french toast. This is probably what gets us to come back here so often since   Service, food, overall atmosphere are all wins - I love this neighborhood brunch place! I'll be back for their weekly happy hours too.

6iQF02aNgeOk8s8dougtKA.review_text: The live band was great, but service was entirely too slow. We went on Saturday, I'm guessing after a Giants game. It took about 10 mins standing at the host stand, 20mins before water and 15mins before we ordered our food (it wasn't even crowded). I only ordered a cocktail, but my friend said the turkey burger was good. yelp.com/biz_photos/HCTO… I won't be coming back. The combo of slow service and drunk sports fans turned me off.

8Bc5qJYYT1Vl3SImCR5lGQ.review_text: I have been to Brickhouse many times.  The food is good average food.  The waiters and waitresses are down to earth and provide good service.  I was there for breakfast for the first time.  I ordered Biscuits and Gravy.  During the breakfast, I asked for more gravy.  When the bill came, I was surprised I was charged $3.00 for extra gravy on the breakfast.  I still like the restaurant, but this leaves a bad spot in their reputation.  I will continue to frequent the restaurant but instead of once every couple of weeks, I may just take some time between the next visit.  Perhaps, once every couple of months would be more appropriate.

dvuZT5op7JiUkJqIiCEjwQ.review_text: Went here to have lunch before the Giants Game. This place is fantastic. It is a smaller place so if you come on game day expect a wait as you get closer to game time. I had the Small Ass Burger (seriously that is what it is called on the menu) it was very good, very flavorful and moist and it was overcooked slightly. The fries were also very good as well, they has a light crisp to them that did not make them feel greasy or heavy. The staff was so friendly and kept checking to make sure that we had everything that we needed.   Also provided coffee while you wait.

DvcAC_nlKaTDsHcA8Slagw.review_text: An eclectic Western-ranch themed eatery worth a stop in before a Giants game for some pre-game action but make sure you have some extra time to spare because it might take a little longer.   Stopped by for happy hour before heading onwards to AT&T Park and it was pretty packed when we walked in the door at 6pm. A little confusing to wait to be seated when there weren't any staff at the door acknowledging the various groups of folks lingering around the entrance. Eventually we got seated at the communal table by the bar.     They have various happy hour specials (3-7pm) including select pints for $4 and $6 bites like chicken wings, fish tacos, and fried calamari. We opted for the pitcher and nachos combo - a quintessential pre-game combo for $23. Brickhouse's take on nachos uses potato chips and pulled pork with blue cheese, cheddar, jalapeños, and pico de gallo. The chips stayed crunchy and there was a nice balance of flavors with  the pulled pork and cheeses against the jalapeños and salsa. Washed down with some Lagunitas and we were all set for the ballgame.   Our server was absolutely lovely but you could tell she was swamped and overwhelmed. In fact, the whole place was severely understaffed for the sudden mass of humanity before the game. Still, I would love to come back to try their burgers. Till the next game day I suppose. Go Giants.

qVCGzJCDnjwut1dnHef2Og.review_text: I wanted to go into this place for a long time - beautiful red brick walls and old wood inside. I always ended up at Bacar when that was around. So today I went in with some friends and a little one.   I got the veggie chili and grilled cheese sandwich. UGH! bad move on the chili and worse move on the grilled cheese sandwich - it had 2 diff kinds of flavorless cheese with hot house tomatoes and pesto. I should've ordered the burger - that looked good.   The little guy got the peanut butter and banana sandwich with fries. Good thing he 'shared' some of his sandwich with me - it was delicious with a little jam.   Because sharing is caring, at least that's what we tell the 4 year old.   Our waiter was nice, maybe a little clueless taking away an iced tea mid way through the meal like he's done with it, but he was at least interesting and a good guy. He brings it up to 3 stars. My guess from the crowd is that other items on the menu are better, just don't order the grilled cheese with pesto. Does that sound good to anyone?

VYo58Cn6YMie1-Kq0djjMQ.review_text: Chose this place by reading the menu online, was hoping for a good place. Luckily found out it's amazing. Most definitely will be back.

-JQWn7dNVHLwrbrk8f-mzA.review_text: Great place!!  I loved the ribs and mac and cheese there.  They had a great assortment of Belgian beers as well, which was quite nice.  I had a few bites of the burger and it was REALLY good.  Not sure if I'll get a burger next time or the Chicken Pot Pie...   The decor was really nice and comfortable.  "Old School" even with antique style furniture that made me feel like I was getting home cooking in an ancient home with wooden floors and furnishings.    The staff was very pleasant and the service was great.  I definitely want to go back a few times to see if they are worthy of 5 stars...

dXDfeAvvoZ0nqhNmHkt5Ug.review_text: Surprisingly awesome spot for breakfast. I like how simple and inexpensive their breakfast offerings are -- I don't always want all those breakfast sides. Great atmosphere for a breakfast/brunch joint, eclectic and sunny. Fun, funky decor and staff.

cCPjASKs5YpMB4BmN2oSZg.review_text: Feel free to recommend Brickhouse to looking for a good burger and pleasant service, whether or not it's baseball season. Our server was excellent, keeping up with our party of three despite our varying arrival and departure times in the midst of pre-Giants game business.   The Brickhouse Wagyu Beef burger had motivated me to recommend this as our meeting spot. Honestly, this burger list (blog?) of mine may never be completed. Anyway, a premium half-pounder with cheddar and bacon absolutely should've hit the spot. For $17, I was expecting a lot, but not all of my expectations were met.
