The only "big-ass" part of the burger was the amount of cheese, which was plentifully gooey.   The patty was a little overcooked, which may have prevented me from tasting its unique flavor. Although let's be honest, their Wagyu/Kobe claim is bogus. Read a detailed review on Forbes about the hype. That kind of beef heritage doesn't have proof of 100% compliance in lineage and methods.  My friends ordered the french dip (Cow Tipper Dip) and fish & chips. The french dip was good for a french dip, though I've never been a fan; she thought it was quite good, however, and to her point the meat was moist but not runny. The fish and chips also got a sign of approval, with garlic fries subbed in for just another dollar...good call on his part.  Brickhouse's biggest selling point to me before games, or any time, is its low beer prices: many bottles and drafts are in the $3-4 range. Cheap beer and great service can't be beat. I think I might come back for brunch before a day game.

JKIkdVqAJLEXTq92gF98bA.review_text: With my beef ban officially over, my first weekend of "freedom" was unexpectedly beef heavy.  After going to Burger Bar on Friday night, I found myself at Brickhouse for my friend's birthday dinner.  Even though they offer several beef alternatives, I had to give their burger a shot considering a whole sheet of the menu was devoted to it.  (side note: since that weekend, I haven't had much beef...talk about overkill...).  Like Burger Bar, Brickhouse gives you the option of tailoring a burger to your liking (albeit with less options).  Given that I already made my own the night before, I decided to give my brain a break and go with one of theirs so that I could try something different.  I ended up ordering the Frenchy Burger (served open face with a fried egg, grilled pancetta, swiss and chipotle aioli) and quickly realized that it was fairly similar to what I had at Burger Bar.  Whoops.  If nothing else, my taste buds are pretty consistent.    When our plates were served, I noticed that my burger looked a little dark, but I didn't think too much of it since we were trying to make sure everyone got the dish they ordered.  Taking that first bite though, it was pretty obvious why it was so dark - overcooked.  I ordered my burger between medium rare and medium, but I ended up getting it a touch past medium well instead.  Now, I generally don't send plates back (can't remember the last time I did, if ever), but I thought about it this time.  Seeing as how my friends around me were complaining about the same problem though, I figured there wouldn't have been much of a point.  Being overcooked, a lot of the burger's juiciness and flavor were gone, and it didn't even taste like it had been seasoned very well.  The egg was nice and I liked the pancetta flavor, but it was just way too salty and overwhelmed everything else.  The sides didn't do much for me either.  The truffle mashed potatoes didn't taste like truffle, and the fries and onions were average - not great but not bad.  I thought the truffled fried polenta bricks were decent though.  The best part of the meal for me was the upstairs loft where we were seated; given the large size of our party (roughly 20 in total), it was nice to have the area to ourselves.  The food was just too disappointing for me though - overcooked (my friend's ribs had some serious char) and relatively bland.  I see people have said some nice things about their brunch, so maybe that would be worth checking out one day, but I don't think I need to come back for dinner.  Even though they might be cheaper than Burger Bar, I'd rather pay more for something I like better (or go to Serpentine for a comparable price and a better burger).  TWO AND A HALF stars for the food, but rounding up since I liked the vibe of the place.  [EDIT]:  Scratch that, upon further consideration, I'm thinking two stars is more appropriate.

Bp9wc211LRKGCUd7rY1J2g.review_text: I think the only reason I made my way to Brickhouse was because of the restaurant.com coupon that could be found on... you guessed it, restaurant.com After being seated we waited what seemed like forever to have a server come around and take our order. Since we had to spend a minimum of $50 we started off with the calamari and chicken wings. Make a note, the server had handed us a happy hour menu in addition to the regular menu in which we made the appetizer selections off of. We found out later that we did not in fact get the happy hour prices for these said appetizers, we were also too lazy to complain and just wanted to leave when we finished eating. Furthermore, when the wings came, they seemed like they were drenched in ketchup and bbq sauce. I have yet to really find a place with some decent wings that I would care to revisit. One day I will find some really great bbq wings in the city, but until then... Calamari was nothing to swoon over as well. I could have sworn some of the pieces didn't even contain any meat at all. I think some of them were just breading molded into little circular shapes and fried. For the main course I settled on the chicken and brie sandwich. (crisp apples, red onions, and basil pesto aioli on foccacia bread) On paper the sandwich just sounds really good, but reality begs to differ. I'm not that super picky now, but the sandwich was pretty disappointing. At least I had the garlic fries to munch on the side, which I admit were pretty decent if not good.  In addition, we had ordered off their "specials" for the day. We asked the server how it was before ordering and he just kinda looked at us like ehhhhhhhhhhh. He said they usually get to taste the specials of the day, but for some odd reason he didn't try this one on this particular day and therefor could not speak for it. Well well well, we figured we'd just try it since it did sound good. Like before though, what looks good on paper is one thing. Now we know why the server gave us the face to begin with. The end.

2o1pRhec0img-_AE7K1QPg.review_text: I used to love this place.  I live in the neighborhood and I used to come here at least once every other week from 2010 through 2012, especially for brunch on Sundays.  It seems like last year there was an ownership change, or some other kind of significant event.  The menu changed dramatically, prices went up a lot (they'd been climbing quickly in the previous months), and overall quality of food and service took a nose dive.  I tried to go back to Brickhouse a few more times since then, but always left disappointed.

Z_oZxwoAP6pxKuiXSPF23Q.review_text: During the week brunch service is a little different than on the weekends.  During the week you order at the counter and then grab a table and have your food brought to you.  On the weekends it's pure table service.  I think the service can be a little slow sometimes on the weekends for brunch.  Since it is a seat-yourself situation and sometimes we slip in a little unnoticed I can understand why, but the staff seem to recognize locals and do their best to accommodate.  At least for me and my boy they do.  In the summertime the upstairs is sweltering hot and uncomfortable and in the winter sitting near the front door downstairs is cold.  The booths are good if you can grab one.  Bennies are smallish but tasty, go for the regular and not the Florentine.  The menu is slightly different from weekdays to weekends also, so plan accordingly.  Bennies = weekends, pancakes = all week, bagels = weekdays.  Coffee, if you aren't getting it to go, is served in gigantic cups.     All in all a solid place when you are hungry at 10 AM, in SOMA and don't want to walk to Delancey.  Don't expect a 5 star experience and you won't be disappointed.  And don't grab that table in front of the stairs.  That's mine.

poDRvJanG6W4MDxoB_Pkig.review_text: Came to Brickhouse last night after raving to my mom about the cow tipper dip sandwich. We'd spent the whole day making trips in a Uhaul and we were dying for this magic French Dip that would sooth away our moving aches and pains. When we got there the atmosphere was as inviting as ever. The live gypsy swing music set the stage and I felt welcomed as always in this little gem I love. I ordered a well deserved beer and began perusing the menu for my hankering. The menu was jumbled and slightly hard to read so I studied it, like, really hard. I'm looking and looking and LOOKING. And my beloved sandwich is nowhere to be found. My heart sinks, I break the news to my mom and we both begin to search for the next best thing we could find. I ordered the pork chop and my mom ordered the chicken sandwich, both of which were delicious, but they weren't that French dip we came here for. How could you take that off the menu Brickhouse? It's what I tell people to go there for!  Call me when the French dip is back in the menu.   TL:DR: Great food, great atmosphere, great music, great service, NO FRENCH DIP, NO DICE.

4i5MZHyB9Lj1jd_cfkN74w.review_text: Definitely use Scoutmob for 50% off!  4 stars for the amazing live guitarist playing on Sunday and the great service they have provided us.  They always refilled my coffee whenever it I was low.  Tried the Vanilla Bean French Toast and liked it.  Definitely one of the better French Toasts that I've ever had.  Bathrooms were conveniently located in the center of the restaurant so we could see the line when there was one.    Good Atmosphere and a great place to take someone on a first date.    I would come back for sure some day with my friends.

n0tt_s85lrPra3gzzSTZNA.review_text: Brickhouse is a mishmash of cozy tables, a bar, semi-lit booths, larger tables, and someone's eclectic living room furniture...and sometimes there is a band right in the front! Overall, it's cozy and warm and a great place to come in from the cold and indulge in comfort food.  Yes, there is beer. Yummy yummy beer. Some local, some not, all quite good! There is also an extensive alcohol/drink list that you can too easily get lost in. With your beer, why not try the veggie sandwich or vegan burger! Both are good sizes and not too heavy!.I think the sandwich actually wins out taste-wise, but sometimes you just gotta have a burger. I've seen fries but have only had the side salad which is adequate but really, only mixed greens with olive oil and balsamic vinegar? But the fries, if someone at your table gets them and you are forced to dine in their presence...look pretty good! Probably not as good as Source fries or the yummy sweet potato fries you can get at Barney's, but still pretty good!  In sum, warm, cozy, tasty, and friendly service.   Note: dine here with a cute boy and if you are lucky the experience will be exceptionally cozy!

e9UPHIeBJ54Z4kaaGSW7yQ.review_text: Wow. All I can say... The deliciousness of this unassuming SOMA treasure is just, wow.   The Brickhouse has been a breakfast favorite for my bf and I for awhile now.   Him: steak and eggs. Hits the spot every time.  Me: anything with those delicious potatoes. Yum!!  Last night though, we used our Yelp! iPhone app to find a local place for ribs... and to our surprise, the Brickhouse popped up! Hmmm... we've never had anything but breakfast... let's give this a go!  So we threw on some jeans & sweatshirts and moseyed on over. Turns out there's live jazz & blues on Thursday & Friday evenings, which was a delight!   Ok, down to the details: Him: ribs, French fries, cole slaw, and this mac n cheese duplicate dish = ahhh-mazing Me: vodka peach pork chop with golden polenta grits & veggies = foodgasm in my mouth. I literally was scooping the leftover sauce up with a spoon to get every last drop.   This local breakfast fav of ours is now a fav for all occasions.

a0G4ZMN2jScFevRzzLafCw.review_text: SOMA Burger, how I love you.  I don't care for the weekend brunch wait, but I love the less-than-2-blocks-from-my-house location; I love the space; and I love the bar.

o4oHQtdw-y8gknqQtTvfqQ.review_text: I love going here Sunday mornings because of their Salmon Benedict plate. Absolutely Delicious. You will have to wait 10-30 minutes to get a seat since this place is usually packed at this time, worth the wait!

flVEzS0EcFHW1eKgSdSfEg.review_text: I've been here twice so far, and I will not return again.   The atmosphere is neat, and I really like the music the two times I've been (live performance by a guy in the corner). I think these are independent musicians that come in to play in the morning, but the two times I've been the music is great. That is where the good parts end.  The first time I went, the service was incredibly slow. I chalked it up to a fluke, even though they weren't busy on that visit. I came in today, and it wasn't just slow, it was absurd. From sitting down, it took 10 minutes before a cup of water showed up, another 15 minutes for the server to show up (who was also manning the bar), and then another 20 minutes before coffee showed up. Coffee was 'meh', and its a very small cup.   The food was decent as far as breakfast fare goes, with the highlight being the bacon which was great. I've had the biscuits and gravy and corn beef hash on my two visits, and both are fine. My wife's breakfast was missing butter for the pancakes, and I'm sure they would've corrected that if our server (or anyone) had come within eye contact distance so we could ask.   The awful service brought me to the point of anger, as I really wanted this place to be good. After this visit, I will never return. The two stars are grudgingly done only because of atmosphere and music.

uNIyxmljF0IVuVEifJNQ6g.review_text: My team and I had a very early morning meeting with my mentors and old coworkers from a previous company and we zipped over to Brickhouse for a bite to eat an insight into startup success.  I decided to give the breakfast croissant sandwich of ham and Swiss a try to kick start my morning power hour.  As a sandwich, it was decent enough but I was disappointed that it came with absolutely nothing else.  It would have been great to get some potatoes or a fruit cup or something to round out the meal but the croissant stood sadly alone.  However, others in our party had some more serious issues such as uncooked eggs, errors with the orders, and just rude service overall.  The cafe was slammed by World Cup fans watching the USA game and totally understaffed to handle the high volume of the day.  It took quite a long while to actually order and receive the food in this crowded cafe, and the overall dining experience was sub-par.  Their WiFi didn't even work as promised either making my site demo totally useless.  I know SF restaurants can get a good breakfast done better than this and I was quite disappointed that Brickhouse let us down.  Hopefully there are some great cafes in the area to try next time I meet up with our talented, entrepreneurial mentors.  Food: 4/10  Service: 3/10  Price: $  Atmosphere: 7/10

6E1gGcJdlCh_l1LJzn2ckg.review_text: Really good burgers! They have a wide selection and at lunch you can order at the counter to get in and out quickly. The menu also has some home style favorites they offer. The only issue I have ever had was ordering a plate that I asked what came on it since it was a special and it turned out completely different.  Overall though if you don't go during the rush times you'll have a great experience and some delicious food! Their BBQ sauce is delicious.

vjWMqGJ9bJpUQ_1t44IuTQ.review_text: Yet another spot on the SoMa lunch tour!  Takeout ordering is fast and friendly. The food is a mixed bag, though...  First time here I had the chicken brie sandwich and a salad. It was pretty tasty. The second time I had the cow tipper dip -- not as good. The sandwich was extremely dry, to the point where even dipping it in the provided au jus sauce didn't really help matters. It would have been good if they had cooked it for like two minutes less. Fries were tasty though.  Five stars for speed and service, minus two for hit-and-miss food.

gtGeMSc_5mpWWbOjZIey1Q.review_text: A great spot before and after giants' games.  They have an amazing happy hour, and PBR pitchers are always $8.  I really enjoy their wide selection of burgers and garlic fries.  The menu is also fairly extensive, so I'm definitely going to try their other offerings.  There's a TV above the bar always on ESPN or some other sporting event.  Best of all, it's a very welcoming atmosphere and the service is always friendly.    Overall, this is a relatively unknown gem among many other more popular establishments closer to the ballpark.

MN4MEeUxXs9wb76SO6Y7qQ.review_text: Hot Mess !  Oh Brickhouse, what has happened to you? After visiting you today for lunch I feel so disappointed.    You know how when you run into a long lost friend who used to have a great sense of humor, dress well, and was fun to be around...and now she's a crack whore?  That's how I feel about Brickhouse.   I've been eating here for about 4 years now. I have been in a few times when the service was not the best, but I gladly returned because the food was great, atmosphere is awesome,  and it is soooo convenient.  I read a YELP review of Brickhouse the other day about how bad the service was. I thought, this person must just be a pain in the ass, the service couldn't have been THAT bad.  To you Ms. or Mr. Yelper whom  I thought was a 'pain in the ass', I stand corrected...everything you said was true.    When we arrived today, there was only ONE other person in the restaurant.  Out of 6 employee's walking around, none of them greeted us, told us we needed to order at the counter, or acknowledged we existed.  We sat for 10 minutes before someone, as they were walking out the door told us to go order at the counter.    When our food arrived, my burger tasted like fish, and my friends "big salad" was a side salad at best.  When we told the server he looked at us blankly like he was a zombie, and said in a monotone voice, 'I'll get you more greens". Came back and dropped the plate on our table and just walked away.     It was if we were being served by the "Twilight" cast.    So Brickhouse, I say this to you.  I love you to death and don't want to end our relationship, but its gone too far.  Your service, your food, your prices....you got's to go !  When there are options like "Holy Grill" three blocks away, you don't have the option to behave like this.    I will miss you. (tear streaming down face) Don't worry you will survive as long as there are hungry Giants Fans and desperate office lunch meetings at your place.  I hope one day we can be friends again.

q0HDybhT0V9dXrs63_WqWQ.review_text: Oh Boy. I was excited to have a big juicy burger between my hands, dripping down the side of my mouth. All day it was all I could think about. Alas, Brickhouse you disappointed me. The menu *looks* great. I was torn between ordering the wild mushroom burger with Cheddar instead of Swiss, or the Apple & Brie sandwich. I ended up getting the burger, cooked medium, and asked for a side salad instead of fries (just to be spontaneous).  As soon as the plate hit the table, I saw there was a problem: round patty on a square (more rectangular) bun! Who does that? It *looked* really good so I of course devoured it. When there were about 2 bites left, I decided to just ditch the bun because it wasn't working for me, and realized that my patty was cooked to well-done, not medium. The salad was just simple greens tossed in balsamic vinegar, olive oil and sea salt. Simple, yet for some reason delicious.  Our waitress was very nice, though. I liked the fact that she knows what the specials du jour are, and makes it a point to say that it's "not that great." Ha ha, I appreciate the honesty.  Just to point out: parking is great, metered spots are open all around the block here (granted it was 6:30pm on a Wednesday). Great little spot to come eat before a show at AT&T park...just a 10-15 min walk from there (depending on how fast you can walk).

WecuAsHBDZGj7Z6_sJcQAw.review_text: Remote parfaits.  Alone six bucks for a cup of granola, fruit and yogurt would be two star expensive. But  you have to remind yourself you're eating it inside a well designed cafe with friendly service all while catching up on work using the free WiFi.  Having breakfast while working remotely is worth paying a little extra.

zDltf7SGyDANcA6ndZkF7A.review_text: After a very generous offer from the GM of Brickhouse, the BF and I decided to give things another go. The food experience this time around was considerably better. Starting off with onion rings was the perfect way to initiate dining. We warmed up our tums with their crispy deliciousness.   We ordered the beef pot pie and pesto pasta with chicken as our entree. Spencer really liked his pot pie and although I wasn't completely sold on the pasta, it was a much better choice than the veggie burger I had last time.   Brickhouse is a great place to go for happy hour with $3 draft beers and $2 off bar bites. I'm not certain I would recommend a full meal here only because there's nothing that I've tasted that would leave me dying to come back. The prices are pretty darn high on some of the meals and although their portions are hefty, the quality doesn't quite warrant that.   I will say that a good friend of mine has had the veggie sandwich here and she emphatically claims that it's amazing. That may be a good place to start if it's your first time eating here. I was really close to ordering it but at the last minute changed my mind (kinda wish I had gone with my gut instinct).   The ambiance is still a driving likability factor here and continues to win me over.

xt6XlFWF8euqZQ_rhrZhpQ.review_text: I had just spend the whole day moving and I was STARVING when we came here to eat dinner.  (so keep that in mind)  Appetizer (calamari) was YUMMY!!  Goat cheese thing was pretty good :)  I shared a buffalo burger and it just didn't have enough taste but maybe I've been spoiled by the burgers with additional stuff.  Breakfast (another day)  the corn beef hash - is amazing!!   Homemade stuff, non of this can stuff.   French toast - sweet but not too sweet! The hash browns need to be crispier  though.  Mimosa seem to have fresh squeezed oj

CT8A3K8cKXxkcGg93bWZ2Q.review_text: I came here during lunch time on a Thursday, it wasn't too busy till it hit 1 or 2 and it got packed. We were able to order right away since there wasn't a line. We were also able to find a table as it wasn't too packed yet. The food did not take too long to come out either. I had the tomato bisque and the chicken brie sandwich. Both were amazingly delicious!!! I really enjoyed my food. I would eat here everyday if I could.

EJLGV1EdM5E0Qu4OmeXkEw.review_text: I was happily surprised with my experience here and will definitely be returning soon.   Ambiance: 4 stars. I absolutely love the southern style theme they have going. The dual tricycle had me giggling pretty good. They also had a band playing that wasn't too loud and kept things upbeat.   Service: Excellent. Wish I could remember our waitresses name. She was friendly, personable, knowledgeable and made sure we were always in order.   Food: Delicious! We started with the Jalapeno crab casserole dip. It had the texture of a really good tuna melt filling but with crab. A yummy spread on some warm Focaccia bread. I ordered the special, house caught king salmon (apparently just caught by the owner himself on a trip to Alaska) with a Cajun rub over crab mashed potatoes. The salmon was fresh and well cooked and the potatoes were still chunky which meshed well with the crab stuffing. my only suggestion would be to add some veggies to lighten up the dish. My date ordered the Rib-eye and it was also cooked very well. It came with truffle mashed potatoes that was actually a scalloped potato gratin but went well with the dish none the less.   I definitely recommend this place if you're in the neighborhood. Seems like a good spot for a small dinner party.

hxo5--VketoAHchr0GOK8w.review_text: Really good sandwiches and Arnold Palmers. I especially like the chicken-brie-pesto on foccacia.   If you're ordering lunch on a weekday, call ahead to order for takeout. The line gets long quickly.

uPdptuCdyC2yRDQk2QATRw.review_text: I'm gonna say it.  And I'm prepared to take the heat for it, but here goes: BRICKHOUSE HAS THE BEST BURGERS IN SOMA!  I've not yet even found a close second.  Unequivocally, hands-down, bar-none, the BEST burgers in SoMa.  Feel free to disagree, but I want to know who you think has the best burger so I can try that one too.  I've had the pleasure of stuffing my gullet here a few times now over the last months and I've been thrilled each time.  I haven't tried anything besides the burgers because, I mean honestly, why the hell would I?!  The burgers are just so damned good!  And their onion rings are pretty legit too.  Now I won't disagree that the prices are too high.  But guess what, SO ARE EVERYONE ELSE'S WITHIN A MILE RADIUS.  SoMa = Overpriced... everything.  Apparently SoMa is the place to be in SF these days, and those of us who live or work here have to pay the price I guess.  That said, I challenge you to find a lunch as good as one from Brickhouse for under $13.  At least as far as I've tried, I've yet to find it.  The service is average; not great, not terrible.  And it is typically very busy at lunch time, as all of the more-than-half-way decent establishments are.  Is it the best burger on the planet?  No.  But it is definitely the best within walking distance of my workplace.

d9WIz0Xuh9ECkHfVmqbhIw.review_text: I'm on a hunt for the best burger in CA.  It can be any kind of burger...I'm not particular.  It doesn't even have to be beef....buffalo, portabella, chicken, tuna patty, even a garden burger.  It just has to be unique and tasty.  Brickhouse is a fun little cafe.  It's open from morning to night.  Morning for a pretty robust breakfast menu.  Sunday brunch and then it looks like they convert to a bar at night.    As for the burger, it wasn't bad...But it also wasn't the type of burger that stirred a long term craving in me that would lead to another visit in the not so distant future.  With San Fran having so many places to eat, I probably will check out other places before going back there again anytime soon.

bFhO6S3Cuj-VitKG2PLsGw.review_text: My friend set up a small birthday dinner here for me last night. Except for one of my friends, none of us have ever eaten here before.  Right off the bat, although the waitress was sweet, she was not on top of her game. Definitely slow service. We wanted to start on drinks first, and it took her a long while to come back to take our orders...just for drinks. C'mon a girl just wants her drink! haha  Anyways, so when it came on deciding what to eat, being that i love salads, i decided on getting the Smoked Seafood Salad. I dunno if its because im such a critic for salads, but when i saw it, i noticed the fish was really dry. took a bite...not impressed. actually disappointed. another friend ordered ribs and it "looked" good, and i stuck my fork in it thinking the meat would just fall right off the bone, NOPE.  i guess im spoiled? but i dont usually see ribs so tough and chewy. One friend ordered the "Kobe" burger? it wasnt too bad, but ive definitely had better burgers at BBQs that my friends would throw.   Topping off the review of the food, so my friend bought a bday cake for me and asked one of the waiters at the beginning to put it in the frig. When the bill came, guess what was charged?! "cake-slicing" fee! wtf?! serious?! they never mentioned a fee for the cake nor did anyone slice the cake for us! that was ridiculous. so we disputed the fee and they took it off the bill. had they not, i think i wouldve gotten super upset....  overall, i gotta say, im probably never going back there again.  Update: I went again because the manager was kind enough to send me a complimentary gift certificate. I was very appreciative, but sad to say, I went there to try their brunch one sunday morning. I was again dissappointed.....food wasn't as tasteful as it looked (my over easy eggs, came with the yolk almost completely fully cook not having any yolk juice spill out). The service was slow and not very attentive. Sorry, but I gave it another chance, and I regret to say that will be my last.

QrR7HmI39mkGBxy7Y0g2CA.review_text: I had a REALLY good burger here. Really thick patty that they cooked rare - as I like it. The onion rings were the BEST I've ever had. The atmosphere here is kinda like a pub that also wants to appeal to the date crowd. Its lowly lit but theres a bar with the Shark's game playing?    Theres all kinds of antique-y stuff all over the walls and it makes it look really busy. It didn't make the food taste different - but its not my cup of tea. BUT the food was pretty darn good and I can't bitch about it.   What DID SUCK was that we got charged a gratuity when we only had FOUR people! Who charges gratuity for a party of FOUR!? We kinda felt ripped off.

Mu0iyLV3BwzpuJBfP4LBfQ.review_text: Dropped in at 7:00pm sat nite. Easy street parking, wound up right in front. That is pretty much unheard of in SF. Place was bout 20% full. While the waiter was a sweet kid, pretty much everything we ordered was botched in some way, and took over 20mins to come out. That's a long tome for a few burgs. They brought out the wrong fries and they were room temp. "Sorry, let me get you the garlic fries". Came out even colder than the first. Can't imagine what it's like there when 50% full.   But what was really funny was the john. Obviously they spent some $$ to make it look nice. Nice tile and fixtures, "art" on walls. But in the corner, a small table with all the cleaning products, brushes and plunger all sitting out in view. What are these people thinking?  This might be the worst run restaurant in town. Clueless. Oh, and the food? Mediocre.

BaCPpQ8g_NLNIhNhd3CVaA.review_text: Enjoyed a nice meal Saturday evening at the Brickhouse.  There was a live band playing the type of music you'd expect from a place that tries to be early to mid-century.  The layout of the tables on the lower level causes a bit of an issue with the band, because you either have to walk all the way around them, or squeeze right next to them when either using the restroom or leaving the place.    The food and drink choices were excellent.  I had the Lamb Pot Pie, and others in our party had the shrimp & grits, with nary a complaint.  The only real reason for the lack of 5 stars was because we didn't get a very good vibe from the server.  He seemed annoyed to be serving us, and when we asked for menus, we didn't realize there were already menus under some plates, and while I'm pretty sure he noticed them (as he flipped through them before wandering off to get more), he then said "wow you have enough menus for two tables, that's great", despite that there were plenty of empty tables.  Perhaps a bit picky, but I'm the patron, right?    I will certainly go back for the food and the relatively decent prices ($25 per person all in, including alcoholic beverages for all 4 people in our party isn't bad in the city at all), and we'll cross our fingers for a better service experience.

XJgRdHOsgypEba4oKwAh1w.review_text: We love this place.  The place is eclectic and comfortable, and the food is very good.  The breakfasts are delicious and the sandwiches are excellent.  On our last visit I had the cow tipper dip (a french dip with cheese) and the roast beef was excellent. My wife had the Brickhouse Melt and raved how delicious it was.  Also, the fries are excellent--some of the best around.  This is a neighborhood favorite in SOMA.

NMe3UCQOEUgnPDLcqtW05w.review_text: I've been here a couple times now, which means it's pretty good. They have a decent happy hour, funky eclectic decor, and a full bar. This time I ordered the sangria. I don't really recommend it. However, the pulled pork kettle chips were pretty phenomenal!

2vJmtWTfC1KgyCifazstVA.review_text: I had a poopy day at  work and was about to run to hennyseys for a sammich but my co-worker started talkin up this chicken brie and I remembered how much I love bread and cheese. Like always brickhouse takes their time preparing the food but its usually worth it. I wasn't too hungry or else I would have had fries instead of salad on the side. The salad is a joke or a slap in the face. Its three bites of spring mix pshh.   I brought the sandwhich back to work and barely got two bites in when my producer said "what are you doing, eating??" LOL so I had to throw it down and animate a car real fast with my only motivation being to finish the sandwich. Its sad really when all you have is a sandwhich to look forward to haha. So I finally ate the thing and it was great, I was supprised by the apples and the crunchy bread mmmmmm -   -t

wuEwwEZ3YSOt_KvEdj0R7w.review_text: Best part of working downtown is my LUNCH hour! Since I've started working in downtown SF, I've been eating and 'mentally yelping' many food establishments and I must say, the 'Brickhouse Cafe and Bar' is one of my favorites in SOMA. I especially love how its 'walk-up self service' style; order your food, get your drink at the bar, sit down and enjoy! Hassle free and straight to the point! Wait time for your food is about 5-10 minutes on average, but who cares! I'll wait longer for good food! (the weekday lunch rush can take a little longer) brickhousesf.com I recommend: 1.The MUSHROOM Burger (grilled mushrooms and swiss cheese) 2. Beer battered ONION RINGS 3. Al's soup and Sandwich combo with Tomato Basil Bisque (Ohhh soo good!) especially on a cold day!

arnttohv0N7NLyk4FIjMdA.review_text: Super hungry and gave Brickhouse another shot, as it was within walking distance.  It redeemed itself with really good crispy-edged sunny-side up eggs and decent Applewood smoked bacon.  The Bloody Mary was more flavorful this time around, and we sat farther away from the bathrooms (though they still stink).  The rye bread was nicely toasted, and even the potatoes were edible.

JGdKYphlPcJTBhHBjCfdig.review_text: I came here several times before writing this review. A friend of mine gave me the advice that if I wanted medium rare burger, I would have to request a rare one. So that is what I did several times and it  always ended up medium rare! Yesterday was a different story... I ordered rare... and I actually got rare! I was shocked! LOL  I ordered the Big Ass burger ($9.25) with garlic fries (additional $1.00).  The food is typical, nothing really stands out of this place with respects to a burger. The fries was bomb, I would get the garlic fries and it would have just enough garlic to make is tasty but not make you smell bad afterwards.  My co-worker ordered a salad with salmon, he spent about $14 bucks... I guess it is reasonable because you get salmon. However, his salmon was really dry and the color of the salmon was off (kinda looked neon orange) and I would recommend getting the dressing on the side... the bowl was big but it wasn't wide to made the dressing spread... so it just sat at the bottom of the bowl and the veggies was soaking it. My coworker had a hard time trying to eat what was left at the bottom of his salad bowl....  I come here for happy hour with friends! Place gets packed, but hell it is close to AT&T.. perfect to get drinks prior to a baseball game!

CxS6gIJk7M7mA6ao8Cpl1A.review_text: Been here twice now, and both times the sandwiches I ordered were very good. I like the style of the place, too. Kinda reminds me of a smaller version of the Grove, if you're familiar with those places.  The first time I went, I got the chicken/brie sandwich; very tasty. I dined in, and service was fine.  Then today I got take out - ordered the brickhouse (turkey, avocado, bacon, sprouts, cheddar) on whole wheat sliced bread. Normally I prefer a roll of some sort to sliced bread, but this sandwich was legit. I also got the brickhouse salad today. Salads are never as good when you get them to go, but it had some great flavors - including blue cheese and peanuts.  Brickhouse is now probably one of my favorite little eateries in the neighborhood.

AEuC-3l47_o3VP7bv4PigA.review_text: Not bad, not great either.  Hubby and I were looking for some variety in our brunch special that's near our Blue Bottle haunt.  We opted this time for Brickhouse Cafe this time:  Hubby order the basic Cowboy Combo and I had the Odyssey scramble. It ain't bad.  The food was properly cooked, not too greasy and the the temp is right and all.  But other than that it's too "basic."  The potatoes were pretty decent, but It needs *something*.  The steak and eggs cost WAAAY too much for him.  He's thrilled about the $3 weekend mimosa though!!!  :) )  If this place have something different like homemade muffins instead of the usual store bought bread or English muffin, I would have considered raising it to a 3.5 or even a 4, but given what I got today, they're at an EVEN 3 STAR in my book.  (Good, but meh... could be better.)

6s1Z1KREApjVACzTIusSEg.review_text: Me and coworkers came here because we heard good things about this place. I've actually come here a few times. Just to change up where I eat from time to time. People were raving about their burgers but to me they weren't all that great. There's actually a few other places in the area that I would rather go to eat a burger. One thing I do like about brickhouse is the environment. It's really chill and the staff are super cool and friendly. I've tried different kinds of burgers and a few diff sandwiches but a lot of it feels on the dry'er end. Even when I've ordered a med cooked burger.. the burger meat doesn't seem to have much flavor itself and never felt like a medium cooked burger, but that's just me. Aside from that I used to come here bc it had a nice sitting area for you and coworkers to eat when a lot of small restaurants are... well.. small.. in sf.

QuLh9_7mM1o7n2HRYkvXvg.review_text: very friendly service, amazing drinks, great eats!

VOYvD-kerR204k0WrR0J3A.review_text: What a great find for happy hour before the Giant's game.. We couldn't have been more please.  We were able to get a booth... Waitress and bus boys were quick and attentive.... They were running around so much because it got crowded. However, they were great.  The food was standard bar grub.. At happy hour, they give you a discount... They have a nice selection of beers on tap.. 11 bucks for a pitcher. Not garbage beer either.  Overall, we enjoyed our time here... We will be going back and bringing friends....

rIiN1d8hnDs39ArSWrxEmg.review_text: BRING BACK THE WEDGE!    I came here for dinner last night and had a super yummy steak. I love the feeling of this place- I've said it before- but it's so neighborhoody- in a neighborhood that sometimes so sorely lacks that important element.   Our server Janica was the BEST.

3lcNlMLeaLCGtS-ELlWrTg.review_text: I like this place, very homey and cute atmosphere, great beer wnd wine and happy hour selections, great brunch and fancier dishes plus  burgers and tacos and brunch.  I think they have a great menu.  We have been coming for years.  Salmon caught by owner when available.

aKccxPmfdRk-8l2jcZ90Sw.review_text: I visit once every few months to check whether it's changed. It's the same experience every time: decent food, terrible service.  Your drink will never be refilled. Once, after finishing my meal, I had to wait twenty minutes for my check.  Recently, after entering the restaurant, I stood around for five minutes in front without being acknowledged by the staff. Even if you're swamped (which they weren't) it doesn't take a lot of effort to say, "I'll be with you in a minute."  This place isn't worth your time with plenty of restaurants nearby who have acceptable service.

wsUJ2O9wspG32NK8BR7VWg.review_text: We live in the neighborhood and have walked by Brickhouse a million times.  We finally went in on Friday for dinner and drinks and fell in love with the place.  "Comfort" is the word that fits best.  The burgers were perfect and a great mix of beers on tap for a very affordable price.  I will definitely be back for food and just to sit at the bar for a couple of beers.

0qrmGKjW03xDYDAExsMhLg.review_text: i love their fries for some reason and went to this place on a bobblehead day. It wasn't that pack, our waitress was very attentive and this place just seems so chill :)

TLzwLBhPoO33w85VOXz97g.review_text: 100 is the number from SF Health Dept, means the place is not in the Chinatown, so very clean and the employs are all wash their hands no matter what!  I was not so impressed by the Bigass Burger because the burger was oily but not juicy, you know what I mean? I am sorry for saying this but I really think that the cook was cooking the burger patty with no sense of love. I mean, I had a better tasty juicy burger before that got a love from the cook.   Making a good burger is not really getting a good meat. Wagyu Beef for a burger? No, Thank you! I don't like the beef ground.  In my opinion, Wagyu Beef should not be ground beef, period. I like Wagyu Beef as a steak, not a burger patty.   I think cheap meat is fine for a burger.  I am talking about a burger place like Hall of Flame Burgers, Sam's and Hamburger Haven. They know what the juicy burger is.  Sorry but, the Bigass Burger did not  impress me much.  But I really like the breakfast menu, especially the Cowboy Combo! 9 bucks. 2 eggs, apple smoke bacon, nice roasted potatoes w/ english muffin was hit the spot! I must tell you that I had to have the egg scrambled. I usually order my egg over medium, but I don't know why I wanted to get my egg scrambled for a first time in a long time. But the egg was so fluffy but firm, in a good way, light but very flavorful nicely cooked.  My son had the French Toast w/ mascarpone cheese and caramelized apple, 9 bucks. It was another hit item. Really Good coffee in the original Brick House insulate coffee mug, 9 bucks! I got one and it's the best coffee mug I've ever had!  The coffee 5 star. The breakfast, so far 4 star. The Big Ass Burger, disappointed, 3 star. Decor, very clean toilet, 5 star. The service, decent-good, 4 star. The 9 bucks coffee mug, 10 star!!!! Total 4 star!  I'd like to come back for more breakfast menu.

B9qjAS2z1lmxuEY1CDqnIg.review_text: I worked across the street for almost 2 years and going to Brickhouse was always a reliable place for lunch. I always come back here because the quality of the food was always consistently good.  Some of my favorite meals include:  - Chicken Brie - Cow Tipper (no cheddar- sub swiss) - Garlic Mashed potatoes   In fact, I love brickhouse so much that I brought my fiance here on the weekend to have brunch. What's the best meal here:  - Biscuits and Gravy  These are crazy good!  Only two warnings - The lines can get long and the service is slow (but the food is worth it). Lastly, credit cards are only accepted for $10 and up.

RGDyPqmNLKPdZ4VBf-6UKQ.review_text: Solid local joint for food, beer, and game. Happy hour has 2 dollar drinks and 2-dollar off bar food menu. I love their garlic and rosemary fries and fish tacos. Skip the calamari...its super tough and tastes like rubber.  They also have great brunch menu....my bf love their biscuits and gracy, and they always have fresh, delicious fish sandwiches....yumm!

MdGAvfI0LrEdiRfPTnG9Gg.review_text: This is one of those rare places that is more than the sum of its parts. Friendly staff, fun owners, great food (especially the bar menu, and the beef stroganov), tasty drinks with a strong beer menu, good music, and just an all around easy going vibe.  There's nothing pretentious or haughty about it, and the regulars you see there know it. Fred catches the salmon himself, greens are local and in season, beef is from his parents ranch, beer and coffee from local producers (theyre often drinking at the bar with the rest of us). It's my local, and should be yours too!

djWl0HKJwEwWlY-0vo7oRA.review_text: Nice happy hour spot to hit up before the Giants game! Service was friendly. Decor has the pub feel. I heard burgers are good, will try next time!  - Onion Rings: gigantic! crispy, nice breading - Beer: good variety of tap

mW8fvDQ3JAtzeLjU--CjTg.review_text: Here's what I remember about my meal here a while back: it was loud as hell.   You see, sometimes they have a live band here. That's a great idea...until the music is so loud and caustic that patrons can't hear the person across from them. Drums do not belong in restaurants.   That said, I actually quite enjoyed my food.

fM_8vYIs8jHFMzarbnyBug.review_text: Order a soma burger here.  Burger had a big pattie with lot avacado and some mushroom.  The burger was on the greasy side and soaked the lower bun.  Pattie was tasty and bog but for the money($14) i wasn't  impressedFries that come with it were ok.

EC6XS6enyHOmPiXVOrVoNA.review_text: Ate lunch here for my daughters birthday and it was AMAZING! Great food, awesome service, wonderful atmosphere. Can't rave about it enough. Definitely a new favorite for the fam

ksxVljiXVbvnt5hZ6R6ZWA.review_text: We recently discovered Brickhouse and what a find! We absolutely love it! Great food and a wonderful quaint atmosphere. This is our Sunday Cheers! xoxo The Carter Girls

7RjiQklHdxrM4NTtvQsV4w.review_text: Had dinner here with 3 other friends the other day. Nice ambience, friendly waitstaff. Their bourbon cocktail on special was delicious. Had the blue cheese burger cooked medium, was a great in evert way. A lot of places will skimp on the bun or the lettuce tomato, not here. Perfect ensemble!  Oh, and I also left my backpack behind. There were nice enough to find my business card in it and leave me a message by next morning, saving me a lot of frantic worrying and backtracking to trace down where exactly I had lost it.  Come for the food, keep coming back for the great people!

6JOD7pAVHb3oC7gYWuOLkA.review_text: How does this place only have 3.5 stars? You people are crazy.   Came here for brunch the other day. I'm in love.   Pros (+): (+) Live music, soft Latin jams that didn't blow your eardrums out, soft enough volume where you can listen to it and enjoy the music but not have to yell at the person sitting next to you so they can hear what you're saying (+) Great ambiance! Chill awesome vibe, nice open space, bar is cool (+) $3 Mimosas and $5 Bloody Mary's (+) The bacon pancake. More like bacon beignet, and omg so good (+) Orange marscapone french toast. Man that marscapone is good. (+) The pulled pork benedict. Perfect eggs, lots of meat, omg so good. (+) Corned beef hash - yummy!  (+) Price range - all perfectly reasonable and you get a lot of food (+) Cool waitresses  Cons (-):  (-) The pulled pork nachos - the plate must have been sitting around for a while, the cheese was already pretty congealed and it wasn't the most appetizing  I am DEFINITELY coming back for more brunch and dinner too. Can't wait to try the burgers. And I live like two minutes away now. Score!

fiAtggeGGinY6UnHI75NcQ.review_text: Had the Chicken Brie Sandwich here for brunch today. Fries were good and sandwich was good. It's nothing super memorable but it's in the neighborhood and it gets the job done. Can't complain much.   I'll be back to try the burgers and happy hour food!

uHeRtPGaC0NgugxrM4fD-Q.review_text: Great feel inside the brickhouse, but the food could be MUCH better.  I has the Odyssey scramble which is a collection of veggies and feta cheese scrambled with eggs and served with a side of potatoes.. The feta wasn't melted and the scramble just wasn't good.. friend had eggs benedict florentien style, which was so-so.  I would highly recommend the Butler & the Chef over this place, the food just doesn't compare.   Also, I'll add that i don't mind that you have to order your food at the register and they bring it to you at the table, but they're really slow on cleaning off the tables when people leave, the joint is small and I ended up cleaning a table so that we could sit down..  The only reasons I give it two stars are that it was the only place I could find nearby open on a Monday and still serving all day brunch, and the coffee bar, which made an excellent espresso and iced coffee.

l4nmDhzy6octw5tR8PP5Ww.review_text: It's 10:00am on a Sunday.  You're looking for a solid brunch spot but don't want to wait for a table.  Look no further - as long as it's not a game day, Brickhouse could be the solution!  $3 mimosas, $5 bloody marys (in a pint glass), and a classic brunch menu with all your standard items.  Huevos rancheros, eggs benedict, and scrambles were all a-ok.    My only question - was the toaster broken?  English muffins weren't crispy - and our neighbor's "toast" wasn't either.  Hopefully this was a one-time thing, but I know next time I'll request extra-toasty.

rO2YKN1PqAJjd6YgP0PM0A.review_text: Went here for dinner - five stars for the awesome grilled yellowtail tuna sandwich for only $11. I couldn't believe how fresh the fish was. Usually when I get any fish on a sandwich, it is not a great idea...  Mixed green salad was decent, french fries were pretty good as well. Drink specials were decent too - $5 drink of the day & $1 off beer (I won't mention the $2 Pabst). I liked it better than 21st Amendment..which I feel is overrated.

0niNpv8X_2I7wIWVWl3ZyA.review_text: I was going to give this place four stars, but then it occurred to me that I didn't even remember what I had... apart from a bloody mary (which, at brunch, is only $5).    And then I remembered how I sat underneath a window that was propped open, on a very chilly morning.  And I remembered how I asked if there was any possible way to close the window, the guy said no.  And I remembered not caring too much, putting on my big red coat, and immediately spilling my bloody mary on it.  At least they both were red, right?  After thinking about it, I remembered that I had the tuna melt, which was fine, but not very melty (especially under the arctic wind that was coming in through the window overhead).  I should have had a burger.

pLUBav1Yf0S3ivYlyQvrdg.review_text: this place is decent.  kind of the only place open around Mission Bay with a bar on Monday around 11am.  Brick House is two floors, but if it's just one or two people, grab a seat at the bar.  it's more comfortable then the booths.    not sure i can say this place is that great. as i don't really have any comments.  i've been here a few times, but will really only come if all the other bars i like are closed.  like i said, this place is fine.  not a big deal.

MqnKnpggkHOmuMFeXEOGDw.review_text: I love this local jaunt. It's cool and fun - sometimes with live music which is great.  Food is fantastic - organic grass fed beef from the owners family. And the salmon caught by the owner as well. Only issue I have is with the take out. Every time I've ordered a take out burger, most of the toppings have been missing. I get the burger and cheese. Nothing else. And I figure it out when I get home. So, if ordering take out, check your order before you leave.

jfGuH33jrhb4UYkj8HaFrw.review_text: What a find. Our server, Justin, was great. The shrimp and grits and blue cheese burger were perfect. Great draft selection.  Definitely a keeper.

GOK1jRfWlRIrPVHROmAfpA.review_text: So good! Their biscuits blew me out of the water. I love me some well baked biscuits and this place delivers. I got one of the breakfast plates, which was all around delicious and completely satisfying. My friend got one of the burgers, which he shared, and just a single bite left me drooling and wanting more. Check this place out!

glM6g32otxVafM2h-BN34A.review_text: Mighty tasty. We went here to wait out the traffic the other day and it was the right choice. We had their signature brickhouse cafe sandwich with a side salad for me and fries for him. Cost $20 with tax and tip for the both of us. Going back next time I want a chill spot to eat/ grab drinks in the soma.

T1upaPMzuW7pNj74fO1rjA.review_text: Easy peasy. That's what the Brickhouse Cafe is in a nutshell. The vibe is laid back, you can seat yourself, and on the weekends, they have live music playing. Not that, "WHAT?! I CAN'T HEAR YOU!" kind of obnoxious live music, just a really cool guy who plays guitar quietly.   The food is standard brunch fare. My only complaint is they sometimes take a little while to get the food out to you but hey, if you're looking for a zippy meal, a Sunday brunch probably isn't your thing anyway. The only other thing I'd fix is their coffee/tea mugs - they're HUGE and made of clear glass. I've never had a decently warm cup of tea there, but I guess that's a small price to pay for a friendly neighborhood brunch spot.

UqkrP5O2ToeXRcYbp7okIA.review_text: From the outside I would guess this place was some kind of biker bar or hole in the wall.. but when you get inside it has this warm, "Louisana" kinda feel to it. The staff is helpful, warm, friendly and willing to bend over backwards to give you what you like!  If I wasn't constantly trying to watch the calorie intake... or at least the fat intake, I would probably be a loyal fan...   Lots of Huge Burgers, Cheesey Fries....Jalepeno Poppers... Entrees like Chicken Piccata in Lemon Butter Sauce... Cheesy Chili.. ummm... all that "good" stuff that just might contain enough grease to clog one of my arteries...

JL1Kcy7TvkszdQ7vlYXUug.review_text: Great burgers and salads, but it can be tough to find a seat at lunchtime (hint: try upstairs). The building is pretty genuine: brick and vintage decor, especially upstairs. They play some interesting music in the afternoons, oldies and stuff. Order something with avocado in it, and go for the delicious side salad instead of fries.  I think someone may be stealing credit card numbers from here, so you might want to stick to paying in cash.

gjfcfzrYZ0O1xINHtnQKiA.review_text: It was torn by the tasty options for brunch.  So, I ordered both: the corned beef hash and the eggs bennies with a side of chicken apple sausage.  Sometimes, the meats can be a bit dry, but this is my default back up place for large groups when the Butler and the Chef is packed.

088SkMN7Hjn2vK2MEUfc3Q.review_text: I've been to Brickhouse for two Friday evening dinners and I'm impressed.  I've ordered burgers both times (as did my dinner mates), and everyone was satisfied with the quality of ingredients and potion size relative to the ~$10 paid (which includes a bunch of fries).  Throw in really friendly service, a homey atmosphere, and live music (jazz on both Fridays, loud enough to enjoy, but quiet enough to permit conversation at the table).  Nice.  This place almost makes me like SOMA.  Almost.

Utu0zD1uI3F8DyFLj9_NjA.review_text: Love the burgers and sandwiches here. Nice variety and hearty portions. Staff is friendly and accommodating whenever I go there. They even fulfilled a request of mine (veggie burger on top of a regular burger.) for my birthday a couple years ago.   There is a TV but it mostly faces the registers so unless you're sitting at the high tables forget watching it. but it helps for the people waiting in line.   On hot days forget about sitting upstairs. Even with the fans it can be brutally hot up there.

ueoddNXejXZ2Rdv_9XClOg.review_text: This review is for the weekday happy hour only.  We were having a group happy hour outing on a Monday afternoon.  A few of us got off early and ended up meeting up here because there was plenty of street parking in front of this place at 4pm.  Walking in we see a chalkboard with happy hour specials with draught beers only $3 a pint!  At those prices, you'd think they would have some crappy beers like Stella  (the euro version of Bud), but NO.  They actually had a really nice beer selection.  I was able to get a Firestone Walker IPA, Allagash White, and Green Flash APA (I think?) for a bill totaling a measly $9!  I wanted to stay longer, but the rest of the group was at the original intended meeting point so we bounced.  I will return for happy hour and probably stay for dinner next time.  The place looked really cozy and almost like the inside of some big house.

3PuCtOPUmxgIA44XcXnnUw.review_text: This place gets all possible stars from me, specifically for it's weekend brunch. My boyfriend and I come here almost every single weekend, since I happen to live in Soma, and it never disappoints.   The biscuits and gravy, french toast, and classic bacon-and-eggs dishes are my favorites. I'm always tempted to try a milkshake, but end up getting too full.   The inside of the place is kind of like an antique shop in a farmhouse, but somehow doesn't feel cluttered. There are trees coming out from the middle of some of the tables, nice sky lights, and vintage armchairs here-and-there. If you're lucky, you can get a booth to the side.   This place is also full of surprises. Each weekend there's a different milkshake flavor of the day to look forward to. On Easter weekend, they put peeps in their mimosas. One random sunday, there was a badass violin player with a mohawk classin up the place with his soothing-earthy tunes.   The mimosas, quirky decor, and delicious breakfast menu keep my boyfriend and I coming back time and time again. Love this place!

dR9OiTIjuzvDdoqjuulKrw.review_text: This review is based solely on the horrible service I received, which caused me to leave before even ordering an item.  I came here with a friend for brunch one Sunday.  We put our name on the list and were told the wait would be 40 minutes or so.  There were some people ahead of us waiting for a table, but it seemed like some tables were finishing up.  So, I doubted it would be quite that long.  We asked one of waiters if the bar was first come, first served and he said yes.  Two seats opened up at the bar, so my friend and I decided to forgo our table and eat there instead.  We were starving.  After awhile, the same waiter that took our names told us that the bar was, in fact, not first come, first served and that people ahead of us on the list had dibs on those seats.  First of all, he either misunderstood the initial question or is just an idiot.  Secondly, I have never, ever heard of reserved seating at a bar.  That is utter nonsense.  Besides that, there were two additional empty seats next to us that no one had claimed.  i told my friend that we should just go someplace else.  The kicker was seeing a couple who had come in well after us already seated at a table.  WTF?  It's really too bad, since the food looked pretty solid.  But, I will never set foot in this place again.

RhUQ1Vz3-bDMLbIGlcyzfA.review_text: With an atmosphere that ranges from rockin' busy (lunch) to super-noisy (happy hour) to mellow (dinner), Brickhouse Café is a SOMA stand-out.  With a menu that includes a nice assortment of all the American classics and comfort food, Brickhouse Café has something for everyone.  Served on Bakers of Paris bun, the tender, juicy 1/2 pound burgers are delicious.  Garnished with apple, onion, and pesto, the chicken and brie sandwich had just the right amount of cheese.  However, the veggie chili fell flat--not even a good helping of Tabasco could cure its lack of flavor.  The happy hour menu is very respectable, and the $10 pitchers of beer are a bargain.  While sometimes a bit spacey, on the whole the wait staff is friendly, engaging, and helpful.  While it may not be worth a special trip across town, Brickhouse Café does SOMA dwellers good.

UE0y4lm6ILoXhyLrtVlo4g.review_text: Takeaways from my visit to Brickhouse. -Happy hour: $2 PBR, $3 draft beers. Whoa baby. Rating: 5 out of 5 pint glasses. -Location: Right near AT&T Park for pre-gaming before Giants' games. Rating: 5 out of 5 ticket scalpers. -Service: Pretty waitress. Slow waitress. Rating: 2 out of 5 cute blondes. -Food: Bar food is not supposed to be the greatest but all four dishes were pretty bad. Rating: 1 out of 5 microwaved meatballs. -Random comment: Whoever chose to put the restrooms where they are made a wholly terrible decision. 1 out of 5 wafting poop smell.  Conclusion: I will come back for drinks and 1. eat somewhere else, 2. sit far far away from those bathroom doors. 3/5

F4li3HnfS4gY5IeMSPkGcg.review_text: Brickhouse is a great local spot for anyone who lives or works in SOMA that is looking for a cheap but tasty meal.  A popular option is the Brickhouse melt, which is a healthy typical BLT plus sprouts and fresh avocado.  The side salad is dressed nicely and the cost for lunch (~$8) is hard to beat.  I like that fact that Brickhouse has its own mellow vibe, which makes it a good fit for the neighborhood.

kwVxIP6qZ3Zdgpm3TsDh6g.review_text: I have been here a few times for brunch/lunch while at work. Everything Ive tried has been good for the most part so far. Being I am a breakfast/brunch junkie I like the food and the decor. It's a cute lil spot in a brick,western themed space.

Pt-1sMARa5VDKd0tKSS56g.review_text: Gets the job done. Good food, good service. I've been here several times now for breakfast and lunch and never had any issues. Good burgers and breakfast options.

iZdcEwzZge5m4WMriYGBOw.review_text: 3.5 stars, but I'll give them the benefit of the doubt.  I've been here a number of times and they really do a good job at managing foot traffic.  I've never had to wait for a table, which is fantastic.  Last time I came, I had the Chicken Pot Pie.  I really love their selection of food, since it's really "homey" and a lot of it is comfort food.  They also have a number of beers on tap and a full bar.  Overall, the restaurant doesn't really specialize in any one dish.  They have a very good selection and you can be rest assured that you'll get great service as well.

y5nh6WX7iXfw3N3a_Ox1IA.review_text: Brickhouse is my go-to neighborhood spot. Unpretentious atmosphere, tasty food and always a decent beer selection. Their french fries are awesomely addicting. I usually get the calamari which comes with jalapenos and Parmesan cheese, the yellowtail sandwich with fries and the wedge salad which is in the running for least healthy salad on the planet.   Later in the week they have a band playing during dinner which is fun but can get a little loud.   Overall, a great spot to grab some comfort food and beer.

qjoZFgL9j4jdGgQXkEQW3g.review_text: We came here on Sunday 8/25 after a disappointing turnout at Soma StrEAT Food Park. We walked in and, although the place was fairly empty, I got a great vibe. The ceilings are high, there is exposed brick, writing on chalkboard, beer on tap and in bottles, annnnnd $3 mimosa's and $5 Bloody Mary pints during brunch.  We both ended up ordering burgers. I got just the regular Big Ass Burger, the bf got the Mexican Burger (jalpeno patty, guac, salsa, etc on top) and the garlic fries. They were out of sweet potatoes so no sweet potato fries.   Neither of us could finish our burgers, which is saying something because I had just ran 12 miles. The patty was good, the fries (I just got regular) were nice and thick, but not tooo thick, and were the perfect consistency. My beer was yummy (I couldn't finish that, either!)  We both left very satisfied. I saw some of their HH specials, and if I were in the area during that time I would definitely return. It's a cool place to check out if you aren't trying to have some crazy SF dining experience.

AHI4Ew--zYhs0m8npEd65g.review_text: What a great restaurant and bar -- very cool eclectic space, cozy yet cool, great beers and drinks, good menu, and friendly service.    I stumbled across Brickhouse after a Sat afternoon Giants game. Had a few beers (great stout and Saison Dupont), then had dinner. Jalapeño crab dip is great and enjoyed the mushroom burger w chipotle aioli. The menu is pretty hearty, burgers, grits, Mac and cheese looked good

Zn7lIByuJmQQMVTK7rNAyQ.review_text: Why have I not reviewed this place yet? I've been here numerous times, for brunch, lunch, dinner, drinks, and it has not disappointed. Friends and out of town guests have also enjoyed this place.   Brunch: Love the corned beef hash and eggs! Lunch/Dinner: Can't go wrong with the Big-Ass Burger and garlic fries! Happy Hour: Draft beer and calamari! $4 beers, $6 bar food, and daily cocktail specials until 6:30. Excellent deal in this area. Service: Friendly, attentive  The only thing that bugs me is that sometimes we're served complimentary bread, and sometimes we're not..?  Overall, I enjoy this place, the prices are reasonable, and I recommend it to people looking to grab a bite before a Giants game or any event at AT&T Park.

NPep3UsiDlURl-0Q_ctbMw.review_text: Okay one word for you - Tracy!!  She is one of the most fabulous servers I have ever encountered.  I LOVE coming to Brickhouse because it's in the middle of SOMA but you feel like you're in a small community where everyone treats you like family. It's a nice little escape from the SF scene.  And the live music is always good!  And the food is good too. Not over the top amaze but pretty darn tasty :)   Check it out for sure!!

H5EY1CeIx4m_pNChKZkq7A.review_text: Great place for brunch. Came on a Saturday morning, right before the Giants game. NOTE: if you plan on coming before a baseball game, go early because it gets PACKED!!!!! Upon my arrival I scoped out the menu and my first thoughts were $3 Mimosas or $12 bottomless? WOW that's my kind of deal and OOOHH Eggs Benedict with bbq pulled pork over biscuits... OOOH DROOLS  As crowded as it was, we were served at a well mannered time and everyone seemed to be so friendly:even the patrons I might say. About a 15-20mins and 2 mimosas down my food came. Results? stuffed even then I wasn't able to finish my meal I would have to say 4 stars. Pork was tender, and my poached were cooked to perfection. I would definitely come back!

wMRkYiG_kDg243-7pMOgRg.review_text: Brick House is your average neighborhood brunch place with yummy food. There's nothing particularly noteworthy about your food other than it's what you'd expect from brunch fare in the city. It's pretty easy to get in on the weekends when other places have 1-2hr waits.    The griddle cakes with fruit are the perfect thing for brunch/breakfast. Mimosas are $3 and so it's easy to down one after the other. You can never go wrong with sausage and bacon.   It's lively in here but never too loud. Service is pretty attentive as well.

_r8iHX2Hyqkm4ZTbaXagYw.review_text: Be sure to check this place out if: - You like getting raw egg soup when you ask for eggs over medium. - You enjoy getting attitude from the cashier when you ask for something vegan. And then get a sandwich full of cream cheese. - You like getting told to, "relax, it's game day," when you're under time constraints and ask when something will be ready.  That pretty much sums up the experience of the group I was with. My egg and cheese sandwich was as blah as it gets - cold, bland scrambled eggs on white bread with a paper-thin slice of cheese.   This is probably a fun spot to watch the game, though.

dT16gKKj9ee9mXf7d3xcVA.review_text: Wow, this place took a serious nose dive. It used to have great food at slightly high prices, not it has crappy food at ridiculous prices. Skip it, there's plenty of better food around.

qGsxD1jBApPpn9eAps8ApQ.review_text: I was feeling rather peckish after an evening car crash on the 101 left me litigious and sore. My friend wanted dinner so we went nearby to brickhouse. The decor was nothing to write home about; in fact, it felt rather busy and was ultimately not ideal.   Warm fresh bread greeted us shortly after we made arrangements for the main course. This, paired with herb butter, delighted our tongues for minutes.   As our group discussed gender, sexual expectations in society, and fat Val Kilmer, I was treated to a tasty Halibut complete with wild rice and broccolini--the wild rice was bursting with flavor and delicious. I enjoyed sipping my anchor steam while surveying the crowd, noticing whimsically outloud "there are a lot of random folks here."  Other selections from our group:   The ravioli:Tasty, fresh and covered in browned sage butter.   The shrimp and grits: tasty but very spicy. A bit heavy for a full meal but great for leftovers.  The best part was the service: our friendly waitress was very hospitable and passed no judgment when we asked for more butter and to split the check 4 ways.   If only I was as wild as that rice. Until next time, Brickhouse.

Qq_fV6NFDnu7sKuScVS5Gg.review_text: I came here for happy hour and a subsequent dinner. Happy Hour is decent enough. It ends at 6pm and they have some good deals. Especially good is their "special of the day" which is just something they whip up and give to you at a special price. Around $4, I think. I do wish there was more seating for it though.   The burgers here are insane. I had a "tiny" burger, and I couldn't finish it. Apparently the tiny one's patty was half the size of the "normal" sized one. I am terrified to see the normal one. That said, it was good.

dko0sNmHUsg6bws6NLA9Qw.review_text: I used to come here a lot for lunch during the work week. They have good burgers, good beers, and have a quick system during the busy lunch rush. However, I had a really bad experience with their staff, thus 2 stars.   A group of us were enjoying some beers when our clumsy colleague knocked over a beer accidentally (not drunk). One of their staff, a surly, heavy-set woman came over as we were cleaning up the small spill and said, "you're all cut off". I get it, I've worked at a bar... if someone spills something, it's up to the staff to make the call, and they are well within their rights to say someone has had enough. The problem was that she was intensely rude. I asked to speak with her manager, and she rolled her eyes and said, "really?" Then she brought me her coworker, the bartender, who I'm pretty confident was not the manager, but her buddy, who was also not hearing me.   Cut us off - fine. Be rude to your repeat customers - not cool. Never going back.

GBpcE7mbKnK51Mrj8Tna7Q.review_text: Brickhouse was the Central Perk of my college years. After class, my friends and I would hang out here often, shooting the shit over a beer and a burger on the second floor. They have comfy seats up there that are great for studying and chatting.  The food is pretty good, but don't expect your socks to be knocked off. The burgers are reasonably juicy and tasty, with fries that are darn addicting. Come here if you want a laid-back atmosphere, with something decent to pop into your mouth (that sounds dirty).

iI5hC_uNUBGkkvtWrBIaZQ.review_text: Do I dare reveal the only good place to grab a pre-game drink and some garlic fries?  I was looking for a solid happy hour for the Giants v. Doyers evening game.  NO place has a happy hour in the ballpark area on home game days.  Red's is tiny and it was too damn cold to be outside.  Momo's was packed as usual.  Pedro's & Pete's Tavern & 21st Amendment did not have a happy hour.  Where should I go for a viable alternative?  So I walked 3 blocks to this beauty of a place.  Before being packed in a stadium with 44,000 other people, I recieved: 1. Immediate seating 2. Great service 3. $8 pitchers of PBR (they also have $11 pitchers of microbrews, $3 pints and wells).  Pints are $9.50 at the ballpark so you might as well "tailgate" here. 4. $4 garlic fries (as well as $2 off other bar food)  All this in a happy hour from 4:30-6:30pm is perfect for any evening game.  Go here, tell them I sent you, but don't tell anyone else and we'll keep this our little secret.

OnagJ2dnPjfRRT4a_CgKCw.review_text: After 3 months of living half a block away from this joint..I finally got to check it out last night. The atmosphere is very casual..in fact..quite noisy--perfect if you are with a party and a crying baby...  he food was solid.  The deep fried polenta was delicious...I wass totally bummed that they were sold out of the pork chops at 6:30pm on a Friday night..wtf? I settled for the half chicken...on a bed of polenta grits and asparagus. The chicken was nice and juicy.. I'll be back soon to check out their brunch.

O4wQaUeLxZDbUCCCvZ-5Dw.review_text: Brickhouse is a fitting name for this place. It's a solid choice you can rely on. I've gone for beer, for breakfast, for lunch (not in that order.) I'm a big fan of the egg sandwich for breakfast (the one in a bagel.) They recently changed their lunch menu around, so I'm not too sure what I like there anymore. A nice atmosphere, with decently private booths. Never too loud.

AMjCgcxM8bgpUbijeuHHRQ.review_text: Awesome big burgers! Great fries and amazing milk shakes!   Really busy at lunch time, but usually not so bad after 3...  Recommend their burgers!

Tx_5UQHUziZgQc6VKO0oqA.review_text: Brickhouse is a reliable neighborhood place for a sandwich or burger. They have wagyu/kobe beef burgers, which are pretty damn good. Their western bbq and soma burgers are also tasty.

vXrUBAIN4aoCt7F5p0kU_g.review_text: Seems like a place were a lot of men would like to go after work for Happy Hour with their dude friends.  It has a very rustic feel to the place.  Best part of eating here, is the bread and butter.  Mmmmm!  There is an upstairs area where you can sit when it get busy.  My guess is during the lunch rush?  Saw a family here with their baby in a stroller.  Who said a kid would stop you from going to a pub?  Not them.  I wasn't too hungry, so I ordered a side of polenta, which was pretty good.  My friend ordered the fries.  You can't really mess up fries.    Great place to use a bathroom, they have 2 private stalls.  Drink up and piss like a horse...as they say.

WpjLsGe2v9-g_cMdAOOLYA.review_text: Headline: Why the hell did the burger win an award?  The Brickhouse is your basic bar, with a few tables thrown in for the restaurant quality.  Expect all your favorite bar type things - quiet music, more than enough beer, and bar snacks.  We started with the Calimari.  I got to give the chef this - he likes garlic, and thats a good thing.  There was a very tasty dipping sauce that had a slight kick.  However, the calimari itself was overly salty and more than a little rubbery.  I ordered the Big Ass Burger - what they are noted for.  It says so right outside - award-winning, even.  However, the burger was boring.  Flat.  Tasteless.  How did they screw this up.  The garlic fries were very garlicky, but undercooked.  My dining partner ordered the pork chop.  This was very juicy and very sweet - almost teriyaki flavored.  It comes with polenta and asparagus, which looked kinda weedy.  There were grilled apples on top, which merely added to the sweetness.  Service was pretty well non-existent.  We got our orders in, the food came out, the check came.  Nothing else.  I did try to engage in my favorite game of "whats good here", but got met with "well everything", which really means nothing.  Overall, this was disappointing.  There are better american burger bar joints within two blocks of here.  It's on my avoid list.

a5bVNQAqI_oYrHq0oLMGkQ.review_text: I was there for brunch and had the salmon benedict! It was good! I would go there and have it again. Also burgers looked good too!  I enjoyed the space- there is an upstairs- and very bar foodish atmosphere and it is bar food, yes!:) haha!  l want to try all the greasy things on their menu.  w/ a beer of course! Good service, can get crowded. There was live music when i was there for brunch- so i enjoyed that as well. If you are sitting close by the kitchen, the view is not so great but manageable.

azivU1jkJhPSKS6ASMegQQ.review_text: I am really surprised this place doesn't have a better rating-Came here before the Giants game Saturday and I loved it.   Yes - it's small. Supply and Demand people.   Sounds like they have some awesome happy hour specials. We came in for breakfast and cocktails, had a delicious breakfast, although I had to ding them a start for bland breakfast potatoes, and for the service. We never went long without what we needed, but felt the service was awfully scattered, with waiters doing EVERYTHING for their tables. It seemed like a dedicated bartender would have been better, making drinks for all the tables and service those of us sitting at the bar as well, rather than a couple going without their check for 20 minutes because the server has to make a round of bloody Mary's.   But other than that, good food, good prices, pleasant experience, I can't wait to go back.

db3bPsPMLubIBlNVkTFX-Q.review_text: Pretty good fish and chips. My son had the rigatoni appetizer and it was cheesy goodness! The pitcher of beer was MORE than enough for two. Very homey place. Will come back! Nice to be close to CalTrain station and NOT pretentious.

1HDRP2A5hvg_JTkQMXU2YA.review_text: Ok ok ok ok. So (somewhat) like my ever so jerkish yet really good friend Abby A, I'm trynna not do the whole 3 star thing and live life on 2 extremes: either you got it, or you don't.  But BHC kinda rang it in there though, so Imma drop the fad for the moment and cave in JUST FOR THIS REVIEW..haha..maybe.   So the first time I went, there wasn't much of a crowd. I had the California Burger with a 'butt-load of fires' (i didn't name it..they did, PROMISE!) and the whole deal was real good! HOWEVER! This time? Not as great, but it was decent...not decent enough though to keep the stars intact.   First off, to the mad cute girl working the counter w/ the glasses..Hiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiii. You earned the spot 1/2 a star by ya lonesome..HAHAHAHHAHA. Ok, back to the foo-...huh? WHAAAAT!? she was cute! and she didn't act mad snobbish and do that "EW! Don't talk to me" kinda look when I said hii to her...BOOYOW OHH-NOW!   Ok, the food. So as of recently I've been on this super soup hype. I looooooooooove me some soup! And most places I go to now, I'll do a soup for beginners. So BHC wasn't no different, except that I wasn't entirely hungry, and a soup would suit me just well.   Jambalaya: Well I'll be a baldy at a toupee farm!! I went on ahead and got me some of that goood ol' Jam-buh-lie-uh! Too bad someone was a a LIE-UH (liar) and the soup wasn't JAMMIN so to speak. Mad salty, and the seasoning was lightweight off.   Grilled Panini: This saved the place! It was a cheese and veggie panini grilled to gee golly goodness! Indeed it saved the sucky soup!!   Backed it up with fries and a lemon iced tea, and it did OK for a lunch outing, though I shoulda just stayed and enjoyed Microsoft FREE FOOD! hahahhaha!   So by now you'll realize:  "Didn't he say he was gonna give it 3 stars? I see 2! Lijh is a LIAR!"   So?   HAHAHAH!   Done!

BdRMVROS1MXOHxr-bdZv0g.review_text: $3 MIMOSAS!! that in itself earns this place at least 2 stars. Not too crowded and easy parking access (meters around the street).  Definitely good comfort/american/brunch food.   Not a fancy place, but chill and welcoming.

lLptGOYUfQ-Ir47UYJv0dw.review_text: The Brickhouse cafe is one of modern and eclectic tastes. Upon walking into the cafe, one feels right at home. The decor is eclectic and unique. It's a cafe with the homey feel and also bar feel, in a cozy way. The number of times my boyfriend and I have come there has never been a wait, unless there was a Giants home game but the wait was never more then 10-15 minutes.   The food here is simple, tasteful and comforting. Their menu ranges from burgers to Classic American food such as pot pie, beef stroganoff, ravioli, roasted chicken, fish and chips, various salads and more. There is always something for everyone and you can't go wrong with simple food made well. The staff is always welcoming and attentive and service is quick.
