This place is a great option if you are seeking a good bite to eat before a Giants game they have specials for Giants games and their menu is creative with the Giants theme into their menu. The Giants menu focuses on specials on their bar food such as different burgers. They even offer a Wagu burger for $14 which is a great price and also flavorful, fatty, and delicious. This is one of the best that I have had in the city. I would recommend trying this burger above all the others.   Dinner- My favorite dish out of the whole menu is their pot pie. Their filling changes between chicken or turkey. The pie is made fresh when ordered, and comes piping hot to the table, with a side salad. The pie is flavorful, the filling is delicious and the crust is buttery and flakey. It comes it comes in a big serving so be prepared to be full!

dm7iWkk3q7RV9xbbs3IY_A.review_text: I went to Brickhouse for happy hour this Friday, and I really loved it.  Great food, good service, and pitchers of beer -- what more could I ask for?  The Fried Calamari and Garlic Fries are great appetizers, and a huge plus is that the Chipotle Aioli on the side is amazing.  It is just spicy enough, and I was glad it came with both dishes.  The Grilled Chicken and Brie sandwich is one of the best sandwiches I've had in a long time.  The apples add a lot of texture and flavor, and the brie is delicious!  And the sandwich goes along really well with the Tomato Bisque  It's a really cute restaurant, and I love places with great food and some character to match.  I would say it's definitely one of my favorite places in SOMA.

wclxUJiaMhyLSvdQ_QrggA.review_text: Tired of the ball park type of food?  Well, The Brick house Cafe is the place to stop before heading to the Giants game.  We were here last night to grab a bite before the game.  I am glad that we stepped in when we did because once we sat down and waited a bit before we got our menus, the crowd started to come.  This little cafe is very cute and unique.  It totally looks like a house in the inside.  Their appetizer plates are cute and unique.  It has different designs on it.  I just so happen to a picture that was sitting in front of me.  (See my pictures for reference)  What also caught my eye is when they brought the check out when we were done with dinner.  It was brought out in a pocket book.  Once again, very unique!.  So, here goes with my review about our drinks and food.  To start off, my bf and I both ordered an alcoholic drink.  He had the pomegranate margarita and I had the lemon drop.  The pomegranate margarita was pretty good, on the other hand, my lemon drop wasn't all that great, but the food made up for it.  I had the tomato bisque soup and the grilled chicken and Brie sandwich.  My bf had the Mexican burger.  The tomato soup was pretty good, I wished it was a bit on the hotter side.  The grilled chicken and Brie sandwich is to die for.  The chicken sits in between a foccaia bread spread ed with mayo pesto sauce with melted Brie cheese, a slice of apple and a slice of onion!  It was pretty awesome.  The sandwich also came with a side salad.  My bf said that his Mexican burger was pretty good.  It had a slice of melted cheese on the patty with avocado.  My bf said that burger patty had a kick to it because they put some jalapeno peppers in the meat.  We will be back ....hoping to try breakfast the next time.

J8vJ15GdQlkGT9BROQU25A.review_text: Great Food,very friendly staff, nice beer and drink menu, reasonable prices + happy hour/daily drink specials, super cute decor and super friendly staff.  Can't get much better than that!  Brickhouse is my go to neighborhood joint.  They do a great weekend brunch as well. I have not found anything I didn't like here.  I always take friends who are visiting here and I've never had a guest not leave happy.   Highly recommend! Thwy are closed around 10 on weekdays and Sunday nights.

Y3QU8Jj3lYuVa2LmunvnRg.review_text: Terrible grilled cheese and mediocre tomato soup.
